They have a 6mm driver with 3 mW of power and 16 ohms of impedance. The 230mAh battery provides 5 hours of playtime and 130 hours of standby time, with charging taking 1.5 hours.
description:
Remax SleepBuds Z2 Overview:

Design

SleepBuds Z2 are the only buds from Remax without the classic stem design. As you might already know, these buds are especially for wearing at night while sleeping, and they claim to be comfortable and lightweight.Additionally, the non-stem design follows along the silicone ear fins, offering you a secure fit plus comfort. SleepBuds Z2 even supports touch controls. Furthermore, these are available in three different colors: Black, Purple, and Beige.

Audio

As for audio, the buds house a 6mm driver each. These drivers are rated to have 3 mW of power and 16 ohms of impedance, providing frequencies as low as 20 Hz and as high as 20 kHz. Remax mentions having low latency, but there is no reference to the SleepBuds Z2 having ENC tech or such.

Battery

For battery life, the SleepBuds Z2 stays alive for 5 hours of playtime, all thanks to 30mAh cells on each bud. The 230mAh battery packed into the case increases its endurance a lot more; we're talking about 130 hours of standby time. Besides, charging takes 1.5 hours to go from null to full.

title: Lenovo Legion Slim 5 2024 (Ryzen 7 8845HS, RTX 4070, 16GB, 1TB, 16" WQXGA 165Hz)
short_description: Introducing the Lenovo Legion Slim 5 2024 (16IRX8) laptop: a sleek gaming powerhouse. With an aluminum build, 16\" WQXGA display, Ryzen 7 processor, and NVidIA RTX 4070 GPU, it offers top-notch performance. If you are looking for a laptop with an excellent display with powerful performance, check this out!
description:
Lenovo Legion Slim 5 2024  Overview

Heres a short description of the design aesthetic, chipset, and battery life of the Lenovo Legion Slim 5 2024 (16IRX8) laptop with Intel i7, RTX 4070, and 165Hz screen.

Design and Display 

Lenovo Legion Slim 5 2024 has the build of a gaming machine. It has an all-aluminium build and weighs a hefty 2.5 kilos. As for the ports, you get a lot— 2 USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-Cs (with DisplayPort1.4), 3 USB-A 3.2 Gen 1 ports, and a headphone port. Similarly, there is also an  HDMI 2.1, an RJ45 port, and a power-in socket.The Lenovo Legion Slim 5 2024 (16IRX8) comes with a wide 16" display of WQXGA (2560 x 1600) resolution with a high 165Hz refresh rate. It has a tall 16:10 aspect ratio as well. The keyboard has a custom 4 Zone RGB backlight, whereas the keycaps are black.

Performance and Memory

Alongside the smooth 165Hz screen, the Lenovo Legion Slim 5 2024 ensures smooth performance with the combination of Ryzen 7 8845HS and NVidIA RTX 4070. The Ryzen 7 8845HS processor has 8 cores and 16 threads. It has 16MB of L3 cache. It can also go up to 5.1 GHz of max clock speed. description:

Asus Vivobook 14 2024 (X1405VAP) Overview

Design and Display

The Asus Vivobook 14 2024 (X1405VAP) retains the signature design of the series, featuring the distinct brand name cutout on the lid. This model maintains a sleek profile, measuring just 1.79 cm thick and weighing less than one and a half kilograms. Under the hood, the Asus Vivobook 14 2024 (X1405VAP) is driven by the Intel Core 5 120U processor, paired with integrated Intel graphics. This processor boasts 10 cores, 12 threads, and a maximum clock speed of 5.0 GHz. Additionally, the GPU within this laptop offers a maximum graphics dynamic frequency of 1.4GHz.Furthermore, it comes equipped with 8GB of memory, expandable by another 8GB. Storage-wise, a 512GB SSD is included, with an additional slot supporting up to 1TB. Fueling the device is a built-in 42Wh lithium-ion battery, complemented by a 45W power adapter.

title: AQFiT W11
short_description: The Aqfit W11 is a rectangular watch with an IP68 rating and 5 ATM certification. It features a 4D curved screen with a 93% screen-to-body ratio and a 1.4-inch HD IPS touchscreen with a resolution of 320 x 320 pixels. The watch uses the latest NFR52832 Nordic chipset, boosting efficiency and reducing power consumption. It supports 15 sports modes, a music controller, weather forecasting, camera control, and smart notifications.
description:
AQFiT W11 Overview:

Design and Display

On the surface, the AQFiT W11 fits all the components inside a rectangular case measuring 47.5 x 55 x 12 mm. This has an IP68 rating added to the 5 ATM certification it comes with.Additionally, the watch boasts a 4D curved screen and a screen-to-body ratio of 93%. The W11 has a 1.4-inch HD IPS touchscreen display with 320x320 px resolution. Additionally, the five color options available are Black, Rose Gold, Olive Green, Plum, and Powder Blue.

Hardware

Inside, the W11 performs all the calculations using the latest NFR52832 Nordic chipset. Along with this comes a 40% efficiency boost and 50% less power consumption. This is followed by an ST LIS2DH12TR sensor for gravity sensor.

Features

On the flip side, the software has all the basic health-tracking features. From sleep monitoring to a pedometer, blood oxygen, and heart rate, the AQFiT W11 has you covered. In addition to that, the smartwatch also shows you the calorie count and water remainder. Besides, it also supports 15 different sports modes.Other than fitness, you also get a music controller with the watch. The W11 can also forecast weather, control the camera from a connected smartphone, and so much more. Even if the watch is lost, users can utilize the anti-lost feature to find its location.

Battery

With its 220 mAh battery cell, the AQFiT W11 offers a usage duration of up to 8 to 10 days of normal usage. If left on standby, this smartwatch ensures 2 months of charge.

description:

Design

And you have a USB, FM radio, and auxiliary port for wired input, as well as a microphone.

Battery

Powered by an 1800mAh battery, the Asta Wolf Retro offers 5–6 hours of playtime and has a standby time of 350 hours. Charging the device takes 2-3 hours through a Micro USB port with a power input of DC 5V (1A).

title: JBL Free X
short_description: The JBL Free X is a wireless earphone with an in-ear fit that is designed to survive drops of water with an IPX5 rating. It weighs around 99 grams and features a circular charging case with four LEDs for charging and two places for buds to rest. The audio is led by 5.6-mm drivers with an impedance of 16 ohms.
description:
JBL Free X Overview:

Design

The JBL Free X has an in-ear fit and an oval-ish non-stem base. It is designed to withstand occasional splashes of water with its IPX5 rating. In addition, the total weight you might have to carry around is around 99 grams, considering both the buds and the case.Speaking of which, the charging case is circular in shape. On opening, there are four LEDs to indicate charge and, obviously, two places for your buds to rest on. While the website only lists one color option (Blue), you can also find the JBL Free X available in White and Black variations.

Audio and Connectivity

Moving on to the audio, the forces on the JBL Free X are led by 5.6-mm drivers. These drivers have an impedance of 16 ohms, delivering the company's renowned Signature Sound.Nevertheless, the connection method is an older version in terms of connectivity. This uses Bluetooth 4.2 with essential profiles such as A2DP 1.3, AVRCP 1.5, and HFP 1.6. Furthermore, charging is handled through the micro USB port.

Battery

For the earpieces, 85 mAh batteries fuel the Free X. The number may seem huge, but each battery lasts only for four hours for both music and calls. The 1500 mAh battery in the case is enough to provide you with another 20 hours of playtime. The case itself can be fully charged within just two hours, thanks to the micro USB.

title: boAt Enigma X700

It has sports and health tracking features like heart rate measurement, blood oxygen level, sleep tracking, calorie monitoring, and over 100 sports modes. description:
Are you tired of all the smartwatches with the rubber straps in the market? Are you looking for something with premium looks? Something elegant perhaps? Then the boAt Enigma X700 might just be what you are looking for!

boAt Enigma X700 Overview

Design and Display

The boAt Enigma X700 comes with a metal case and a metal strap as well. The case features two buttons and a crown with the company logo on the right. This watch weighs around 140 grams which is significantly higher than boAt's other offerings. However, it is to be expected given the metal build of the watch.On the front, we are getting a 1.52-inch display with an AMOLED panel. It has a resolution of 466 x 466 pixels and is capable of achieving a peak brightness of over 600 nits. Moreover, it offers an always-on-display feature. The boAt Enigma X700 boasts an IP67 water and dust resistance. It comes in three colour options: Copper Black, Copper Blue, and Silver Chrome. The earlier two options have a dual-colour tone, while the latter one is a single tone.

Features and the rest

The boAt Enigma X700 comes with all the standard smartwatch features. This includes heart rate monitoring, blood oxygen monitoring, sleep monitoring, guided breathing, daily activity tracker, and so on. Additionally, it offers over 100 watch faces, and sports modes for fitness tracking.Powering this smartwatch is a 390 mAh battery that offers up to 7 days of typical usage. You can charge the boAt Enigma X700 with the magnetic charger that comes in the box. It comes with Bluetooth v5.3 and we can make and receive calls through it straight from the watch. This smartwatch also allows you to utilise the voice assistant of your phone. It is compatible with devices running on Android 8.0 or iOS 12.0 or later. You can customise your watch further with the boAt wearables app.

title: Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 (Ryzen 9 5900HS, RTX 3050 Ti, 16GB, 1TB, 13.4" WUXGA 120Hz)
short_description: Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 (GV301QE) is a convertible gaming laptop with a sleek build. It has a touchscreen on the front measuring 13.4 inches and WQUXGA in resolution. Additionally, the display has an adaptive refresh rate of up to 120Hz as well as a decent colour gamut. The performance side is pretty stacked too with AMD Ryzen 9 5900HS CPU and NVidIA RTX 3050 Ti GPU combo. One of the unique features of this laptop is, you can plug in a mobile graphics card into it called the ROG XG Mobile. Other than that, you it has 16GB onboard memory, 1TB PCIe Gen 3 SSD, and 62Wh battery.
description:
Are you looking for a gaming laptop that comes with a powerful set of hardware? Then the Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 with Ryzen 9 5900HS processor and RTX 3050 Ti dedicated graphics card might just be what you are looking for!

Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 (GV301QE) Overview

Design and Display

The Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 (GV301QE) is a unique specimen as it is a gaming laptop, but convertible. This means the laptop has a fully rotating hinge that expands the landscape of how you can use the device. The lid has a carbon fibre-like pattern and has a sleek overall build. In terms of ports, it has a combo audio jack, an HDMI, one USB-A port, one ROG XG Mobile Interface port, and two USB-Cs.On the front, you have a 13.4-inch IPS display with WQUXGA resolution. It comes with touch support and has Corning Gorilla Glass protection atop. Additionally, you get up to 120Hz refresh rate on the Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 (GV301QE) along with Adaptive Sync. The screen has a fair vibrancy to it with 116% sRGB, 86% Adobe, and 85% DCI-P3 colour gamuts.

Performance

The combined power of AMD Ryzen 9 5900HS processor and NVidIA GeForce RTX 3050 Ti GPU drive the performance on the Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 (GV301QE). The CPU has eight cores, 16 threads, 20MB of cache, and a peak clock speed of 4.6GHz. Similarly, the dedicated graphics on this thing have 4GB GDDR6 VRAM and can offer a boost frequency of 1,135 MHz at up to 40W TGP.If the default graphic power of the laptop is insufficient, you can plug the ROG XG Mobile into this laptop. It is a portable graphics card with up to a GeForce RTX 3080 with 1,810 MHz at 150W TGP. Other than that, the Asus ROG Flow X13 2021 (GV301QE) comes with 16GB LPDDR4X onboard RAM. Meanwhile, you get 1TB M.2 2230 NVMe PCIe Gen 3 SSD as the storage. Given that it is a convertible laptop, it is likely unupgradable. Lastly for power, it packs a four-cell 62Wh battery and is coupled with a 100W Type-C charger in the box.

title: boAt Airdopes Flex 454 ANC
short_description: The boAt Airdopes Flex 454 ANC are in-ear earbuds with a shorter stem and a glossy case with a matte body. They come with active noise cancellation and 10mm drivers, with adaptive EQ powered by Mimi. The earbuds also have \"Beast Mode\" and \"boAt SmartTalk\" for voice prompts, in-ear detection, and multipoint connectivity. The batteries last around 60 hours of playback, with 45 hours of playtime even with the ANC turned on. They can be recharged within 10 minutes using the boAt Hearables app.
description:
boAt Airdopes Flex 454 ANC Overview:

Design

The boAt Airdopes Flex 454 ANC (a pretty long name to say) are in-ear earbuds with a shorter stem. The design is nothing extraordinary or anything. On the color side of things, you get only two typical choices: Gunmetal Black and Zinc White.On the flip side, Flex 454 ANC has a case with a glossy lid and a matte body. The case itself doesn't have any IP rating, but the buds inside are IPX5-rated.

Audio

For audio, the Airdopes Flex 454 with ANC obviously comes with active noise cancellation. According to boAt, they are releasing "Flagship-Level" ANC on these budget wireless earphones, which can cancel up to 32 dB of loudness.Getting back to actual audio quality itself, the Flex 454 has 10mm drivers. These earbuds ship with adaptive EQ powered by Mimi, which takes different factors into consideration to tune audio according to your ear's sensitivity.

Features

The Airdopes Flex 454 ANC delivers with “Beast Mode” decreasing latency to 60ms. This also features “boAt SmartTalk”, allowing you to “Accept” or “Reject” a call using voice prompts. Plus, this supports in-ear detection and multipoint connectivity. Customizing via the boAt Hearables App is another one of those features you won't easily get at the price range.

Battery

Moving on to the batteries, the endurance mentioned in Airdopes Flex 454 ANC is quite promising. In total, the buds and the case combined can last you around 60 hours of playback. Even with the ANC turned on, 45 hours of playtime sounds interesting. And thanks to ASAP charging, 4 hours' worth of playback is recharged within just 10 minutes of plugging it in.

title: Bose SoundLink Flex
short_description: Bose, an audio company known for its headphones, released SoundLink Flex. It is a rugged speaker, making it resistant to rust and UV light, and it has an IP67 rating. It weighs 590 grams and features PositionIQ for better audio, an echo reduction algorithm, and a built-in microphone for calls. Connectivity options include Bluetooth 4.2, party mode, and stereo mode, and can be customized using the Bose Connect App. The speaker can last up to 10 meters away and charges with a single 12-hour charge or a USB-C charge.
description:
Bose SoundLink Flex Overview:

Design

Bose SoundLink Flex features a rugged design that's resistant to rust and UV light. That's mostly due to the materials used here: powder-coated steel for the grill and silicone for the exterior. Additionally, it weighs nearly 590 grams, which makes it easier to carry around.Another feature that makes SoundLink Flex safe to carry around is the IP67 rating so that no water can harm the speaker unless you are going for a deep swim. While the upper section has all the buttons for controls, the right side has a loop for your fingers to hold onto the speaker. Moreover, there are multiple color options, including Black, Carmine Red, Green, Stone Blue, and White Smoke.

Audio and Connectivity

With PositionIQ, SoundLink Flex claims to adjust according to its orientation to make audio better. There is an echo reduction algorithm to make your listening better. Furthermore, the speaker has a built-in microphone for calls.As for connectivity, you get an older Bluetooth 4.2. The connection can last up to about 10 meters away from the device. Besides, there is party mode and stereo mode support if you have two of the speakers. The SoundLink Flex can also be customized using the Bose Connect App.

Battery

Bose SoundLink Flex fuels for 12 hours of playtime on a single charge. Additionally, the USB-C charges the device within 4 hours.

title: Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2021 (Ryzen 7 5800H, RTX 3070, 16GB, 1TB, 16" WQXGA 165Hz)
short_description: Legion 5 Pro is the best gaming laptop that Lenovo has to offer. The 2021 iteration of the laptop brings an all-aluminum design, Ryzen 5000-series CPUs, and RTX 30-series GPUs. The CPU-GPU combo is paired with Lenovo's in-house cooling solution and AI Engine to maximize fps in games.
description:
Lenovo Legion 5 Pro (2021) Overview:

Design, Display

Legion Lenovo 5 Pro features an all-aluminum chassis, differentiating it from the vanilla Legion 5. Another way to distinguish the two is by looking at the Legion "Y" branding on the lid. Based on the color variant, it will glow either blue or white on the Legion 5 Pro. Further, the thickness of the laptop ranges from 21.7 to 26.85 mm. Likewise, the weight is listed at 2.45 kg.Opening the lid, you are greeted with a 16" IPS screen with a 165Hz refresh rate. It even has support for both AMD's Free-Sync and NVidIA's G-Sync. Lenovo claims the peak brightness to be 500 nits while the laptop is certified for DisplayHDR 400. In addition, Lenovo Legion 5 Pro boasts 100% sRGB coverage, 178° viewing angle, and DC Dimming.

Performance

In terms of performance, the 2021 iteration of the Lenovo Legion 5 Pro brings AMD's Ryzen 5000-series CPUs, together with NVidIA RTX 30-series GPU. Here, users can choose between Ryzen 5 5600H and Ryzen 7 5800H. The latter boast higher clock/thread count and clock speeds. On the GPU front, you can either get the RTX 3060 to the RTX 3070.Lenovo has deployed in-house Legion Coldfront 3.0 thermals and Legion AI Engine to provide the maximum possible fps.Lenovo Legion 5 Pro features two SO-DIMM RAM slots that you can configure with up to 32GB of DDR4 RAM. Likewise, you get two M.2 SSD slots. Users can configure the M.2 2280 slot with up to 1TB storage, while the remaining M.2 2242 slot caps at 512GB.

Others

title: Dell XPS 13 Plus 2022 (12th Gen i7-1260P, 16GB, 512GB, 13.4" 3.5K Touch OLED)
short_description: Dell XPS is a high-end ultraportable notebook series with a striking design. The XPS 13 Plus (9320) has a 13.4-inch QHD touchscreen with a 16:10 aspect ratio. This is also an OLED display with a 3.5K aspect ratio and a DCI-P3 color gamut of 90%. Powering it is a considerably faster 12th Gen Intel P-series processor and Xe graphics, as well as up to 16GB of LPDDR5 RAM and 1TB of SSD. As a result, it will undoubtedly serve you well in your day-to-day chores. Similarly, the XPS 13 offers Thunderbolt connectors and WiFi 6 compatibility for faster communication.
description:
The Dell XPS 13 Plus 2022 (9320) is a premium laptop that offers a sleek design, powerful performance, and a stunning display. In this blog post, let's talk about some of the key features and specifications of this laptop and why you might want to consider it for your next purchase.

Dell XPS 13 Plus 9320 (2022) Overview:

Design and Build Quality

The Dell XPS 13 Plus 2022 has a minimalist and elegant design. The laptop has a platinum or graphite color option and a durable aluminum chassis resistant to scratches and fingerprints. Also, the carbon fiber palm rest is soft and comfortable. The laptop weighs only 1.2 kg and has a thin profile of 14.8 mm, making it easy to carry around.It features a backlit keyboard and a fingerprint reader integrated into the power button for quick and secure login. The laptop has two Thunderbolt 4 ports that support power delivery, data transfer, and display output, as well as a USB-C to USB-A adapter.

Display and Audio

The Dell XPS 13 Plus 9320 has a stunning display that is one of its main selling points. The laptop has a 13.4-inch screen with four different options: FHD+ non-touch, FHD+ touch, 3.5K OLED touch, or UHD+ touch. All of these options have an InfinityEdge design that minimizes the bezels and maximizes the screen-to-body ratio. The display also has an anti-glare or anti-reflect coating that reduces reflections and eye strain.The display quality varies depending on your chosen option, but all of them have high brightness, contrast, color accuracy, and viewing angles. The FHD+ options have a resolution of 1920 x 1200 pixels and a refresh rate of 60 Hz, while the 3.5K OLED option has a resolution of 3456 x 2160 pixels and a refresh rate of 60 Hz. The UHD+ option has a resolution of 3840 x 2400 pixels and a refresh rate of 60 Hz.The laptop also has a dual speaker system that delivers clear and loud sound. The speakers are tuned by Waves MaxxAudio Pro and support Dolby Vision for an enhanced audio-visual experience. Accompanying it is a dual microphone array that supports noise cancellation and voice recognition.

Performance and Battery Life

This particular model laptop has the 12th Gen Intel Core i7-1260P CPU with 12 cores, 16 threads, 18 MB cache, and 4.7 GHz turbo frequency.As for the memory and storage, you get 16GB LPDDR5 RAM that runs at 5200MHz and 512GB of SSD storage. The laptop also has an integrated Intel Iris Xe graphics card for casual gaming and graphics tasks. The laptop also supports Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 5.2 for fast and stable wireless connectivity.The Dell XPS 13 Plus 9320 2022 comes with a 56 Wh battery that supports fast charging via the Thunderbolt 4 port.

title: Lenovo V14 G4 (13th Gen Intel Core i5-1335U, 8GB, 512GB, 14" FHD)
short_description: Lenovo V14 G4 is an affordable offering targeted at businesses and business individuals. The performance of this laptop is handled by 13th Gen Intel Core i5-1335U, 8GB RAM, and 512GB SSD. The memory and storage can be upgraded to exactly double the capacity. For power, it comes with a 45Wh battery and a 65W charger. The display on this thing isnt great as it is a TN panel. Regardless, it is a 14-inch unit with FHD resolution, standard refresh rate, 45% NTSC colour gamut, and 250 nits peak brightness.
description:
Are you looking for an affordable laptop that does not compromise much on performance? Then you might want to take a look at the Lenovo V14 G4 with 13th Gen Intel Core i5-1335U processor.

Lenovo V14 G4 (IRU) Overview

Design and Display 

Lenovo V14 G4 (IRU) comes in a sleek and subtle design. The laptop does not have any fancy patterns or gradients going on. It keeps it rather simple with a monotone finish. It is available in Business Black, and Iron Grey colours. However, only the former is available in Nepal. The thing weighs just 1.43 kilos and is quite portable. For ports, it has two USB-A, one USB-C, an HDMI, one combo headphone jack, as well as an ethernet port.The Lenovo V14 G4 (IRU) comes with a 14-inch display of FHD (1,920 x 1,080) resolution with a standard 60Hz refresh rate. Furthermore, there are two display choices IPS and TN. The one available in Nepal is the latter one, which is the poorer option between the two. It can go 250 nits in brightness, covers 45% NTSC colour gamut, and offers a 500:1 contrast ratio. The viewing angles are pretty bad with 45° on either side, 35° from down, and just 15° from up.

Performance

Under the helm, this Lenovo V14 G4 (IRU) variant has a 13th Gen Intel Core i5-1335U processor. You can configure this laptop with other Intel and AMD silicon. They are available in Nepal as well. Regardless, this particular silicon has 10 cores, and 12 threads, and reaches a peak clock speed of 4.6GHz. Meanwhile, the integrated Intel Iris Xe handles the graphics side of things.Other than that, it comes with 8GB memory out of the box. It is soldered onto the board. However, the Lenovo V14 G4 (IRU) has dual-channel DDR4-3200 RAM support of up to 16GB. This means you can pop in an extra 8GB of memory whenever you require. For storage, it comes with a 512GB NVMe PCIe 4.0 SSD, which can be doubled when you run out of space. Given that, this laptop offers a decent upgradability unit allowing you to future-proof it.

title: HiFuture Sound Mini
short_description: The HiFuture Sound Mini is a budget-friendly speaker with a circular design, curved top, and flat bottom. It is made of plastic and features a speaker grille covered with fabrics. The speaker is IPX4 water-resistant, but its plastic construction is prone to smudges. It has a 40mm full-range driver, 5W RMS output, and supports two codecs. The speaker also has Bluetooth 5.0 and supports stereo output. The speaker has an 1800mAh battery, providing around 12 hours of playback.
description:
HiFuture Sound Mini Overview:

Design

The HiFuture Sound Mini is a portable speaker with dimensions of 98 x 98 x 47.5mm and a weight of 170 grams. It is available in a black color option and features a circular design with a curved top and flat bottom, a little like a chocopie but flat. Additionally, the speaker's body is primarily constructed of plastic and includes a speaker grille covered with fabrics on the top. A thin LED stripe below the grille adds minimal aesthetic value. The plastic construction is prone to smudges, though. However, the Sound Mini from HiFuture is IPX4 water-resistant, providing some protection against minor water splashes.

Audio and Connectivity

The audio features a 40mm full-range driver, delivering an output of 5W RMS power. Further, Sound Mini has a frequency response range of 100Hz to 20kHz. There are two codecs supported here: SBC and CVSD. Moreover, an omnidirectional microphone is provided here for calling and voice assistance.In terms of connectivity, the HiFuture Sound Mini is equipped with Bluetooth 5.0. The speaker supports stereo output, and users can pair two Sound Mini speakers for this effect. The controls, located at the bottom of the speaker, include buttons for power, volume adjustment, pairing, and activating the voice assistant.

Battery

Likewise, Sound Mini houses an 1800mAh battery, providing around 12 hours of playback on average. The Type-C charging port accepts 5W DC input, and the speaker takes approximately 3 hours and 30 minutes to charge from 0 to 100%.

title: Infinix GT 20 Pro
short_description: Introducing the Infinix GT 20 Pro, the ultimate gaming phone for exceptional performance. Featuring a MediaTek Dimensity 8200 Ultimate SoC, up to 12GB of RAM, and a 144Hz 6.78-inch AMOLED display, it’s built for serious gaming. The phone includes a 108MP main camera, a 32MP front camera, and a 5,000mAh battery with 45W fast charging. Additional features: JBL dual speakers, in-display fingerprint scanner, and 5G connectivity. If youre a gamer, this might be the best phone for you at this price.
description:
Here is a thorough overview of Infinix GT 20 Pro; its features and specifications including design and display, performance, memory, battery, camera, and others.

Infinix GT 20 Pro Overview

Performance

The Infinix GT 20 Pro packs a Mediatek Dimensity 8200 Ultimate SoC under the hood. This upper midrange 5G chip boasts four Cortex-A55 cores running at 2 GHz, three Cortex-A78 cores clocking at 3 GHz, and a primary Cortex-A78 core at 3.10 GHz. With Pixelworks X5 Turbo display gaming processor for frame rate optimizations and up to 12GB of RAM, it seems ready for some serious gaming actions.Likewise, booting the smartphone is Infinix’s XOS 14 built on top of Android 14. Infinix promises two major Android updates and three years of security patch updates.
  • Read our Infinix GT 20 Pro review here

Design and Display

Talking of the design, this guy goes for a gaming vibe just like its predecessor. The rear side houses a semi-transparent finish, slightly identical to Nothing Phone 2. You also get a curved LED strip that is customizable for notifications, charging indicators, notifications, and such.As for the display, it sports a 6.78-inch AMOLED panel with a 144Hz fast refresh rate. This FHD+ res display boasts a 2340Hz PWM dimming, 1300nits of peak brightness, and a DCI-P3 color gamut. Plus, you also get an in-display fingerprint scanner for biometrics security.

Camera

In terms of camera, the Gt 20 Pro houses a triple camera setup. You get a 108MP primary shooter with OIS alongside a 2MP depth and a 2MP macro combo. Upfront, there is a 32MP snapper for clicking selfies and making video calls

Battery, Charging, and Others

Fueling the gaming phone is a 5,000mAh battery with 45W wired fast charging support. It also supports Bypass charging and Hyper Charge mode. As for the connectivity, the phone will support 5G, WiFi 6, Bluetooth, NFC, GPS, and a USB Type-C port. Other features of this gaming phone include JBL dual speakers and an x-axis linear motor for in-game vibration.

Asus TUF Dash F15 (2022): Overview

Here's a brief description of the Asus TUF Dash F15 (2022) with 12th Gen Intel Core i7 processor and NVidIA RTX 3050 graphics with deeper dive into design aesthetic, chipset, and port selection.

Display and Build

The TUF Dash F15 (2022) sports a 15.6" 144Hz IPS Panel. The screen has an FHD resolution of 1920 x 1080 and covers 62.5% of the sRGB color gamut. On top of that, it has Adaptive-Sync and a MUX switch. The laptop weighs exactly 2 kilograms and is 354mm wide, 251mm deep, and 20.7mm high.

Battery and Connectivity

In the tank of the TUF Dash F15, you will find a 76W Lithium Ion battery. It can be charged via the 180W adapter in the box.In terms of port selection, you get 2 USB Type-A ports, one USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C port, a Thunderbolt 4 port, an HDMI slot, an RJ45 LAN port, and a headphone jack. description:
Wings Phantom 860 Overview:

Design

The Wings Phantom 860 bears an in-ear design. These buds have green lighting with only one color option: Black. Additionally, the LED lights follow the case. You even get an IPX5 rating. Also, there are touch control gestures supported on the stems.However, the case doesn't have an IP rating. Additionally, it also has those green LEDs. On top of that, the "Open and On" Technology automatically turns on the buds and connects to your smartphone when the case lid is open.

Audio

On the audio front, the Phantom 860 boasts 10 mm high-fidelity composite drivers with an impedance of 32 ohms. Further, the quad-mic setup, two on each of the earbuds, cancels the ambient noises during calls, paired with the ENC. And you can't forget about the game mode with 40 ms of low latency.

Rest of the specs

The Wings Phantom 860 earbuds offer approximately 10 hours of playback time on their own, with an additional 40 hours of battery life provided by the charging case. This totals up to a combined usage of 50 hours. The earbuds can be fully charged in 1.5 hours if completely depleted while charging only the buds takes around an hour.In addition, the device utilizes Bluetooth 5.3 for connectivity and employs USB-C for charging via cable. The wireless earphones also have Wings Sync app support.

description:
If you are looking for a powerful and portable laptop, you might want to consider the Dell Inspiron 14 5420 (2022) with NVidIA GeForce MX570 graphics.

Dell Inspiron 14 5420 (2022) Overview:

Performance

This laptop features a 12th Gen Intel Core i7-1255U processor, which has 10 cores and 12 threads and can boost up to 4.70 GHz. This means you can handle multitasking, productivity, and entertainment with ease. It is contemplated by an NVidIA MX570 GPU.The ultrabook also comes with 16GB of RAM and a 1TB SSD, which provide fast performance and ample storage space for your files and programs. You can enjoy a smooth and responsive experience, whether you are working on a document, browsing the web, or streaming a video.

Display and Design

One of the highlights of the Dell Inspiron 14 5420 2022 is its 14-inch WVA display. This FHD+ panel has a resolution of 1920 x 1200 and a 16:10 aspect ratio. This gives you more vertical screen space and less scrolling, which is ideal for reading, writing, and viewing content. The display also has an anti-glare coating and a ComfortView feature, which reduce eye strain and enhance your comfort.The Dell Inspiron 14 5420 has a sleek and sturdy design. It comes with an aluminum exterior shell and a platinum silver color. Weighing only 1.54 kg (3.40 lbs), the thickness is 19 mm (0.75 in), making it easy to carry around. It also has a backlit keyboard, a precision touchpad, and a fingerprint reader for convenience and security.

Battery, Ports, and Connectivity

Fueling the ultrabook is a 4-cell 54Wh battery with 65W charging support. It also has a range of ports and slots to connect your devices and accessories. It has two USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A ports, one USB 3.2 Gen 2x1 Type-C port with Power Delivery and DisplayPort, one audio jack, one HDMI 1.4 port, one power adapter port, and one SD-card slot. For wireless connectivity, there is an Intel Wi-Fi 6E AX211 wireless card and Bluetooth 5.2.

title: Mivi DuoPods M20
short_description: Mivi is an audio product manufacturer from India. They've released a slew of TWSs known as DuoPods. The DuoPods M20 is the cheapest one available in Nepal. description:
Mivi DuoPods M20 Overview:

Let's get into the specifics of the Mivi DuoPods M20 TWS.

Design

The DuoPods M20 is a stemless in-ear wireless earphone with pocketable packaging. The buds weigh only 3.5 g, and the charging case is 35 g, so the product is lightweight. Talking about the case, it is rectangle-ish in shape with oval corners. Even at this price range, Mivi offers a water and sweat protection certification of IPX5. Audio

Producing the sound in the Mivi DuoPods M20 is a 6-mm dynamic driver.  Here, the company has stated that AptX is supported on their website, but the latency does not appear to be reduced. Additionally, it can generate frequencies ranging from 20 Hz to 20 kHz. Since there is no environmental noise cancellation, your voice may not be as clear during calls.

Rest of the specs

Batteries last no more than 6 hours in the DuoPods M20. With the charging case, that playtime increases to 30 hours. Furthermore, these buds charge in under an hour, and the case's battery recharge in 2–3 hours. The case also contains a Type-C charging cable and Bluetooth 5.0.

title: Mivi DuoPods M30
short_description: Mivi released another budget TWS, continuing the M series with the DuoPods M30. It improvizes on different aspects such as drivers, design components, battery, and microphone than the M20, its predecessor.

Mivi DuoPods M30 Overview:

Let's dive into the specifications of the Mivi DuoPods M30 TWS.

Design

For the design of the earbuds, Mivi DuoPods M30 has gone with a somewhat similar design to its predecessor, M20. It is an in-ear fit with no stem and a matte finish. Plus, the earbuds support audio codecs like SBC and AAC. Each earpiece uses a MEMS microphone to deliver clear audio to the receiver during calls.

Rest of the specs

Powering the DuoPods M30 is a 35 mAh battery. Additionally, the charging capsule gives a combined playtime of 42 hours with a 380 mAh battery. Other than that, both the earbuds and the case charge in about 1 hour with a USB-C port. And Bluetooth 5.1 connects with any device within 10 meters of range.

short_description: This Dell G5 gaming laptop is equipped with a 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12500H CPU and Nvidia RTX 3050 graphics. Memory options include 16GB of DDR4 RAM and 512GB of SSD. description:
If you're looking for a capable gaming laptop that can handle 1080p gaming at high settings, you might want to check out the Dell G15 5520 with Intel Core i5-12500H and RTX 3050.

Performance

This laptop packs a 12th Gen Intel Core i5-12500H processor and an NVidIA GeForce RTX 3050 GPU, which deliver strong performance for most games. The chip is paired with 16GB of RAM and a 512GB SSD, which are enough for multitasking and storing your games. You can also upgrade the memory and storage yourself, as they are user-replaceable.The laptop has a decent selection of ports, including three USB-A, one USB-C, an HDMI 2.1, an Ethernet, and a headphone jack. The USB-C port supports video output but not charging or Thunderbolt 4.

Design and Display

The Dell G15 5520 2022 comes in three color options: Dark Shadow Gray, Obsidian Black Special Edition, and Specter Green with Camouflage. The laptop has a plastic chassis with a textured lid that features the Dell logo and a vent for airflow. It is on a thick and heavy profile, measuring 1.1 inches in height and weighing 2.57 kg. Hence, it may not be the most portable or sleek device, but it feels sturdy and durable.You get a full-size keyboard with a numeric keypad and a G-key for quick access to gaming functions. The keyboard is backlit with either orange or RGB lighting, depending on the color choice.The laptop has a 15.6-inch display with various resolutions and refresh rate options. You can choose between an FHD (1920 x 1080) 120Hz, an FHD 165Hz, and a QHD (2560 x 1440) 240Hz panel. This particular model has an FHD panel with 120Hz. The higher refresh rates are ideal for smooth gaming, while the QHD option offers sharper visuals.

Battery and Others

The Dell G15 (2022) gets its juice from a 56Wh battery with 180W charging support. Talking of ports, it has got a decent selection, including three USB-A 3.2 Gen 1 ports, one USB-C port with DisplayPort alt mode, an HDMI 2.1 port, an Ethernet port, a headphone jack, and a power port.The USB-C port supports video output but not charging or Thunderbolt 4. The laptop also has an HD webcam with dual microphones and stereo speakers with Nahimic audio software.

title: HiFuture Olymbuds 2
short_description: The HiFuture Olymbuds 2 are lightweight, stemless in-ear headphones, with the main highlight being an LED display on the case that shows battery percentage. description:
HiFuture Olymbuds 2 Overview:

Design

The major highlight of HiFuture Olymbuds 2 is seen as soon as you open the box. Aside from the charging cable and ear tips, you are met with a vertical, curvy case that features an LED display on unboxing. This LED display shows the battery percentage of the case, and that's it.On further opening the case, you get two extremely lightweight earpieces. "How lightweight?" you may ask. Only 3.8 grams per bud! Deep diving, the Olymbuds 2 are in-ear buds with a stemless design. And when it comes to water protection, they are certified as IPX5-rated buds. Additionally, there are two color options—Black and Blue.

Audio and Connectivity

Powering the music in Olymbuds 2 are the dynamic drivers of unknown diameter and the ultra-sensitive polymeric diaphragm. These drivers produce a Graphite Inspired Sound, according to the company. According to them:
Thanks to the perfect amalgamation of high magnetic density and superior stability provided by this driver, the OlymBuds2 delivers a perfect bass and provides impressive sound quality.
Moreover, the TWS ships with Bluetooth 5.3 with the SBC codec for connection. The "Hail Sensor" allows you to get connected with a single flip-up of your charging cases.

Battery

Other than that, the 40 mAh battery packed in the Olymbuds 2 is decent enough to last 6 hours or a 4-hour call. The 300 mAh cell within the case adds another 30 hours of charge, making it last for a day and a half.

title: Lenovo ThinkPad L14 Gen 3 2022 (12th Gen i7 1255U, 16GB, 512GB, 14" FHD)
short_description: The ThinkPad L14 series of laptops are business devices with compact form factors and security integrations. Lenovo ThinkPad L14 Gen 3 is an ultralight device with an efficient CPU meant for work-from-anywhere (WFA). The laptop is easy to carry coming in at just around 1.4 kg and is powered by Intel 12th-gen i7-1255U, complemented by 16GB of DDR4 RAM and 512GB SSD.
description:
Lenovo ThinkPad L14 Gen 3 (2022): Overview

Here's a brief description of the build, chipset, and the battery life of the Lenovo ThinkPad L14 Gen 3 2022 with the i7 processor.

Design and Build 

ThinkPad L14 has an all-plastic build featuring ABS plastic top and bottom. It has a 14" FHD display with 45% NTSC coverage. The L14 features an LED backlit keyboard, a Windows Precision touchPad, and a familiar Trackpoint. It is light at just 1.39 kg or about 3.06 pounds. It is 325mm in width, 217mm deep, and has a height of 19.8mm.

Performance and Memory

Lenovo ThinkPad L14 Gen 3 (2022) is powered by Intel's 12th gen Core i7-1255U processor. It has 10 Cores and 12 Threads. The chip has a base frequency of 3.5 GHz and a max boost frequency of 4.7 GHz.The graphics part is handled by the Intel Iris Xe Graphics. Lenovo ThinkPad L14 comes with 16GB of dual-channel DDR4 RAM. There are 2 SO-DIMM slots where you can add up to a 32GB stick each. Thus ThinkPad L14 can have a maximum of 64GB RAM. You get 512GB SSD with Opal 2.0 security on purchase, which can be further expanded to 1 TB.

Battery and Connectivity

What powers the machine is a 57Wh Li-Po battery. It comes with a 65W power adapter in the box.As for connectivity, you get a USB-C 3.2 Gen1 port and a USB 4 (Thunderbolt 4) port that supports data transfer, Power Delivery 3.0, and DisplayPort 1.4. You also get 2 USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A ports, 1 HDMI port, and an Ethernet port. A 3.5mm headphone/microphone jack is also present alongside a card reader slot. On the wireless side of things, you get WiFi 6 and Bluetooth 5.1.

title: Anker Soundcore Liberty 3 Pro
short_description: The Anker Soundcore Liberty 3 Pro is a pretty huge upgrade from its predecessor. It has a triple-point ergonomic shape plus a built-in structure that relieves air pressure for a comfortable fit. It features dual coaxial drivers along with Anker’s ACAA 2.0. It also supports Sony’s proprietary LDAC technology, Hearid, and 3D surround sound. The six microphones on each of the buds help with the ANC, and along with the AI-Uplink Noise Reduction algorithm, they filter out unnecessary sounds during the call.
description:
Anker Soundcore Liberty 3 Pro Overview:

Design

Anker Soundcore Liberty 3 Pro, even though a pretty large name, has a smaller design than its predecessor. The buds get a triple-point ergonomic shape plus a built-in structure that relieves air pressure for a comfortable fit. Additionally, these also come with four liquid silicone ear tips and a pair of ear wings, hence no compromises are made in the convenience aspect.Moreover, an IPX4 water-resistance rating is provided. And the color options are four in number: Fog Gray, Midnight Black, Dusk Purple, and Frost White.

Audio

On the audio end, the Liberty 3 Pro features dual co-axial drivers (one of which is 10.6 mm) along with Anker’s ACAA 2.0. This Astria Coaxial Acoustic Architecture (ACAA) 2.0 promises to deliver precise, harmonious sound with greater details.This is a massive upgrade from Liberty 2 Pro, its predecessor. For comparison, the treble is boosted by 460%, the mids are enhanced by 150%, and the bass is powerful as claimed by the company. This exhibits an "ultra-wide and immersive soundstage."Also, this beast of a TWS supports Sony’s proprietary LDAC technology, which allows for a Hi-Res Audio Wireless-certified listening experience. Similarly, it also provides Hearid, allowing users to personalize the listening experience according to their needs. Another feature is 3D surround sound, a new addition to this one.

Noise Canceling

The six microphones provided, three on each of the buds, cancel out the noise for the Anker Liberty 3 Pro. Not only the mics, but the Hearid mentioned above (called Hearid ANC) optimizes noise reduction as per your ear's needs. And the AI-Uplink Noise Reduction algorithm filters out unnecessary sounds during the call.

Battery 

The Anker Liberty 3 Pro has an 8-hour battery life. Added to that is the charging case, which extends the playback for 32 hours. Furthermore, quick charging allows you to reach 3 hours of listening time in just 15 minutes. The case is wired and wireless charging-compatible.
Other than that, you can customize your hearing profile as you like. Just install the SoundCore app from the Play Store or App Store, depending on your OS.

title: Anker Soundcore Life P2i
short_description: The Anker Soundcore Life P2i is another budget TWS from Anker, a well-known company. It has an in-ear fit with three silicone tip sizes and two color options. 10-mm audio drivers with deep bass handle the music side of things. Additionally, it can switch between two EQ modes (bass and podcast) and has AI-enhanced uplink noise reduction.
description:
Anker Soundcore Life P2i Overview:

Design

On the surface, the Anker Soundcore Life P2i is an in-ear fit with typical silicone tips. The box provides you with three silicone tip sizes: large, medium, and small. Talking about the sizes, the buds themselves are pretty tiny and sleek, merely weighing 4.4 g.Also, they have buttons for control, meaning you need to press the button rather than simply touch the surface. Furthermore, the device is water-resistant, following IPX5 standards.Two color options are provided here: Black and White (Opulent Garden).

Audio related features

Moving on to audio, the Life P2i is powered by 10-mm audio drivers with an impedance of 16Ω. The company promises this product to have deep bass with a frequency range of 20 Hz to 20 kHz. Additionally, it can switch between two EQ modes (Bass and Podcast). These are exactly what the name suggests: one is for the bass and the other for the vocals.Moreover, the AI-enhanced uplink noise reduction allows for a smooth call experience, so the other side won't have to worry about your surrounding noises ruining the conversation. This is all thanks to the two microphones in Soundcore Life P2i, one on each of the earpieces, along with some processing going on inside the buds.

Connectivity

The wireless earbuds need one way or another to transfer data from the device. Hence, the P2i connects to your device (usually a phone) within a 10-meter radius using Bluetooth V5.2. For charging, though, you would need a wired USB-C cable alongside a power brick, or maybe you can charge them using your phone/laptop.

Battery and Charging

On the battery side, this Soundcore Life P2i abides by 8 hours of longevity. The case tops it off with 20 hours of playback. This implies a combined playback time of 28 hours. Further, 10 minutes of charges back you up for one hour!
seo_title_facebook: Anker Soundcore Life P2i Price and Specifications in Nepal

title: Amazfit GTS 2e
short_description: The Amazfit GTS 2e is a rectangular version of the 2e, featuring an aluminum alloy body and a matte plastic finish with sensors at the bottom. It is 5 ATM water-resistant and available in three colors: Obsidian Black, Moss Green, and Lilac Purple. The 1.65\" AMOLED screen has a 341 PPI pixel density and a 384 x 442 pixel resolution. The watch offers health and fitness tracking features and 90 additional sports modes, six of which are automatically detectable.\r\n\r\n
description:
Amazfit GTS 2e Overview:

Design and Display:

The Amazfit GTS 2e is the rectangular version of the 2e, with a single button at the side. This uses aluminum alloy as the body. The bottom features a matte plastic finish with the sensors. Further, the 2e is 5 ATM water-resistant. Aside from that, the watch is available in three colors: Obsidian Black, Moss Green, and Lilac Purple.Coming to the display part, this features an AMOLED screen with 2.5D curved glass. This display is 1.65" in size and has a 341 PPI pixel density and a 384 x 442 px resolution. You are given a broad range of watch face themes to play around with and see what fits you the best.

Health and Fitness Tracking

With this watch, you get health-tracking features such as 24/7 heart rate, SpO2, stress and sleep management, PAI, etc. Additionally, the temperature sensor found in GTS 2e adds more functionality to health tracking.Thereafter, there are 90 additional sports modes in 2e, of which six are automatically detectable. Some of which are outdoor running, treadmill, walking, outdoor cycling, pool swimming, and elliptical sports modes.

Connectivity

Moving on to connectivity, the GTS 2e uses Bluetooth LE 5.0 to connect to your device. Paired with the Zepp App, you can customize watch faces, call using the watch, and get your health data. In addition to that, you can get notifications from your phone, set up events, alarms, and timers, and do so much more.Not just your smartphone, but the Amazfit GTS 2e can also connect to the satellites up there, thanks to the GPS provided.

Battery

For battery life, this smartwatch packs a 246 mAh cell, easily lasting for around 14 days on typical usage. Moreover, if you want it for more basic things, it can even last for up to 10 additional days based on your usage pattern. When you add in load, though, the maximum time it lasts is halved.

title: Anker Soundcore Spirit Dot 2
short_description: Anker is a reliable company when it comes to charging technologies. Their Soundcore sub-brand is how they release audio products. One of them is the Anker Soundcore Spirit Dot 2, which consists of small earbuds designed to fit in your ears. They have touch controls and an IPX7 rating. You get an 8-mm diamond-coated drivers for enhanced bass. Battery life information is not provided, but a quick 10-minute charge gives around 1 hour of playback.
description:
Anker Soundcore Spirit Dot 2 Overview:

Design

Okay, firstly, the Anker Soundcore Spirit Dot 2 is small enough to fit comfortably in the ears. For reference, the 2nd version of Spirit Dot is comparatively 20% slimmer than its previous version.As for fit, it is put in the ear with silicone tips holding it in place. Additionally, the box provides you with 5 sizes of ear tips and 3 sizes of air wings to perfectly fit your ear. "What are air wings?" you may ask. These are the silicone builds that hold the buds on the outer ears.Another factor affecting the design part is touch controls. Further, the TWS provides you with an IPX7 rating that’s toughened by exclusive SweatGuard technology. Here, Soundcore's Dot 2 has gone with touch for controls. As far as the color options go, I found only a Black variant.

Audio related features

Moving on, 8-mm diamond-coated drivers are what lead the music department in Dot 2. The company claims these drivers are surrounded by elastic, bass-maximizing material. The aforementioned materials apparently increase the bass output by up to 100%. Paired with Bassup technology, they say these buds are perfect for workout-fueling music.Further, the Soundcore Spirit Dot 2 only support normal codecs: SBC and AAC. However, there is no mention of microphones or call quality.

Battery and Connectivity

Here, Anker claims Spirit Dot 2 survives 5 hours and 30 minutes of playback on one full charge. Along with the case, they provide you with 16 hours of non-stop music. Another thing mentioned here is that 10 minutes of charge gives you an hour of backup.Additionally, MCSync True-Wireless Connection Technology allows for dual transmitters to ensure 30% less latency when listening to anything. A USB-C cable is provided for wired charging.

title: Google Pixel Fold
short_description: Pixel Fold is the first foldable phone from Google, and it combines the best features of a smartphone and a tablet. It has a 7.6-inch OLED display that folds in half, making it easy to carry and use. Running on Android 13, the phone gets the horsepower of its homegrown Google Tensor G2 chipset. It is mated with 12GB of RAM and 256GB or 512GB of UFS 3.1 storage. As for the optics, the Pixel Fold bears a triple rear camera system (48MP + 10.8MP + 10.8MP), and dual 8MP + 9MP selfie cameras. Fueling the device is a 4,821mAh battery with 30W fast charging alongside Qi Wireless charging support.
description:
Google Pixel Fold Overview:

Design and Display

Alongside Pixel 7a and Pixel Tablet, Google finally unveiled its first foldable phone—the Pixel Fold—at I/O 2023. And this phone looks much like the OPPO Find N2, instead of the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4. It has a short and wide 17.4:9 display up front, that unfolds into a 6:5 screen.More specifically, Pixel Fold has a 7.6-inch OLED display that folds in half, with a 5.8-inch cover screen on the outside. The main display here uses ultra-thin glass (UTG) and a special protective layer to prevent creases and scratches. Whereas the cover screen gets Gorilla Glass Victus protection. And both these displays support a 120Hz refresh rate too. Google's first foldable is IPX8 water-resistant too.

Performance

Under the hood, this thing is powered by Google's own Tensor G2 chip, which is optimized for AI and machine learning. And it also enables features like Live Translate (to translate speech and text in real-time across apps) and Magic Eraser (to remove unwanted objects from photos with a tap).Google Pixel Fold comes with 12GB of RAM and 256GB or 512GB of storage. It runs on Android 13 out of the box, and Google has promised 3 generations of OS and 5 years of security updates for this phone.

Camera

Getting to cameras, Pixel Fold has a triple rear camera system that consists of a 48MP primary, a 10.8MP ultra-wide, and a 10.8MP telephoto sensor with 5x optical zoom. The phone also has a 9.5MP selfie camera on the cover screen and an 8MP sensor on the main screen inside some rather thick bezels.

Others

Fueling the Google Pixel Fold is a 4,821mAh battery that supports wireless charging as well as wired fast charging with a 30W adapter. For security, Google has used a side-mounted fingerprint sensor here. Its stereo speakers support spatial audio too.
seo_title_facebook: Google Pixel Fold Price, Full Specifications, Comparison
seo_description_facebook: Google Pixel Fold price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specifications, availability, and price of the Google Pixel Fold

title: Google Pixel 7a
short_description: Pixel 7a is Google's latest mid-range smartphone, offering a balance of performance, features, and affordability. It comes with a 6.1-inch 90Hz OLED display, a Tensor G2 processor, 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of storage. It also supports wireless charging and Face Unlock, which are new additions to the Pixel \"a\" series. Sporting a dual-camera setup at the back, it consists of a 64MP main and a 13MP ultrawide sensor. Pixel 7a also benefits from Google's software enhancements, such as \"Real Tone\", \"HDR+\", and \"Night Sight\". The phone runs on Android 13 with 3 generations of guaranteed OS updates and 5 years of security patches. Fueling the phone is a 4,385mAh cell with 18W wired and 7.5W wireless charging.
description:
Pixel 7a Overview:

Google has recently launched the Pixel 7a, a successor to the Pixel 6a (review) and a cheaper alternative to the Pixel 7 (review). The phone offers a lot of value for money, as it shares many features with the flagship Pixel 7, but costs USD 100 less in the US or INR 12,000 less in India. Let us review some of the key aspects of the new Google Pixel 7a.

Design and Display

Pixel 7a has a similar design to the Pixel 6a, with a glass front, a plastic back, and an aluminum frame. It also retains the IP67 rating for dust and water resistance. You get four color options: Charcoal, Sea, Coral, and Snow.The phone has a 6.1-inch OLED display with an FHD resolution and a 20:9 aspect ratio. It supports HDR and has a refresh rate of 90Hz, which makes it smoother and more responsive than the 60Hz display of the Pixel 6a. It is also protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 3.

Performance

Powering the Pixel 7a is the Google Tensor G2 (5nm); the same chipset that runs on the Pixel 7 and the Pixel 7 Pro. It has an octa-core CPU with two Cortex-X1 cores clocked at 2.85 GHz, two Cortex-A78 cores clocked at 2.35 GHz, and four Cortex-A55 cores clocked at 1.8 GHz. The GPU of choice here is Mali-G710 MP7. As for the memory configuration, it comes with 8GB of LPDDR5 RAM and 128GB of UFS 3.1 storage.The phone boots on Android 13, which is the latest version of Google's operating system. It also benefits from Google's promise of 5 years of security and 3 years of OS updates.

Battery and Charging

Google Pixel 7a gets its juice from a 4385mAh battery that supports up to 18W wired charging and up to 7.5W wireless charging. This is another upgrade from the Pixel 6a, which had no wireless charging support. Pixel 7a's USB Type-C 3.2 port supports USB Power Delivery (PD) 3.0 too.

Camera

This phone's camera setup has been thoroughly revamped compared to Pixel 6a. Instead of dual 12MP sensors at the back, Pixel 7a uses a 64MP f/1.8 main sensor with phase detection autofocus (PDAF) and optical image stabilization (OIS). Whereas its secondary rear camera is a 13MP ultra-wide sensor with a 120° FoV. The front camera has also been bumped from 8MP to a 13MP unit.

short_description: The Lenovo ideaPad 1 2022 is an ideal laptop for office workers and students. It comes in a minimal design language with a plastic frame. You get a 14-inch screen with a TN panel offering an FHD resolution, 60Hz refresh rate, and 220 nits brightness. For performance, you get a 12th Gen Intel i7-1255U processor. description:
Lenovo is a staple brand in the corporate sector with its sleek and minimal ultrabooks. One of the popular offerings from the brand is their ideaPad series. Here, we will look at the Lenovo ideaPad 1 (2022) with the Intel i7-1255U processor.

Lenovo ideaPad 1 2022 (14IAU7) Overview

Design and Display

Lenovo laptops come with an iconic uniform design language and this laptop is no different. This laptop comes with just 17.90 mm thickness and weighs just 1.37 kilograms. The Lenovo ideaPad 1 2022 comes in a plastic body with a monotone finish. The laptops lid flaunts minimal company branding while shipping in Abyss Blue, Cloud Grey, and Sand colour options. This laptop comes in a single Cloud Grey shade in Nepal.On the front, you have multiple options of panels. However, this particular model comes with a 14-inch TN LCD panel. Here, you get an FHD resolution spanning 1,920 x 1,080 pixels. Meanwhile, the display on the Lenovo ideaPad 1 2022 isnt all that great as it only offers a 45% NTSC colour gamut. Lastly, it offers 220 nits of brightness.

Performance and the rest

Under the hood, this Lenovo ideaPad 1 2022 packs the Intel Core i7-1255U coupled with integrated Intel Iris Xe Graphics. The processor packs 10 cores, 12 threads, and clocks in at a maximum of 4.7 GHz. The GPU you get in this laptop shares the memory and TGP with the CPU.Other than that, you get an 8GB DDR4-3200 memory. Some models of the laptop offer you an extra SO-DIMM slot with up to 8GB of memory support. For storage, you get a 512GB SSD. You get an additional SSD slot with another 512GB support. Therefore, this Lenovo ideaPad 1 2022 offers a decent amount of upgradability. In the meantime, you get an integrated 42Wh lithium-polymer battery with a 65W 3-pin power adapter.

description:
Realme 11 Pro is one of the latest smartphones from the Chinese brand, launched in May 2023.

Realme 11 Pro Overview:

Design and Display

title: Lenovo Legion 5 2021 (Ryzen 7 5800H, RTX 3070, 16GB, 2TB, 15.6" FHD 165Hz)
short_description: Lenovo Legion 5 (2021) is a gaming laptop with a pretty subtle visual profile. As a result, it blends in a professional environment rather easily as well. This gaming laptop is powered by AMD's Ryzen 5000 series CPU and NVidIA's RTX 30 series GPU.
description:
Lenovo Legion 5 (2021) Overview, Price:

Design, Display

The 2021 edition of Legion 5 features an all-plastic build quality. There's a subtle "Legion" branding on the top left corner of the laptop's lid and a "Lenovo" branding on the bottom right. As for cooling, Lenovo says its "Legion Coldfront 3.0" technology helps deliver great performance with zero throttling even under long gaming sessions. The slightly more premium Legion 5 Pro has an even better thermal system, by the way.Anyway, this cooling solution includes two fans with quad-channel exhaust and a large air intake vent at the bottom and underneath each keyboard switch. The laptop comes in two finishes: Phantom Black and Phantom Blue. But you can also find the Stingray White color option in certain markets.Upfront, you're getting a 15.6" Full HD IPS LCD screen with an anti-glare coating on top. Likewise, the Legion 5 (2021) is available with two display configurations in total:
  • 120Hz refresh rate, 250 nits brightness
  • 165Hz refresh rate, 300 nits brightness, 100% sRGB, Dolby Vision

Performance

In terms of performance, this gaming laptop brings AMD + NVidIA combo. It is available with a single CPU choice, i.e. Ryzen 7 5800H, whereas GPU options range from RTX 3050 to RTX 3070. The RTX 3070 variant has 8 GB of GDDR6 VRAM.As for memory, you can install up to 32GB DDR4-3200 RAM here. The Legion 5 (2021)'s base model usually arrives with 512GB SSD but you can bump it up to 2TB M.2 NVMe SSD as well.

Others

Moving on, this gaming laptop features a Legion TrueStrike keyboard with 4-zone RGB lighting. You can customize the lighting pattern under the Lenovo Vantage app. Port options on the Legion 5 (2021) include 4x USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A, 2x USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C, 1x HDMI 2.1, 1x RJ45, 1x 3.5mm combo audio jack, and an E-shutter button on the right. Contrary to a physical webcam shutter, this button toggles the camera on/off.When it comes to battery, this gaming laptop has been paired with either a 60 or 80 Wh battery depending on the GPU configuration. Similarly, they fuel up via a 230W or a 300W AC adapter, respectively.

title: Realme 11 5G
short_description: Realme 11 is the midrange model in the company's number series for the year 2023. The phone is powered by MediaTek's Dimensity 6100+ 5G chipset with 8GB of RAM and 256GB of storage. Its IPS LCD display has a smooth 120Hz refresh rate and up to 240Hz touch sampling rate. Realme 11 5G runs on Android 13-based Realme UI 4.0. Furthermore, the phone has a big 5000mAh battery that supports 67W SuperVOOC fast charging. And Realme offers a compatible charger inside the phone's box itself.
description:
Realme is a brand that has been making waves in the smartphone market with its affordable and feature-packed devices. The latest offering from the company is the Realme 11 5G, a mid-range phone that supports 5G connectivity and boasts a 120Hz display, a 108MP dual camera setup, and a 5000mAh battery.

Realme 11 5G Overview:

Design and Display

The Realme 11 5G has a sleek design with a matte finish on the back and a punch-hole cutout on the front. On the display side, you get a 6.72-inch IPS LCD screen with a resolution of 2400 x 1080 pixels and a refresh rate of 120Hz, which makes scrolling and gaming smooth and fluid. The panel supports a  peak brightness of 680 nits and support.

Performance

The phone is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset. This octa-core SoC features two Cortex-A76 cores clocked at 2.4GHz and six Cortex-A55 cores clocked at 2.0GHz. It is accompanied by a Mali-G57 MC2 GPU and an integrated 5G modem. Memory-wise, it comes with 8GB of RAM and 128/256GB of UFS 2.2 storage.

Camera

The Realme 11 5G has a dual-camera setup on the back, consisting of a 108MP main camera with an f/1.8 aperture, and a 2MP depth sensor. For selfies and video calls, there is a 16 front-facing camera that can also record 1080p videos at 30fps.

Battery and Others

Fueling the phone is a 5000mAh battery that supports 67W fast charging via a USB-C port. Other features of the phone include a side-mounted fingerprint scanner, a dual-SIM slot, a headphone jack, and dual stereo speakers. The phone runs on Android 13 with Realme UI 4.0 on top.

description:
Oppo A18 Overview

title: HiFuture FlyBuds 2
short_description: The HiFuture FlyBuds 2 is a semi-in-ear earbud with a unique design, featuring stems for storage and a touch sensor for controls. The case features a HiFuture logo and a small LED. The audio quality is excellent, with graphene and biological diaphragm drivers. The 2nd iteration of FlyBuds supports Bluetooth 5.0, magnetic pogo pins, and a Type-C charger.
description:
HiFuture FlyBuds 2 Overview:

Design

HiFuture FlyBuds 2 inherits most of the design elements from its predecessor. Nevertheless, it looks completely different. First of all, the buds are semi-in-ear, which means no silicone tips and such. The stems hold most of the stuff inside. And on the outside, you can use the touch sensor at the top for controls or the holes at the bottom for mics.Besides, the Flybuds 2 has an IPX5 rating. The outer case has a HiFuture logo at the top and a small LED at the bottom. And the case, along with the buds, is available in classical Black and White options.

Audio and Connectivity

On the audio front, HiFuture promises "superior talking quality and audio experience" in their FlyBuds 2. The two master technology allows it to connect separately to the device. Additionally, the drivers providing sound are made with graphene and a biological diaphragm.For connecting with your device, the 2nd iteration of FlyBuds ships with Bluetooth 5.0. And the magnetic pogo pins in the case mean that the buds turn off when put into the case and turn on while out of the case. Furthermore, a Type-C charger fuels the case.

Rest of the specs

About fueling, the FlyBuds 2 themselves are fueled for 4 hours, thanks to the cell inside. Moreover, when paired with the charging case that can hold an additional 20 hours of playtime, the package as a whole stays up for a combined playback time of 28 hours. Further charging it for 15 minutes gives an additional 2 hours playtime.
seo_title_facebook: HiFuture FlyBuds 2 Price and Specification in Nepal
seo_description_facebook: HiFuture FlyBuds 2 full specifications, price, comparison, and more. Find out the complete specs and price of HiFuture FlyBuds 2

title: HiFuture FutureMate
short_description: The HiFuture FutureMate is a wireless earphone with an open-ear fit, providing sound without blocking the ear canal. It has an IPX5 rating. The headphones support SBC and AAC codecs, but air-conducted audio may reduce quality. They have two microphones on each earpiece for improved call quality. The headphones have an 8-hour battery life, allowing them to last for a day.
description:
HiFuture FutureMate Overview:

Design

First of all, HiFuture FutureMate is among those wireless earphones using an open-ear fit you barely see on the earphones. What's the open-ear fit? You may ask. Well, this type of fit delivers sound without blocking your ear canal as in other traditional types of fits.
  • Check out HiFuture FutureMate Pro with a similar fit but is completely wireless
Moreover, there is an IPX5 rating protecting FutureMate Air Conducting headphones from some sort of water damage. The only colors available are Black, Red, and Gray.

Audio

For audio, the HiFuture FutureMate supports both the SBC and AAC codecs, suiting Android and iOS users. However, the audio itself is air-conducted, so there will be some loss in quality. Additionally, two microphones on each earpiece power the ENC, which means the call quality will be a bit better.

Battery and the rest

And to top it all off, the FutureMate provides 8 hours of battery life. This means the band will easily last for a day, all thanks to a 100 mAh lithium-ion polymer battery. Further, to bring it back to full, plugging them in for 2 hours is enough.

title: HiFuture Fusion
short_description: HiFuture Fusion is an upper-budget earbuds that comes with premium features. The earbuds boast an IPX5 water and dust resistance while offering up to 40 hours of playback. Meanwhile, these buds have a six-mic setup, four of which are utilised for ENC and Hybrid ANC. The HiFuture Fusion comes with Bluetooth v5.3 for wireless connectivity and also offers an ultra-low-latency mode for gaming. Lastly and most interestingly, these buds offer high-quality LDAC codec support.
description:
HiFuture is a Chinese accessories brand that has a wide catalogue ranging from basic stuff like earbuds, and smartwatches to more niche products like smart glasses. One such offering from HiFuture is the Fusion earbuds.

HiFuture Fusion Overview

Design

The HiFuture Fusion is an in-ear earbud that comes in a stemless design and fin on top. The fin on the top of the earbud is placed there to offer a better grip on the ear. These earbuds here come in a dual-tone blend of glossy and matte finish. Moreover, the HiFuture Fusion comes with an IPX5 rating, making it resistant to splashes of water. This also means that these earbuds are sweat-resistant and, therefore can be a perfect partner for you during workouts.Moving on to the case, it comes in an ovular design with a matte finish. The case features a USB Type-C charger on the left. Meanwhile, it features a light blue indicator on the front. The HiFuture Fusion is available in two colour options: Jet Black, and Ivory White.

Audio and rest

The HiFuture Fusion offers gaming mode with ultra-low latency. Additionally, these buds feature a six-mic setup wherein four of them are enhanced by AI and utilised for ENC. The remaining two mics are the primary mics for picking up your voice. With this setup, these earbuds also offer a “Hybrid ANC” feature. The company has opted to remain silent about the driver size on the earbud.These earbuds are capable of offering you up to 40 hours of playback time. In the meantime, HiFuture Fusion is capable of wireless charging providing you with utmost convenience. Other than that, it comes equipped with Bluetooth v5.3 and supports the high-quality LDAC codec. Lastly, it is compatible with devices running on Android, iOS, as well as Windows.
  • Check out more HiFuture Earbuds, HERE!

title: Realme C53
short_description: The Realme C53 is a budget smartphone offering a massive 6.74-inch 90Hz screen, a dual-camera setup, and a 5000 mAh battery. The screen has a peak brightness of 560 nits and a touch sampling rate of 180Hz. It sports a dual-camera setup consisting of a 108 MP primary shooter and an unspecified depth sensor. Meanwhile, the front camera is an 8 MP lens with AI Selfie. The phone is powered by a Unisoc Tiger T612  processor and a 5000mAh battery with 18W fast charging. As for the software, it runs on Android 13 with Realme UI 4.0 T Edition on top.
description:
Realme C53 is a budget offering quite similar to the Realme C51. The Chinese smartphone manufacturer has made some tweaks to this phone to separate it from its more affordable sibling. Here is a brief overview of the Realme C53.

Realme C53 Overview

Design and Display

The Realme C53 is a two-textured phone with a rounded rectangle shape and flat design. This unit measures 167.20 x 76.70 x 7.99 mm in dimensions and weighs about 186 grams. It is available in two colour options: Champion Gold, and Champion Black.Up front, a massive 6.74” display greets us with a 90Hz refresh rate and 180Hz touch sampling rate. Even though it can reach a peak brightness of 560 nits and can display 16.7 million colours, it is an LCD panel, which is the standard for budget phones like this one.

Performance 

In terms of performance, the Realme C53 also relies on a Unisoc Tiger T612 SoC. It isn't a very good processor but a popular choice in this price range. Additionally, it is an octa-core chipset built on a 12nm process and can clock in at a maximum of 1.8GHz. It is further assisted by 4GB LPDDR4X RAM and 128 GB internal storage.The Realme C53 offers an additional 4GB virtual RAM extension as well as storage expansion of up to 2TB via MicroSD card. On the software side of things, the Realme C53 comes with Realme UI T Edition based on Android 13. Furthermore, it offers a unique Mini Capsule feature, which is basically Apple's Dynamic Island knock-off.

Camera and the rest

In terms of shooters, we have a 108MP primary camera with a 3x In-sensor Zoom capability. It receives assistance from a depth sensor that Realme has opted to remain silent about. And on the front, we have an 8MP camera that is assisted by AI for selfies.The Realme C53 has dual-SIM support with 4G LTE, dual WiFi, and Bluetooth v5.0 connectivity. You do not have any NFC support here. And lastly, juicing up the phone is a 5,000 mAh battery with 33W SUPERVOOC charging support via USB Type-C Port.

title: Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2021 (Ryzen 7 5800H, RTX 3060, 16GB, 1TB, 16 WQXGA 165Hz)
short_description: Lenovo Legion 5 (2021) is a gaming laptop with a pretty subtle visual profile. As a result, it blends in a professional environment rather easily as well. This gaming laptop is powered by AMD's Ryzen 5000 series CPU and NVidIA's RTX 30 series GPU.
description:
Lenovo Legion 5 (2021) Overview, Price:

Design, Display

The 2021 edition of Legion 5 features an all-plastic build quality. There's a subtle "Legion" branding on the top left corner of the laptop's lid and a "Lenovo" branding on the bottom right. As for cooling, Lenovo says its "Legion Coldfront 3.0" technology helps deliver great performance with zero throttling even under long gaming sessions. The slightly more premium Legion 5 Pro has an even better thermal system, by the way.Anyway, this cooling solution includes two fans with quad-channel exhaust and a large air intake vent at the bottom and underneath each keyboard switch. The laptop comes in two finishes: Phantom Black and Phantom Blue. But you can also find the Stingray White color option in certain markets.Upfront, you're getting a 15.6" Full HD IPS LCD screen with an anti-glare coating on top. Likewise, the Legion 5 (2021) is available with two display configurations in total:
  • 120Hz refresh rate, 250 nits brightness
  • 165Hz refresh rate, 300 nits brightness, 100% sRGB, Dolby Vision

Performance

In terms of performance, this gaming laptop brings AMD + NVidIA combo. It is available with a single CPU choice, i.e. Ryzen 7 5800H, whereas GPU options range from RTX 3050 to RTX 3070. Only the RTX 3050 Ti (95W) and RTX 3060 (130W) variants are currently available in Nepal. These GPUs have been complemented with 4GB and 6GB of GDDR6 VRAM, respectively.As for memory, you can install up to 32GB DDR4-3200 RAM here. The Legion 5 (2021)'s base model usually arrives with 512GB SSD but you can bump it up to 2TB M.2 NVMe SSD as well.

Others

Moving on, this gaming laptop features a Legion TrueStrike keyboard with 4-zone RGB lighting. You can customize the lighting pattern under the Lenovo Vantage app. Port options on the Legion 5 (2021) include 4x USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A, 2x USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C, 1x HDMI 2.1, 1x RJ45, 1x 3.5mm combo audio jack, and an E-shutter button on the right. Contrary to a physical webcam shutter, this button toggles the camera on/off.When it comes to battery, this gaming laptop has been paired with either a 60 or 80 Wh battery depending on the GPU configuration. Similarly, they fuel up via a 230W or a 300W AC adapter, respectively.

title: JBL Tune 130NC
short_description: JBL is a well-known brand when it comes to audio. For the TWS, JBL's 130NC is their noise canceling buds. These buds are open-fitted TWS earphones with silicone tips, providing an ergonomic fit and an IPX4 rating. The buds are available in four colors: White, Blue, Sand, and Black. The audio comes from 10-mm drivers powered by JBL Pure Bass Sound with an impedance of 32 ohms. The headphones also support active noise cancellation and Ambient Aware modes.\r\n\r\n
description:
JBL Tune 130NC Overview:

Ergonomic Design

The JBL Tune 130NC is an open-fitted TWS earphone fitted with silicone tips, ensuring an ergonomic fit. With an IPX4 rating, you can enjoy your music without worrying about any water splashes. Moreover, these earphones are lightweight, weighing just around 11.4 grams.The case is a squarish box with rounded corners that open up to reveal the buds inside. Near the opening, there are LEDs to indicate charge levels. Moreover, the case and buds are available in four colors: White, Blue, Sand, and Black.Audio PerformanceThe audio in the JBL Tune 130NC comes from 10-mm drivers. These drivers are powered by JBL Pure Bass Sound and have an impedance of 32 ohms. The drivers can output 20 Hz to 20 kHz frequencies, and the sensitivity is listed at 103 dB.And yes, this does support active noise cancellation, as the name suggests. This is all thanks to the four mics provided, two on each bud. Additionally, Ambient Aware mode is also a feature here, which is JBL's way of saying transparency mode.

Playtime with extension measures

When it comes to battery life, the buds alone can play 10 hours of music without ANC turned on. With ANC, though, these survive 8 hours of playtime. On top of that, the case adds 30 hours of lifetime to the buds, or 24 hours if ANC is turned on.Charging is also quick, with the case taking 2 hours to fully charge.

title: JBL Wave Flex
short_description: The JBL Wave Flex earbuds feature an ergonomic design with a stick-open stem, weighing 3.8 grams each. Available in blue, white, beige, and black variants, they have an IP54 rating and an IPX2 rating in the case. The 12mm drivers deliver deep bass sound, with a built-in microphone for calls and Smart Ambient technology.
description:
JBL Wave Flex Overview:

Ergonomic design

The "stick-open" design of the JBL Wave Flex is engineered to offer an ergonomic fit according to the company. The stem not only houses controls but also adds very little weight to the buds, making them weigh 3.8 grams each. Whether you're out for a jog or a long commute, these earbuds stay in place.In terms of color options, there are blue, white, beige, and black variants, but in Nepal, you'll only find the Black and Blue ones. The IP54 rating gives you peace of mind when you're caught in unexpected rain or facing a dusty environment. The Wave Flex even doesn't miss out on the IPX2 rating in the case.

Deep Bass Audio

Beyond the technical specs, the "Deep Bass Sound" is attributed to the 12mm drivers in the JBL Wave Flex earbuds. These drivers can deliver frequencies from as low as 20 Hz for bass to 20 kHz for treble.Additionally, the built-in microphone isn't just for calls. The Wave Flex also supports Smart Ambient technology (the company's way of saying ENC), as well as Ambient Aware and TalkThru modes for different listening experiences.

Battery

The battery on the JBL Wave Flex lasts for 8 hours of playback on the earbuds alone. Plus, the charging case extends this even further, providing a total of 32 hours of endurance. Furthermore, quick charging can replenish the battery in just two hours.

title: Vivo V29e

It comes in Forest Black and Rose Gold colors and is slim and lightweight, with an IP54 rating. Vivo V29e Overview

Display and Design

Beginning with the display, the Vivo V29e has a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. The display has a punch-hole cutout for the camera, and the bezels are small. Furthermore, the device ships in two configurations: 8/128GB and 8/256GB. For software, Vivo uses its own Funtouch OS based on Android 13.

Altogether, there are two cameras on the back (with a ring light at the bottom) in V29e. The 64MP f/1.79 lens with OIS is at the forefront, trailed by an 8MP f/2.2 ultrawide sensor. There is also a 50MP front-facing camera with an f/2.0 aperture. Further, there is a 4800mAh cell powering the Vivo V29e with 44W fast charging. Talking about connectivity, the phone offers WiFi 5, Bluetooth 5.1, 5G, GPS, and a USB-C 2.0 port.
