title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5
short_description: The Galaxy Z Flip 5 is Samsung's clamshell folding phone for 2023. Samsung has finally placed a bigger cover display this time, measuring 3.4 inches (AMOLED). This ensures more usability and convenience on the Flip 5 as compared to its predecessors. The inner display is a 6.7-inch AMOLED panel with a 120Hz refresh rate. Other than that, it is powered by a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy, an overclocked version of the regular 8 Gen 2.  Meanwhile he battery capacity on the Flip 5 remains the same 3700mAh as on the Flip 4. It supports 25W wired charging, 15W wireless & 4.5W reverse wireless charging.
description:
Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 Overview:

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 is the latest foldable smartphone from the Korean tech giant. It features a 6.7-inch dynamic AMOLED display that can fold in half, a Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy processor, and more. Let's head over to its short overview.

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 brings in the much-needed, outer display update. The device houses a massive 3.4-inch AMOLED cover screen. Samsung calls it 'Flex Window' by the way.  This brings a whole new range of usability such as a full-size QWERTY keyboard to reply to texts and messages, and a wide range of clockfaces, gestures, and widgets.
This flip phone houses a new double hinge design called Flex Hinge which provides a gapless hinge experience. Samsung ships this foldable in four colors: Cream, Green, Lavender, and Graphite.
Opening the phone will get you to the foldable display. It is a 2X Dynamic AMOLED screen with a resolution of 2640 x 1080 pixels and a refresh rate of 120Hz. You get a Gorilla Glass Victus 2 protection as well.

Performance

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 gets the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy chipset under the hood. It is an overclocked version of the regular 8 Gen 2 and offers significant CPU and GPU boosts.  The phone can handle any task you throw at it, whether it's gaming, multitasking, or browsing. Memory-wise, you get 8GB of RAM and 256/512GB of UFS 4.0 storage. On the software side, the phone boots on OneUI 5.1.1 built on top of Android 13.

Camera

This time as well, Samsung has retained a dual camera setup on the Z Flip 5. You get a 12MP main shooter and a 12MP ultrawide-angle unit. On the front side, there is a 10MP sensor, located in a small hole-punch cutout on the main screen.

Battery and Others

Fueling the Z Flip 5 is a 3,500mAh battery with 25W fast charging support. It can also be charged wirelessly via a 15W charger. And for biometrics security, there is a side-mounted fingerprint reader.
seo_title_facebook: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 Price, Full Specifications, Comparison
seo_description_facebook: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs, price of the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5
short_description: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 is largely identical to its predecessor, but it does offer some quality of life improvements. The company has finally brought a gapless hinge on the Fold 5. On top of that, \"Flex Hinge\" is aiding for the phone to be a millimeter thinner and 10 grams lighter than the Fold 4. The display is still identical though, with 2X Dynamic AMOLED, 120Hz refresh rate, and LTPO 2.0. You get the 21.6:18 aspect ratio, which reduces letterboxing in the screen. The foldable is powered by 4 nm-based Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy, a customized version of the regular 8 Gen 1. On the back, there is a triple camera setup with a 50MP main camera, a 10MP telephoto shooter, and a 12MP ultra-wide lens. For selfies, you get a 10MP sensor on the cover screen and a 4MP under-display camera on the inner display. Moreover, it comes with a 4400mAh Li-Po battery that supports 25W wired fast charging. The phone is available in three memory configurations: 12/256GB, 12/512GB and 12GB/1TB.
description:
Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 Overview

Samsung has recently unveiled its latest foldable flagship device, the Galaxy Z Fold 5, which promises to deliver a premium foldable experience with improved performance, durability, and features. Let's get into its overview.

Design and Display

The Galaxy Z Fold 5 features a sleek and elegant design with a metal frame and a glass back. Samsung ships this foldable in three colors: Phantom Black, Icy Blue, and Cream. As a foldable, it consists of a hinge mechanism that allows it to fold and unfold smoothly and securely. With a teardrop hinge, the gap is finally not visible, when closed, this time. The hinge also supports Flex mode, which lets you use the device at different angles for various tasks.
The Fold 5 has two displays: a 6.2-inch cover screen on the front and a 7.6-inch main screen on the inside. Both screens have a dynamic AMOLED 2X panel with a 120Hz refresh rate and HDR10+ support, delivering crisp and vibrant visuals. The cover screen has a resolution of 2316 x 904 pixels, while the main screen boasts a resolution of 2176 x 1812 pixels. It also has an under-display camera (UDC) that blends in with the pixels, creating a seamless and immersive viewing experience.

Performance

The Galaxy Z Fold 5 is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy chip, which is one of the most powerful ones in the market. After all, it's the overclocked version of the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2, particularly made for Samsung devices. In terms of memory and storage, you get 12GB of RAM and up to 1TB of internal storage.
The device runs on Android 13 with One UI 5.1.1, which is optimized for foldable devices. It offers various features such as Multi-Active Window, App Continuity, Split Screen, and Drag and Drop.

Camera

Getting to the optics, the Fold 5 has five cameras. A 10MP selfie camera is on the cover screen, and a 4MP UDC is on the main screen. And a triple rear camera setup is present on the back. The rear camera setup includes a 50MP primary sensor, a 12MP telephoto camera with 2x optical zoom and 10x digital zoom, and a 12MP ultra-wide-angle camera with a 123-degree field of view. The device can record videos up to 8K resolution at 24fps.

Battery and Others

The Fold 5 gets its fuel from a 4400mAh dual-cell battery. The device supports 25W fast charging, 11W wireless charging, and 4.5W reverse wireless charging. You also get S Pen stylus support here, which is sold separately as an accessory. The S Pen allows you to write, draw, edit, and control your device with more precision and convenience.

seo_description_facebook: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs, and price of the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5.

title: Redmi Note 11S
short_description: Redmi Note 11S is finally available in the Nepali market for a fairly reasonable price. The phone features a 108MP main camera and an Helio G96 processor.
description:
Redmi Note 11S Overview, Price:

Here, we will discuss the full specifications and price of the Redmi Note 11S.

Design, Display

The Redmi Note 11S has a thickness of 8.09mm, making it somewhat a tad bit smaller than its 5G counterpart. In terms of build quality, the Note 11S's frame and back are made of plastic. It is available in three color options: Pearl White, Twilight Blue, and Graphite Gray.The phone features a 6.43 inch Full HD AMOLED display which supports a variable refresh rate of 90Hz and 180Hz touch sampling rate.

Performance

The Note 11S is powered by the MediaTek Helio G96 chipset. The SoC has two Cortex-A76 (@2.05GHz) and six Cortex-A55 (@2.0GHz) CPU cores. This has been paired with up to 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 128GB of UFS 2.2 internal storage.The handset comes with MIUI 13 based on Android 11 out of the box. This is a letdown from Xiaomi's side, as Realme and Samsung have already started providing Android 12. Moreover, the brand hasn't pledged any number of years of software updates on this thing.

Cameras, Others

Moving on, the smartphone houses four lenses in its rectangular camera bump. It comprises a 108MP primary sensor, an 8MP ultra-wide with 118˚ FoV, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor. Furthermore, for selfies, there's a 16MP sensor on a punch-hole cutout. The camera has features like night mode, portrait, and HDR, among others.Besides this, the Redmi Note 11S can reach 100% in under an hour as its 5000mAh battery supports 33W fast charging.

title: HP Victus 15 2023 (Ryzen 5 7535HS , RTX 2050, 8/16GB, 512GB, 15.6" FHD 144Hz)
short_description: Looking for a powerful laptop thats perfect for entry-level gamers? Look no further than the HP Victus 15 (2023). With its Ryzen 5 7535HS processor and NVidIAs RTX 2050 GPU, this laptop is a beast when it comes to performance. Not only that, but its 15.6\" screen with 45% NTSC coverage makes it a joy to use for watching movies and playing games. With a long-lasting battery, speedy memory, and a variety of ports, this laptop is a great choice for anyone looking for a good deal.
description:
HP Victus 15 (2023) Overview:

Heres a brief description of the design aesthetic, chipset, and port selection of the HP Victus 15 (2023) laptop with the AMD Ryzen 5 7535HS  and NVidIA RTX 2050 GPU.

Design and Build 

HP Victus 15 (2023) comes with a 15.6-inch display. Its an IPS LCD panel that covers 45% of the NTSC color gamut. The laptop has an 82% screen-to-body aspect ratio and can reach 250 nits of peak brightness.All this is housed inside a new form factor that tries to mimic the more premium Omen series. As you would expect, it is made of plastic. HP Victus 15 (2023) measures 37cm in length and weighs around 2.28 kg.

Performance and Extras

Regarding CPU, HP Victus 15 (2023) comes with the Ryzen 5 7535HS, and,  NVidIA GeForce RTX 2050 for the graphics, which has 4GB of GDDR6 RAM with 50W TGP. However, since the GPU is based on a newer microarchitecture, it brings hardware-accelerated Ray Tracing, DLSS supersampling, and other RTX features. In addition with DDR5 RAM and a 512 GB SSD, multitasking can be performed at an ease.The HP Victus 15 (2023) laptop comes equipped with a 52.5Wh battery and a 150W AC charger. It delivers a battery life of up to 6 hours and 45 minutes on mixed usage. The laptop also boasts a variety of ports, including one USB-C, two USB-A, one HDMI, one ethernet, and a 3.5mm headphone jack. Additionally, the keyboard is backlit, and the laptop features a 720p HD camera.

title: Ultima Atom 820
short_description: Ultima is set to release a new TWS after some time here in Nepal. These new earbuds, the Ultima Atom 820, are a TWS with in-ear earbuds and a stem, a square case, and 4 LEDs for charge level. It is rated IPX5 and comes in blue, gray, and pink color options. The audio features 13mm drivers and the latest Bluetooth V5.3. The buds also have IWP (Instant Wake n' Pair) and Beast Mode for gaming.
description:
Ultima Atom 820 Overview:

Design

On the surface, the Ultima Atom 820 is a TWS with in-ear earbuds plus the stem. Alternatively, this stem works as a touch control. Talking about the case, it is square with rounds around its corners and edges. At the front, there is the Ultima logo followed by the company name.Speaking of something functional, there are 4 LEDs below that logo that indicate charge level. Additionally, the Atom 820 is rated IPX5, so a little water won't damage the buds. Besides, the color options are Blue, Gray, and Pink.

Audio and Connectivity

When it comes to audio, the Atom 820 features 13 mm drivers. These drivers perceive a frequency range of 20Hz to 20kHz. On the flip side, these wireless earphones use mics along with ENC tech to cancel out the ambient noise from your voice during calls.In terms of connection, Ultima has provided the latest Bluetooth V5.3 with the new Atom 820. Additionally, the buds come with IWP (Instant Wake n' Pair). Plus, when a problem arises with latency, there is a separate Beast Mode that is simply a gaming mode with 60ms of low latency.

Battery

The battery is decent here, as the Atom 820 presents 10 hours of playback on a single charge, all thanks to the 35mAh cell inside. Added to the fact that the case also includes a 350mAh battery, the product combined stays up for 32 hours of playback.Further, the Ultima Atom 820's case has fast charging support using USB-C. Precisely, the case charges within 1.5 hours, while each bud takes approx. 30 minutes to get full.

title: Samsung Galaxy A05s
short_description: Samsung Galaxy A05s is the latest budget offering from the brand. It sports a 6.7-inch FHD+ screen with 16 million color depth. It is powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 680 chipset which is based on 6nm fabrication technology. Talking about the cameras, it has a triple camera setup that can capture decent-looking photos while providing a decent day-to-day experience. To aid in the overall performance of the smartphone, Samsung ships Galaxy A05s with the OneUI 5, on top of Android 13. This budget smartphone is fueled by a 5000mAh battery with 25W charging. Samsung has provided type-C in this price segment which is a plus point.
description:
Samsung Galaxy A05s is a new budget phone, that comes as a successor to last year's Samsung Galaxy A04s.

Samsung Galaxy A05s Overview

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy A05s is an all-plastic phone with a rounded rectangle shape and a glittery finish. It measures 168 x 77.80 x 8.80 mm and weighs 194 grams. It is available in three colours: Black, Silver, and Light Green.For display, the phone features a 6.7” display with a waterdrop camera cutout that is centrally aligned. It is a PLS LCD with FHD+ (1080 x 2400 pixels) resolution and a colour depth of 16 million.

Performance and Battery

Samsung has opted to replace their proprietary Exynos chip with Qualcomm's Snapdragon 680 this time around on the Galaxy A05s. It is an octa-core processor built on a 6nm fabrication process and is able to achieve a peak clock speed of 2.4 GHz.Furthermore, the SoC is coupled with 6 GB RAM and 128 GB storage. We can further expand the storage up to 1 TB via a MicroSD card. It runs on Android 13 with OneUI 5 on top of it. With this combination, Galaxy A05s should be able to assist you in basic gaming pretty easily. And maybe even some demanding games on low settings.As a power supply, the Samsung Galaxy A05s goes with a 5,000 mAh non-removable cell. The phone supports 25W fast charging via Type-C. In terms of connectivity, the phone supports dual-band WiFi, dual SIM 4G LTE, Bluetooth v5.1, and a five-way navigation system. It also has a headphone jack, however, it misses out on NFC and MHL support.

Camera

The Samsung Galaxy A05s comes with four cameras altogether. On the back, we get a triple camera setup with 2MP + 50MP + 2MP, laid vertically on top of one another. The top and bottom cameras are a macro lens and depth sensor respectively with f/2.4 maximum aperture. The central one is the primary camera with f/1.8 aperture. On the front, we get a 13 MP sensor.

title: Samsung Galaxy S23 FE
short_description: Galaxy S23 FE is a water-downed version of Samsung's flagship lineup of phones. It is suitable for those looking for a flagship smartphone on a budget. The phone is just 8.2mm thick and weighs around 209 grams only. It is powered by an in-house Exynos 2200 chipset. It is coupled with 8GB memory, and either 128GB or 256GB storage. Other than this, Galaxy S23 FE has a triple camera setup at the back, led by a 50MP main sensor. Meanwhile, on the battery side of things it comes with a respectable 4500 mAh cell.
description:
Samsung Galaxy S23 FE Overview

Samsung Galaxy S23 FE is a 2023 FE offering from the company after skipping the Samsung Galaxy S22 FE. It makes the necessary compromises and gives the flagship experience to its users at a much more affordable price.

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy S23 comes with a premium design and materials, namely aluminium for the frame and Gorilla Glass 5 on the front and the back. It measures 158.00 x 76.50 x 8.20 mm in dimension while weighing in at 209 grams. It comes in loads of colour options such as Mint, Cream, Graphite, Purple, Indigo, and Tangerine.On the front, we have a 6.4-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2x display that has a resolution of 1080 x 2340 pixels. Similarly, it is capable of a 120Hz refresh rate while boasting a colour depth of 16 million.

Performance

Under the hood, the Galaxy S23 FE comes with the in-house Exynos 2200 chipset. The US gets the Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 SoC, however, the rest of the world has to make do with the 4nm octa-core chipset with a maximum clock speed of 2.8 GHz.Furthermore, it comes in a sole 8 GB memory variant. On the other hand, it comes with two memory options viz. 128 GB or 256 GB. And lastly, it ships with Android 13 with OneUI 5.1 on top.

Camera and the rest

The Samsung Galaxy S23 FE boasts a triple camera setup on the back, led by a 50MP primary sensor. It is coupled with a 12MP ultrawide and 8MP telephone lens. Meanwhile, up on the front, we are getting a 10MP shooter for the selfies.Powering the system is a 4,500 mAh battery that can be juiced up by 25W of fast charging. Similarly, it supports tri-band WiFi and Bluetooth v5.3 for wireless connectivity. It also comes with 5G cellular network and NFC support.

title: Samsung Galaxy A25 5G
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy A25 5G is one of Samsung's midrange offerings for 2024. This smartphone comes with a 6.5-inch super AMOLED screen on the front. Under the hood, it packs the homegrown Exynos 1280 chipset. It comes in two configurations: 8GB + 128GB, and 8GB + 256GB. It has three cameras on the back, among which the primary is a 50MP sensor with OIS support. Meanwhile, on the front, you get a 13MP shooter. This smartphone draws its power from a 5,000 mAh cell with 25W fast charging support.
description:
The South Korean tech giant, Samsung offers a smartphone in every price segment. The Samsung Galaxy A25 5G comes in as their midrange offering for the year 2024.

Samsung Galaxy A25 5G Overview

Design and Display

Starting with the design, Samsung has recently started to adopt a uniform design language for all the Galaxy series. Given that, the Samsung Galaxy A25 has the typical Galaxy design. It does however feature a chequered pattern on the back. Additionally, Samsung has introduced a “Key Island” which is a slight elevation on the phone's frame where all the buttons are located.On the front, a 6.5-inch Super AMOLED panel greets you as the phone's display. It is an FHD+ screen with a 1,080 x 2,340 pixels resolution. Additionally, it comes with a maximum refresh rate of 120Hz. It is available in four colour options: Blue Black, Blue, Light Blue, and Yellow.

Performance

Under the hood, the Galaxy A25 5G comes with the company's in-house Exynos 1280 chip. Based on a 5nm process, it packs two Cortex-A78 cores @2.4GHz and six Cortex-A55 cores @2.0GHz. It is available with 8 gigs of memory coupled with either 128GB or 256GB storage. You get the option to expand your storage to 1TB with a MicroSD card.On the software front, Samsung Galaxy A25 comes with the latest One UI 6.0 based on Android 14. Moreover, you get four years of OS and five years of security updates.

Cameras and Others

In terms of cameras, you get three of them at the back compromising a 50MP primary camera with OIS support. It is assisted by an 8MP f/2.2 ultra-wide lens and a 2MP f/2.4 depth sensor. You get a 13MP snapper with f/2.2 aperture on the front for the selfies.Powering the Samsung Galaxy A25 is a 5,000mAh battery that supports 25W wired charging. Moreover, the biometric option includes a side-mounted fingerprint scanner. Whereas, for audio, it comes with a stereo speaker as well as a 3.5mm headphone jack.

title: Samsung Galaxy S24
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy S24 is the base version of Samsung's flagship lineup of phones for the year 2024. It features an Armored Aluminium body while boasting Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the front as well as the back. The display here measures 6.2 inches diagonally and is a Dynamic AMOLED 2x with 120Hz refresh rate. Meanwhile, for the chipset you either get Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 for Galaxy or Samsung's in-house Exynos 2400, depending on the region. It is available in 8GB+128GB and 8GB+256GB configurations. description:
Samsung Galaxy S24 Overview

Samsung Galaxy S24 is the company's entry-level flagship for the year 2024. This phone is sort of like Samsung's “mini” offering and the successor to the Samsung Galaxy S23.

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy S24 comes with a premium set of materials with an armoured aluminium body and Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the back. title: Asus Vivobook 14X 2023 (13th Gen i7-13700H, 16GB, 512GB, 14" WUXGA)
short_description: Asus VivoBook 14X 2023 has a 14-inch IPS LCD WUXGA screen that can hit a peak brightness of 300 nits. This variant is powered by a 13th Gen Intel Core i7-1300H processor, and it has an integrated Intel Iris Xe GPU. In terms of memory, you can configure it with up to 16GB RAM and a 1TB SSD. The laptop is fueled by a 50Wh battery that charges via a 90W AC adapter. Asus VivoBook 14X OLED weighs around 1.4 kg only, while its lid is made of aluminum. For security, it features a Windows Hello-certified fingerprint sensor.
description:
Asus Vivobook 14X 2023 (K3405VA): Overview

Here's a brief description of the build, performance, and battery life of the Asus Vivobook 14X 2023 with Intels Core i7-13700H processor

Design and Display

The Vivobook 14X has a premium looking sleek design. It features a military-grade design with metal lid while remaining compact and lightweight. Weighing just around 1.4kg, it is easy to carry around and available in 2 color options: Indie Black and Cool Silver.The 14-inch display is an IPS LCD panel of WUXGA (1920x1200) resolution. It covers 45% of the NTSC color gamut and has an aspect ratio of 16:10. The 60Hz screen is a non-touch matte display that can reach a peak brightness of 300 nits.

Performance and Memory

Asus Vivobook 14X (2023) is powered by a 13th Gen Intel Core i7-13700H processor. It has 14 cores (8 Efficiency + 6 Performance) and 20 Threads with a max boost frequency of 5 GHz. On the GPU front, it features integrated Intel Iris Xe graphics. VivoBook 14X ships with 16GB of DDR4 memory which cannot be upgraded any further. With that, you also get 512GB of M.2 SSD, which you can replace with a 1TB one.

Battery and Connectivity

In the tank, Asus VivoBook 14X has a 3-cell 50 Wh Lithium Polymer battery. You can recharge with the 90W adapter in the box.For wired connections, you get 2 USB Type-A ports, a single USB-C port, and an HDMI slot. Moreover, you also get a 3.5mm headphone/microphone jack for your audio needs. Alongside that, you get WIFI 6E and Bluetooth 5.3 technology.

title: Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra
short_description: The new Galaxy S24 Ultra is Samsung's most premium non-foldable smartphone for 2023. It has a similar look to its predecessor, the Galaxy S23 Ultra. However, it is much different specs-wise. Replacing the chipset, the new S24 Ultra comes with a Snapdragon 8 gen 3. Besides, The phone can shoot up to 4K 120 fps, which is unavailable in any smartphone to this date. In addition, this flagship beast packs a 200 MP rear camera, a 50 MP Periscopic lens, a 12 MP Ultra Wide lens, and a 10 MP Telephoto Lens. In addition, one of the eye-catching features of S24 Ultra is the Galaxy AI, which unpacks a lot of cools stuff like Generative AI, Circle to search, and AI Photo editor.
description:
Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra Overview

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra showcases a robust design, weighing 233 grams and boasting an IP68 rating for water and dust resistance. Constructed with a Titanium frame, the device also supports the S-pen for enhanced user interaction. Its 6.8-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2X Infinity-O display features Gorilla Glass Armor for added durability.The display offers a QHD+ resolution of 3088 x 1440 pixels, ensuring crisp visuals. With an Adaptive 120Hz refresh rate and Vision Booster technology, users can expect a smooth and visually optimized experience. The display is capable of reaching up to 2600 nits peak brightness, providing excellent visibility even in bright conditions.

Performance and Storage

Under the hood, the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 for Galaxy, a 4nm mobile platform that ensures top-notch performance. The device comes with 12GB of LPDDR5X RAM, complemented by three options: 256 GB, 512 GB and 1TB of UFS 4.0 storage, providing ample space for applications, media, and files. This robust combination of chipset and memory ensures efficient multitasking, seamless app launches, and smooth overall performance. Running on One UI 6.1 layered on top of Android 14, users can expect a feature-rich and intuitive software experience.

Camera and Battery

The camera setup on the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is a photography powerhouse. The quad-camera system on the rear includes a remarkable 200MP primary lens with Optical Image Stabilization (OIS) and Phase Detection Autofocus (PDAF). It is accompanied by a 12MP ultra-wide-angle lens with a 120º field of view, a 10MP telephoto lens offering 3x optical zoom, and a 50MP periscopic lens with 5x optical zoom.On the front, a 12MP f/2.2 lens takes care of high-quality selfies. The device ensures secure access with an Ultrasonic fingerprint sensor. The substantial 5000mAh battery is equipped with 45W fast charging capability and supports 15W wireless charging, providing users with reliable and flexible charging options. The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is available in Black, Violet, Grey, and Yellow color options, catering to various style preferences.

Extras: Galaxy AI

The latest entry feature in the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is the Galaxy AI, which heightens your convenience level to Max. It comes with cool features like Generative AI, Circle-to-search, AI Camera, AI Photo Editor and Autofill, Notes manager and so much more.
seo_title_facebook: Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra Price, Full Specifications, Comparisons
seo_description_facebook: Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra price, full specifications, comparisons, and more. Find out the complete specs, and price of the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra here.

title: Samsung Galaxy S24+
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy S24+ is the middle-of-the-pack of Samsung's flagship lineup of phones for the year 2024. It features an Armored Aluminium body while boasting Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the front as well as the back. The display here measures 6.7 inches diagonally and is a Dynamic AMOLED 2x with 120Hz refresh rate. Meanwhile, for the chipset you either get Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 for Galaxy or Samsung's in-house Exynos 2400, depending on the region. It is available in 12GB+256GB and 12GB+512GB configurations. For photos, it packs a triple-camera setup on the back led by a 50MP primary sensor, coupled with a 12MP ultrawide and 10MP telephoto shooter. On the front, it sits with a 12MP camera for selfies. Under the hood, it packs a 4,900 mAh cell and ships with OneUI 6.1 based on Android 14.
description:
Samsung Galaxy S24+ Overview

Samsung Galaxy S24+ is the company's mid-level flagship for the year 2024. This phone is the successor to the Samsung Galaxy S23+ and a larger version of the Samsung Galaxy S24 with some add-ons.

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy S24+ comes with a premium set of materials with an armoured aluminium body and Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the back. It measures 158.50 x 75.90 x 7.70 mm in dimension while weighing in at 196 grams. It boasts an IP68 rating and comes in loads of colour options such as Cobalt Violet, Amber Yellow, Onyx Black, Marble Grey, Jade Green, Sapphire Blue, and Sandstone Orange.On the front, we have a 6.7-inch Dynamic AMOLED 2x display that dons the Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2 protection. In terms of resolution, this screen is a QHD+ unit that spans 1440 x 3120 pixels. Similarly, it is capable of a 120Hz refresh rate while boasting a colour depth of 16 million.

Performance

Under the hood, the Galaxy S24+ comes with the in-house Exynos 2400 chipset for the global audience. Meanwhile, the US, South Korea, and China will get to enjoy the custom “For Galaxy” version of the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3.Furthermore, it comes in a sole 12GB memory variant. On the other hand, it comes with two memory options viz. 256GB or 512GB. In terms of software, it ships with Android 14 with OneUI 6.1 on top. This time around, the Samsung Galaxy S24+ comes with Galaxy AI and as such offers tons of AI features.

Camera and the rest

The Samsung Galaxy S24+ boasts a triple camera setup on the back, led by a 50MP primary sensor. It is coupled with a 12MP ultrawide and 10MP telephone lens. Meanwhile, up on the front, we are getting a 12MP shooter for the selfies.Powering the system is a 4,900 mAh battery that can be juiced up by 45W of fast charging. Similarly, it supports tri-band WiFi and Bluetooth v5.3 for wireless connectivity. It also comes with a 5G cellular network, NFC, and UWB support.

title: Samsung Galaxy A15 5G
short_description: Samsung Galaxy A15 5G is the latest midrange offering from the brand. It comes with an updated design with a “key island” on the right. On the front, you get a 6.5-inch Super AMOLED screen with 90Hz refresh rate, 800 nits brightness, and FHD+ resolution. It packs a MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset coupled with up to 8GB RAM and 256GB ROM. The phone runs on Android 14-based OneUI and offers you 4 years of software and 5 years of security updates. Additionally, you have a triple camera setup on the back with a 50MP main, 5MP ultrawide, and 2MP macro lens. The selfie camera is a 13MP unit with face recognition capabilities. It has a 5,000 mAh battery with 25W charging speed. Lastly, you get a 25W charging brick bundled with this phone.
description:
Samsung Galaxy A15 is a new midrange phone, that comes as a successor to last year's Samsung Galaxy A14. The phone is available in two different connectivity options, but the 5G variant hit the Nepali shelves first.

Samsung Galaxy A15 5G Overview

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy A15 is an all-plastic phone with a rounded rectangle shape and a patterned finish. It comes in a similar design to the Samsung Galaxy A25 5G with a “key island” on the right. It is available in three colours: Blue Black, Blue, Light Blue, and Yellow.For display, the phone features a 6.5” display with a waterdrop camera cutout. Moreover, the panel here is a Super AMOLED with FHD+ (1,080 x 2,340 pixels) resolution. You get a refresh rate of 90Hz on this phone along with a peak brightness of 800 nits and a Vision Booster feature.

Performance and Battery

Samsung has gone with MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset on the Samsung Galaxy A15 5G. It is an octa-core processor following a 6nm fabrication process with a peak clock speed of 2.2 GHz.Furthermore, the SoC is coupled with up to 8GB RAM and 256GB storage. We can further expand the storage up to 1 TB via a MicroSD card. It runs on Android 14 with OneUI 6.0 on top of it.

Camera and the rest

The Samsung Galaxy A15 5G comes with four cameras altogether. On the back, we get a triple camera setup led by a 50MP primary sensor. You have a 5MP ultrawide shooter and a 2MP macro lens assisting the main camera. Meanwhile, on the front you get a 13MP camera doing the work.As a power supply, the Samsung Galaxy 15 5G goes with a 5,000 mAh non-removable cell. The phone supports 25W fast charging via Type-C. You get a free 25W charging brick bundled with the phone in Nepal. In terms of connectivity, the phone supports dual-band WiFi, dual SIM 5G, Bluetooth v5.3, and a five-way navigation system. It also has a headphone jack along with NFC support.

title: Samsung Galaxy A35 5G
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy A35 5G is the companys 2024 midrange offering. This phone comes with quite a design overhaul from its predecessor — starting with flat edges. The company has swapped out the plastic back for glass while integrating a bump for buttons. On the front, you get a 6.6-inch Super AMOLED screen with Corning Gorilla Glass Victus+ protection. It also boasts an IP67 rating. Under the hood, you get Samsungs in-house Exynos 1380 chipset with improved vapor chamber cooling. Other than that, it comes with up to 8GB memory coupled with up to 256GB storage. For software, you get Android 14 with OneUI 6.1 on top. You can enjoy four years of OS updates and five years of security patches on this phone. In the rear, you get a triple camera setup comprising 50MP primary, 8MP ultrawide, and 5MP macro. Samsung has finally ditched the Infinity-U cutout on their midrange devices from this one!
description:
Samsung is one of the most popular smartphone brands in the world with a wide selection of offerings. The Samsung Galaxy A35 5G is the companys midrange smartphone for the year 2024!

Samsung Galaxy A35 5G Overview

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy A35 5G gets quite a design overhaul without deviating much from the classic “Galaxy design” we are familiar with. The design tweaks include the introduction of a glass back, a flat frame, and integration of “Key Island” as we saw in the Galaxy A15 5G and Galaxy A25 5G. The colour options include Awesome Ice Blue, Awesome Lilac, and Awesome Navy.On the front, you are getting a 6.6-inch Super AMOLED screen. It stretches 1,080 x 2,340 pixels achieving an FHD+ resolution. Meanwhile, you get a 120Hz refresh rate, a colour depth of 16M, and 1,000 nits brightness. In addition to that, the Samsung Galaxy A35 5G comes with Corning Gorilla Glass Victus+ protection and an IP67 rating.

Performance and the rest

Under the hood, this phone packs the in-house Exynos 1380 chipset which was featured in the Samsung Galaxy A54 5G (Review). This processor has eight cores, 5nm fabrication, and a peak clock speed of 2.40 GHz. Moreover, Samsung says the phone comes with an improved vapour chamber cooling system. In addition to that, you get up to 8GB of memory and up to 256GB of storage. You can expand the storage up to 1TB. Furthermore, the Samsung Galaxy A35 5G offers you four years of OS updates and five years of security patches.In the optics department, you get a 50MP primary shooter. An 8MP ultrawide camera and a 5MP macro lens further assist the main camera. In the meantime, you get a 13MP selfie camera on the front. Additionally, you get an “Infinity-O” camera cutout, which is one of the most welcome design changes. This phone draws its power from a 5,000 mAh cell with 25W charging capability.

title: Samsung Galaxy A55 5G
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy A55 5G is the companys 2024 premium midrange offering. This phone comes with slight design tweaks from its predecessor — starting with flat edges. The company has swapped out the plastic frames for aluminium while integrating a bump for buttons. On the front, you get a 6.6-inch Super AMOLED screen with Corning Gorilla Glass Victus+ protection. It also boasts an IP67 rating. Under the hood, you get Samsungs in-house Exynos 1480 chipset with improved GPU and NPU. Meanwhile, you also get an improved cooling unit. Other than that, it comes with up to 12GB memory coupled with up to 256GB storage. For software, you get Android 14 with OneUI 6.1 on top. You can enjoy four years of OS updates and five years of security patches on this phone. In the rear, you get a triple camera setup comprising of 50MP primary, 12MP ultrawide, and 5MP macro. On the front, you get a 32MP shooter.
description:
Samsung is one of the most popular smartphone brands in the world with a wide selection of offerings. The Samsung Galaxy A55 5G is the companys premium-midrange smartphone for the year 2024!

Samsung Galaxy A55 5G Overview

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy A55 5G gets a bit of design retouch without deviating much from the classic “Galaxy design” we are familiar with. The design tweaks include the use of aluminium as the choice of material, a flat frame, and integration of “Key Island” as we saw in the Galaxy A15 5G and Galaxy A25 5G. The colour options include Awesome Ice Blue, Awesome Lemon, Awesome Lilac, and Awesome Navy.On the front, you are getting a 6.6-inch Super AMOLED screen. It stretches 1,080 x 2,340 pixels achieving an FHD+ resolution. Meanwhile, you get a 120Hz refresh rate, a colour depth of 16M, and 1,000 nits brightness. In addition to that, the Samsung Galaxy A55 5G comes with Corning Gorilla Glass Victus+ protection and an IP67 rating.

Under the hood, this phone packs the in-house Exynos 1480 chipset. This processor has eight cores and a peak clock speed of 2.75 GHz. Moreover, Samsung says the phone comes with an improved GPU, NPU, and an integrated cooling system. In addition to that, you get up to 12GB of memory and up to 256GB of storage. You can expand the storage up to 1TB. Furthermore, the Samsung Galaxy A55 5G offers you four years of OS updates and five years of security patches.In the optics department, you get a 50MP primary shooter. It is further coupled with a 12MP ultrawide camera and a 5MP macro lens. In the meantime, you get a 32MP selfie camera on the front. title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6
short_description: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 is the companys 2024 clamshell foldable offering that comes with quite a few upgrades from its predecessor. The frames have gone flat while the camera cutouts get the same colour casing as the phone. The displays, inside and out, remain mostly the same. The inner display can go as bright as 2,600 nits this time around. Under the hood, we get the upgraded Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, 12GB RAM, and a storage choice of 256GB, and 512GB. This phone also gets the Galaxy AI and 7 years of software updates moving forward. The primary camera and the battery also receive an upgrade at 50MP and 4,000 mAh respectively. Meanwhile, the ultrawide camera, front shooter, and the charging speeds remain the same.
description:
Are you for a phone that is truly unique, but does not cut corners in terms of performance? Then you might want to consider getting the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6.

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 Overview

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 is the companys fifth iteration of a clamshell-style foldable (they skipped the Z Flip2 to match numbers with the Z Fold). Aesthetically, this phone looks much more neater than its predecessor. On this iteration, Samsung is matching the colour of the camera casing with the rest of the phone. Meanwhile, the frame has gone totally flat, dust and water resistance has gone up to IP48 and comes in seven different colours (three of which are online exclusive).The screen department on the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 does not see many changes. Inside, you get the same 6.7-inch Infinity Flex display. It is a Dynamic AMOLED 2X panel with FHD+ resolution and 120Hz refresh rate. The inner screen can glow a lot brighter at 2,600 nits tops. In the meantime, the outer screen is a 3.4-inch Super AMOLED panel with a standard 60Hz refresh rate. Additionally, it has a 720 x 748 pixels resolution and dons a Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2 protection. The inner screen does not enjoy any such luxury because it obviously needs to — fold.

Performance and the rest

For performance, this foldable taps into the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor but the one that Qualcomm specifically boosted for Galaxy phones. The memory on this thing has gone up to 12GB, which is the only variation available. On the other hand, Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 is available 256GB and 512GB storage options. The phone now has a much-needed vapour chamber, which is the first time for the series. Likewise, the battery capacity has also gone up to 4,000 mAh — a respectable amount.This year the lower member of the series finally gets a camera upgrade. Now the primary shooter on this thing is a 50MP unit, a great leap from the 12MP on previous generations. Likewise, the ultrawide remains at 12MP, but the actual sensor has apparently grown bigger. On the front, it is still the same 10MP shooter. Given its form factor, the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 comes with all the quirky software features. Like every other product this year, Galaxy AI supercharges this phone as well! It even gets a specialised use mode for the Interpreter feature! While we do see substantial upgrades in many areas, this phone sadly still keeps the 25W charging speed.
  • Meanwhile, check out other Samsung phones available in Nepal

title: Samsung Galaxy A06
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy A06, launched in Nepal, features a 6.7-inch HD+ display with a 90Hz refresh rate, a dual-camera system (50MP main, 2MP depth), and an 8MP front camera. It’s powered by a Mediatek Helio G85 SoC, with 4GB or 6GB of RAM, and 64GB or 128GB of storage. The phone runs on Android 14 with OneUI Core and includes a 5000mAh battery with 25W fast charging. Connectivity options include 4G, WiFi 5, Bluetooth 5.3, and USB Type-C.
description:
Samsung Galaxy A06 Overview

Design and Display

The Galaxy A06 sticks to the familiar Samsung style for budget smartphones, featuring an all-plastic build, a U-shaped notch display, and a noticeably larger chin at the bottom. Moreover, the camera design remains consistent, with a protruding lens and an LED flash positioned beside it.As for the display, it boasts a 6.7-inch PLS LCD panel with an HD+ resolution. Furthermore, a notable upgrade in this model is the introduction of a 90Hz refresh rate, replacing the previous static 60Hz.

Performance

Under the hood, the Galaxy A06 comes with a MediaTek Helio G85 SoC. Besides, this 12nm processor supports 4G connectivity and includes two Cortex-A75 cores running at 2.0GHz, alongside six Cortex-A55 cores clocked at 1.8GHz. Graphics are managed by a Mali-G52 MC2 GPU. Also, the terms of memory and storage options, the phone offers choices of 4GB or 6GB of RAM and 64GB or 128GB of internal storage.On the software front, the device runs on Android 14 with Samsungs OneUI Core. Additionally, Samsung has committed to providing two years of OS updates and four years of security patches.

Camera and the rest

The Galaxy A06 features a dual-camera system, including a 50MP main camera and a 2MP depth sensor. For selfies and video calls, theres an 8MP front-facing camera.Moreover, the phone is powered by a 5000mAh battery with 25W fast charging support. Connectivity options include 4G, VoLTE, dual-band WiFi 5, Bluetooth 5.3, GPS, and a USB Type-C port.
  • Also, check out our Samsung Galaxy A05 article.

title: OnePlus 10 Pro
short_description: OnePlus' flagship phone for 2022—the OnePlus 10 Pro—made its debut in China back in January. And now, the phone is available for pre-order in Nepal as well alongside a bunch of offers.
description:
OnePlus 10 Pro Overview:

Here, we will discuss the full specifications and price of the OnePlus 10 Pro.

Design, Display

To begin with, the OnePlus 10 Pro features a 6.7-inch 2K AMOLED display with a refresh rate of 120Hz. This is backed by LTPO 2.0 technology, which allows the display to switch between 1 and 120Hz depending on the content.[gallery td_gallery_title_input="OnePlus 10 Pro" td_select_gallery_slide="slide" size="full" columns="2" ids="117359,117360"]The 10 Pro is noticeably different from its predecessor in terms of design. The camera module at the back blends into the frame seamlessly—similar to what we've first seen on the Galaxy S21 series.

Performance

Now, given that it's the company's flagship product of the year, it's unsurprising that the OnePlus 10 Pro arrives with Qualcomm's latest Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 processor. Similarly, it includes a 340 sq.cm surface area covered vapor chamber cooling to keep thermals under control. The memory option includes up to 12GB of LPDDR5 RAM and up to 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage. In terms of software, it boots on OxygenOS based on Android 12.

Camera, Others

Moving on to the cameras, there are three on the back: a 48MP primary lens, a 50MP ultrawide (150° FOV), and an 8MP telephoto lens. Both the primary and telephoto camera enjoys OIS for steady footage. And, not to forget, like last year's OnePlus 9 series, there's Hasselblad color calibration on these cameras too.Furthermore, the OnePlus 10 Pro features a 5000mAh battery with support for 80W wired and 50W wireless charging. For audio, it has a stereo speaker setup with Dolby Atmos support.

title: OnePlus Nord CE 2 5G
short_description: OnePlus Nord CE 2 is the company's latest mid-range phone that comes with popular Oxygen OS and 64MP triple-camera setup.
description:
OnePlus Nord CE 2 5G Overview, Price:

Here, we will discuss the full specifications and price of the OnePlus Nord CE 2 5G.

Design, Display

OnePlus Nord CE 2 is the successor to last year's Nord CE. Yet, it differs heavily from its predecessor in terms of design. It has a rectangular camera layout on the rear that flows seamlessly with the back panel—contrary to the elongated camera layout of its predecessor. The phone is fairly slim at 7.8mm and weighs 173 grams. However, it misses out on a classic OnePlus alert slider.The smartphone boasts a 6.43-inch AMOLED panel with a 90Hz refresh rate, HDR 10+ certification, and Gorilla Glass 5 protection. The OnePlus Nord CE 2 is available in two color options—Bahamas Blue and Gray Mirror.

Performance

When it comes to performance, it comes with Dimensity 900 5G chipset. It's a 6nm processor that features brings two Cortex-A78 (@2.4GHz) and six Cortex-A55 (@2GHz) CPU cores alongside Arm’s Mali-G68 MC4 GPU. Likewise, the memory option includes up to 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage.While Nepal gets only 8/128GB variant, along with it India also has a 6/128GB models.On the software front, the OnePlus Nord CE 2 ships with last year's Android 11 with OxygenOS 11.3 out of the box. It is slated to get two years of platform and three years of software updates.

Cameras, Others

Moving on, the Nord CE 2 hosts the same set of cameras as its predecessor. It has a triple camera setup that comprises a 64MP primary sensor, an 8MP ultrawide, and a 2MP macro sensor. Then, there's a 16MP selfie camera on the left-aligned punch-hole cutout at the front. Powering the phone is a 4,500mAh cell that supports 65W SuperVOOC charging.Check out the full specifications and price of the OnePlus Nord CE 2 below:
seo_title_facebook: OnePlus Nord CE 2 5G Price, Full Specifications
seo_description_facebook: OnePlus Nord CE 2 5G price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs, price of the OnePlus Nord CE 2 5G here.

title: OnePlus Nord 2T 5G
short_description: Prior to its global release, OnePlus debuted the OnePlus Nord 2T in Nepal. The phone is an upgrade over last year's OnePlus Nord 2, and it has the latest MediaTek Dimensity 1300 mobile silicon. The charging speed has also been boosted to 80W. The Nord 2T retains the Nord 2's triple camera setup, which comprises a 50MP primary sensor, an 8MP ultrawide sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor. Similarly, the display remains unchanged, with a 6.43-inch AMOLED screen and a refresh rate of 90Hz.
description:
OnePlus Nord 2T 5G Overview:

Design, Display

OnePlus Nord 2T has pretty much the same specifications as last year's Nord 2. It comes with the same 6.43-inch AMOLED screen with Full HD+ resolution. The screen supports a 90Hz refresh rate and is HDR 10+ certified which allows HDR content consumption on platforms like YouTube.The OnePlus Nord 2T 5G sports a rectangular camera island on the back and a left-aligned hole-punch cutout for the selfie camera up front. It is available in two colorways, Jade Fog and Grey Shadow.

Performance

The Nord 2T replaces the Nord 2's Dimensity 1200 with the brand new MediaTek Dimensity 1300. It's a new MediaTek 6nm mobile silicon with four Cortex-A78 cores, one at 3GHz and three at 2.6GHz, and four Cortex-A55 cores at 2GHz. Similarly, a 9-core Arm Mali GPU handles graphics. For improved gaming performance, the new chipset supports HyperEngine 5.0.The device runs Oxygen OS 12.1, which is based on Android 12. OnePlus has also promised up to three years of software support and an additional year of security updates.

Camera, Others

For the camera, the company has kept the old setup on the OnePlus Nord 2T. On the back, it has a triple camera setup led by a 50MP Sony IMX766 primary sensor. It is accompanied by an 8MP ultrawide and a 2MP monochrome sensor. For selfies and video calls, there's a 32MP IMX615 sensor on the front.A 4,500mAh battery powers the phone. While the Nord 2 supported a charging speed of up to 65W, the Nord 2T supports 80W of fast charging. For added security, there is an in-display fingerprint sensor.Connectivity-wise, the phone supports 5G, Bluetooth 5.2, GPS, and NFC. OnePlus has also included an X-axis linear motor and dual stereo speakers.

It is powered by the same Snapdragon 695 5G chipset as its predecessor. The chipset is paired with 8GB of RAM and up to 256GB of onboard storage. You will get the taste of OxygenOS 13.1 based on Android 13 in this smartphone. OnePlus has provided a 108MP ISOCELL HM6 primary sensor in this device which is accompanied by a couple of 2MP macro and depth sensors. Moreover, there is a 16MP camera at the front for selfies underneath the punch-hole cutout. Nord CE 3 Lite is fueled by a 5000mAh battery which supports 67W SUPERVOOC charging. But OnePlus has provided an 80W charging brick inside the box.

title: OnePlus Nord 3
short_description: OnePlus Nord 3 is a premium midrange smartphone bringing flagship-esque specs at a more affordable price point. It is powered by the leading 4nm MediaTek 9000 chipset and comes with up to 16GB of LPDDR5X RAM. Besides that, it has a large 5000mAh battery and supports up to 80W fast charging. The Nord 3 has a triple camera setup, comprising a 50MP primary sensor, an 8MP ultrawide sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor. Similarly, the display is a 6.74-inch AMOLED screen with a refresh rate of 120Hz.
description:
OnePlus Nord 3  Overview:

Design, Display

OnePlus Nord 3 brings improvements to last year's Nord 2. It comes with a larger 6.74-inch AMOLED screen with Full HD+ resolution. The screen supports a higher 120Hz refresh rate and is HDR 10+ certified which allows HDR content consumption on platforms like YouTube.The OnePlus Nord 3 doesn't have a camera island and sports a hole-punch cutout for the selfie camera up front. It is available in two colorways, Misty Green and Tempest Grey.

Performance

The Nord 3 replaces the Nord 2's Dimensity 1200 with the more capable MediaTek Dimensity 9000 chipset. It's a MediaTek 4nm mobile silicon with a single prime Cortex X2 Core, three Cortex-A710 cores, and four Cortex-A510 cores. Similarly, the Mali G710 GPU handles graphics. For improved gaming performance, the new chipset supports HyperEngine 5.0.The device runs Oxygen OS 13.1, which is based on Android 13. OnePlus has also promised up to three years of software support and an additional year of security updates.

Camera, Others

For photos and videos, the company has provided a triple camera setup on the OnePlus Nord 3 led by a 50MP Sony primary sensor and complemented by an 8MP ultrawide and a 2MP monochrome sensor. For selfies and video calls, there's a 16MP sensor on the front.A 5000mAh battery powers the phone. While the Nord 2 supported a charging speed of up to 65W, the Nord 3 supports 80W of fast charging. For added security, there is an in-display fingerprint sensor.Connectivity-wise, the phone supports 5G, Bluetooth 5.2, GPS, and NFC. OnePlus has also included an X-axis linear motor and dual stereo speakers.

title: OnePlus Nord N30 SE 5G
short_description: OnePlus Nord N30 SE 5G is an offering from the brand at an affordable price bracket. This phone comes with a 6.72-inch LCD on the front with FHD+ resolution. Meanwhile, it relies on the MediaTek Dimensity 6020 chipset. It comes in a single 4GB + 128GB configuration. Additionally, it also offers a dual-camera setup on the back consisting of a 50MP primary and 2MP depth sensor. On the front, a single 8MP shooter sits underneath the centre-aligned hole-punch cutout. It has a 5,000 mAh battery and supports 33W of charging capability.
description:
OnePlus Nord is a series of rather affordable and midrange phones. The OnePlus Nord N30 SE 5G sits in a lower price bracket and comes in as an okay-ish offering!

OnePlus Nord N30 SE 5G Overview

Design and Display

Following the trend, the OnePlus Nord N30 SE 5G comes in a flat frame. It has a rectangular camera island on the back that houses two cameras and a flashlight. Similarly, the phone flaunts the company logo right at the centre. It is available in two finishes: Cyan Sparkle, and Black Satin.Meanwhile, we have a 6.72-inch screen greeting us on the front. The panel here is an LTPS LCD with a pixel density of 391 PPI. The screen measures FHD+ in resolution spanning 1,080 x 2,400 pixels. The company has not specified the refresh rate of this screen, which would suggest that the OnePlus Nord N30 SE is only capable of a 60Hz refresh rate.

Performance

This phone packs the MediaTek Dimensity 6020 chipset to deliver its performance. This processor is an octa-core silicone that follows 7nm lithography and clocks in at a maximum of 2.2 GHz.In the meantime, the OnePlus Nord N30 SE 5G offers a sole 4GB + 128GB configuration. You don't have an option to expand the storage in here either. On the software side of things, this phone ships with OxygenOS 13.1 based on Android 13.

Camera and the rest

Talking of the cameras, you get a dual-camera setup on the back. The primary shooter here is a 50MP sensor. It is then assisted with a 2MP depth sensor. On the front, we are getting an 8MP snapper for selfies and face recognition.The OnePlus Nord N30 SE 5G draws its power from a 5,000 mAh cell while supporting 33W fast charging. Other than that, it comes with dual SIM, 5G cellular, dual-band WiFi, Bluetooth v5.3, and NFC support. For wired connection, we have a sole USB Type-C port. Meanwhile, we also have a side-mounted fingerprint sensor for further security and stereo speakers with 300% Ultra Volume Mode for media consumption.

title: OnePlus Nord 4
short_description: OnePlus Nord 4 is a premium midrange smartphone bringing flagship-esque specs at a more decent price point. It is powered by the latest Snapdragon 7+ Gen 3 chipset and comes with up to 12GB of LPDDR5X RAM. Besides that, it has a large 5500mAh battery and supports up to 100W fast charging. The Nord 4 has a triple camera setup, comprising a 50MP primary sensor, and an 8MP ultrawide sensor. Similarly, the display is a 6.74-inch AMOLED screen with a refresh rate of 120Hz.
description:
Lets have a quick overview of the latest OnePlus Nord 4 below.

OnePlus Nord 4 Overview

Display and Design

The OnePlus Nord 4 features a 6.74-inch Tianma U8+ OLED display with a resolution of 2772×1240 pixels and a 120Hz refresh rate. The display has a peak brightness of 2150 nits. On the design side, the Nord 4 comes with a refreshing look.The OnePlus Nord 4 features a straightforward design, which they call the “only metal unibody smartphone on the planet in the 5G era” in a dual-tone rear panel. The smartphone comes in three colourways; the Mercurial Silver features two large camera lenses and a flash in the upper section, while the lower section has a textured finish with diagonal lines. At the same time, other colours remain Obsidian Midnight and Oasis Green.

Performance and Storage

The Nord 4 is powered by the Snapdragon 7+ Gen3 processor, an upgrade from the Nord 3’s Dimensity 9000. Talking of this processor, it is an Octa-core silicon with one prime Cortex-X4 core at 2.8GHz, four Cortex-A720 cores at 2.6GHz, and three Cortex-A520 cores at 1.9GHz. To compare, this chipset provides flagship-level performance, having comparable benchmark scores with the last-gen Titan Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 and even closer to this year’s 8s Gen 3 processor.It includes up to 12GB LPDDR5X RAM and up to 256GB UFS 4.0 storage. Moreover, the OnePlus Nord 4 also features 0.0179 square meters of cooling technology. The smartphone runs on Android 14. OnePlus promises four major Android updates and six years of security updates.

OnePlus Nord 4: Camera System

The rear camera setup includes a 50MP main camera (LYT600) with OIS and an 8MP ultra-wide camera. The front camera is 16MP. Moreover, the OnePlus Nord 4 has an in-display fingerprint sensor and stereo speakers with Dolby Atmos support. The device has a 5500mAh battery and supports 100W SuperVOOC fast charging. The Nord 4 includes an IR Blaster, 0809 AAC linear motor, an alert slider as well

title: iPhone 11
short_description: Apple released the iPhone 11 back in 2019. Yet, it's still a capable device for day-to-day use.
description:
iPhone 11 Overview, Price:

Here, we will walk through the full specifications and price of the iPhone 11.

Design and Display

The iPhone 13 comes with a 6.1-inch Liquid Retina IPS LCD display with 625nits of typical brightness 828 x 1792 pixels resolution. The smartphone has an oleophobic coating to prevent fingerprints. The smartphone features a notch on the front and a squared camera module on the back. Similarly, the frames are built of aluminum.

Performance

Under the hood, the iPhone 11 is powered by an A13 Bionic chip. Despite being a two-generation older chipset, it is adequate for everyday chores and casual gaming. Similarly, the device is available with up to 256GB of storage. In terms of battey, it has a 3,110 mAh cell that supports 18W fast charging. Unlike its successors, a compatible charger is included in the box.

Camera, Others

Moreover, it has a couple of 12MP lenses at the back. The primary lens features optical image stabilization (OIS), while the ultrawide lens has a field of view (FOV) of 120 °. For selfies, it has a 12MP sensor on the aforementioned notch. Both the back and front cameras are capable of recording up to 4K@60fps video.Moreover, the connectivity option includes WiFi 6 (802.11ax), 5G, Bluetooth 5.0, e-SIM (dual), GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, QZSS, and BeiDou.

title: iPhone 15 Pro Max
short_description: iPhone 15 Pro Max is Apple's biggest and most expensive iPhone of 2023. It brings a massive 6.7\" Super Retina XDR OLED display with the \"Dynamic Island\" hole-punch cutout, alongside a revamped camera system and more. The upgraded camera array on the iPhone 15 Pro Max now consists of a 5X telephoto zoom lens over last year's 3x. Besides that, the 48MP primary sensor, and 12MP ultrawide are the same. You can now shoot ProRes video directly to an external SSD thanks to the USB-C port (10 gigabits per second). As expected, the iPhone 15 Pro Max is powered by the all-new 3nm A17 Pro chip. It also boasts a big 4,323mAh battery, which is interestingly slightly smaller than what you get on the cheaper iPhone 15 Plus.
description:
iPhone 15 Pro Max Overview

Build and Display

The new iPhone 15 Pro Max now sports a titanium alloy frame which not only makes it more durable but lighter as well. Pair that with the slightly curved edges, and the newer Pro Max is much more comfortable in the hand compared to its predecessor. The entire 15 lineup ditches the iconic lighting port for the universal USB-C port. In the 15 Pro Max, this should allow for faster data transfer and charging speeds.The display panel itself seems unchanged but the bezels are even slimmer this time around. The screen is a 6.7 inch "Super Retina XDR" OLED with a 120Hz refresh rate, 2,000 nits of peak brightness, 2796 x 1290 resolution, and a pixel density of 460 ppi. It’s got the same “Ceramic Shield” display protection too.

Processor 

Under the hood, the iPhone 15 Pro Max features the all-new 3nm A17 Pro chipset. This Apple Silicon features 6 CPU cores alongside 6 GPU cores and a 16-core Neural Engine. Apple promises up to 20% improved GPU performance which should help with gaming and graphically intensive workloads.Although unofficial, the 15 Pro Max ships with 8 GB RAM which is an increase from the 6GB in the iPhone 14 Pro Max.

Cameras

The iPhone 15 Pro Max has a triple camera layout on its back. Led by the 48MP primary shooter, the 12MP ultra-wide and 12MP telephoto act as complementary lenses. The telephoto camera has been upgraded from 3X zoom capable to 5X zoom capable using a "tetraprism" design. Over the front, you'll find a 12MP selfie camera housed in the Dynamic Island alongside the True Depth sensor for Face id.

Others

Other features include support for up to 10 gigabits per second data transfer speeds thanks to the USB-C port and USB 3 controller on the A17 Pro chip. There's also satellite connectivity for emergency SOS, crash detection, and roadside assistance. Connectivity options include the same Bluetooth 5.3, WiFi 6E, dual-frequency GPS, and NFC. There's a second-gen UWB chip which should help with improved Ultra Wide Band connections.
seo_title_facebook: iPhone 15 Pro Max Price, Full Specifications, Comparisons
seo_description_facebook: iPhone 15 Pro Max price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs and price of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max here.

title: Remax CozyPods W7N
short_description: The Remax CozyPods W7N is a modern earbud with a minimalist design casing and features a sensitive touch sensor, and an in-ear design. It features two driver with 32 ohms of impedance, a high-quality microphone, and Bluetooth 5.3 technology for wireless connectivity. The earbuds have a impressive battery life, providing 7 hours of playback time and 28 hours of use with a charging case.
description:
Remax CozyPods W7N Overview:

Design

The Remax CozyPods W7N features fairly a simple design, coming in black and white colors. In addition to that, the stems house a sensitive" touch sensor for controls.Moreover, the earbuds have a in-ear design. And theyre available in la lightweight design of only 40 gm.

Audio and Connectivity:

Moving on, the CozyPods boasts a two-driver unit with 32 ohms of impedance. The drivers are rated at 2 mW power and provide highs as high as 20kHz and lows as low as 20Hz. Plus, they have a high-quality microphone for clear phone calls, according to the company.It uses Bluetooth 5.3 technology for wireless connectivity, offering a stable connection with a range of up to 10 meters. Besides, the Remax CozyPods W7N is compatible with both Android and iOS devices.

Battery

The earbuds themselves provide approximately 7 hours of playback time. But heres the cool part: the charging case can recharge them up to four times, giving you a total of up to 28 hours of use.

title: iPhone 15 Pro
short_description: The iPhone 15 Pro lineup now features a titanium body that is not only stronger but noticeably lighter too. Powering the iPhone 15 Pro is Apple's new A17 Pro chip, built using a 3nm process. The iPhone 15 Pro doesn't enjoy a lot of camera upgrades though, at least in the hardware department. The 48MP primary sensor with second-generation sensor-shift OIS (and pixel binning), alongside a 12MP ultrawide, and a 12MP telephoto lens are all the same cameras from last year's 14 Pro. The 6.1\" Super Retina XDR OLED display is also the same as its predecessor. But, there's a new programmable \"Action Button\" which replaces the mute switch.
description:
iPhone 15 Pro Overview

Build and Display

The new iPhone 15 Pro sports a titanium alloy frame which adds durability to the design. It is also lighter at 187 grams compared to the 206-gram-ed 14 Pro. Other design changes include the replacement of the mute switch with a new programmable "Action Button" similar to what we saw in the Apple Watch Ultra and Ultra 2. But arguably the most noticeable change is the USB-C port over the iconic lightning.As for the display, unfortunately, we don't see any upgrades here. But it is still an excellent screen. The 6.1" Super Retina XDR OLED panel comes with 120Hz ProMotion and 2,000 nits brightness. The LTPO panel can vary from 1Hz to 120Hz whenever necessary. It has got the same “Ceramic Shield” protection that we’ve been seeing since the iPhone 12.But one thing that’s different is its bezels, Apple has managed to fit the same screen in a slightly smaller chassis leading to minimal bezels on the iPhone 15 Pro.

Processor

Powering the Pro iPhone is Apple's latest A17 Pro SOC. This Apple Silicon promises up to 10% improvement over last year's A16 Bionic. The 3nm chip has an extra GPU core and promises up to 20% improvement in graphical performance. The 16-core neural engine is also twice as fast compared to the last gen. The iPhone 15 Pro also comes with 8GB of RAM for multitasking.

Cameras

Moving on to the cameras, we don't see any noticeable changes here. Though the phone has improved Photonic Engine and Smart HDR 5, that is not exclusive to the 15 Pro. The triple camera setup on the back still consists of a 48MP primary, a 12MP ultrawide, and a 12MP telephoto camera with up to 3X optical zoom. On the front, the 12MP selfie cam is accompanied by a True Depth Sensor for Faceid. One cool trick of the new iPhones is the ability to capture depth information on all shots. This allows you to change focus points, or turn normal shots to portraits later down the road. Another feature on the Pros is the ability to capture Spatial video that you'll be able to relive in the Apple Vision Pro.

Rest of the specs

The Pro models have faster USB-3 speeds (up to 10 gigabits per second) compared to the 15 and 15 Plus (USB 2.0 speeds). For wireless connections, you get WiFi 6E, Bluetooth 5.3, dual-frequency GPS, and NFC. Ultra-wideband (UWB) connections might see an improvement with the second-gen UWB chip.
seo_title_facebook: iPhone 15 Pro Price, Full Specifications, Comparisons
seo_description_facebook: iPhone 15 Pro price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs and price of the Apple iPhone 15 Pro here.

title: iPhone 15
short_description: The iPhone 15 shares an identical visual to the iPhone 14. It features the same aluminum frame as its predecessor with a textured matte finish and a Super Retina XDR display with FHD+ resolution. It runs on the A16 Bionic chip with 6GB of RAM and storage options of 128GB, 256GB, or 512 GB. Having said this there is a boost in camera setup; it comes with a dual camera setup having a 48MP primary sensor (from 12MP) and 12MP ultrawide, along with a 12MP TrueDepth front camera. The phone adopts USB Type-C but features USB 2.0 speed. Notably, it introduces \"Roadside Assistance\" with satellite connectivity.
description:
On September 12, Apple launched four new iPhones and two Apple Watches. Among them, the standard iPhone 15 stands out with only minor design and build upgrades, but it offers a performance boost compared to the vanilla iPhone 14. Without further ado, let's get right into the specifications of the all-new iPhone 15.

iPhone 15 Overview

Design and Display

The iPhone 15 features an aerospace-grade aluminum frame with a rear panel polished from nanocrystalline particles for a textured matte finish. The Super Retina XDR screen it comes with, bears an FHD+ resolution (2556 x 1179 pixels), HDR10, Dolby Vision, 2,000 nits of peak brightness, and Ceramic Shield glass protection. Sadly, the refresh rate has stayed the same at 60Hz.Likewise, you get an IP68 rating for protection against dust and water drips. Apple ships this guy in five color options: Black, Blue, Green, Yellow, and Pink. What’s new this time in iPhone 15 is the arrival of Dynamic Island.

Performance

Running the show on the core is Apple’s last year chipset, the A16 Bionic. This 4nm-fabbed chip features a hexa-core architecture with two Everest cores at 3.46GHz and four Sawtooth cores at 2.0GHz clock speeds. The Apple 5-core GPU is responsible for handling gaming and graphics-related workloads.In terms of memory, it offers 6GB of RAM and comes in three storage options: 128GB, 256GB, and 512GB, though storage is not user-upgradeable. The all-new iPhone 15 boots on iOS 17.

Battery

iPhone 15 comes with a non-removable Li-Ion battery with a capacity of 3300 mAh, which supports fast charging at 20W, as well as 15W MagSafe and 7.5W Qi magnetic wireless charging. This iPhone variant offers up to 20 hours of video playback on a single charge, but it's important to note that it doesn't include a charger in the box.

Camera

There is again the dual camera setup in iPhone 15, with the primary shooter getting a resolution bump, with a 48MP sensor. This quad-pixel camera brings 100% Focus Pixels for swift autofocus. Next is a 12MP ultrawide camera that offers a wide 120° field of view.Moving to the front, you get a 12MP TrueDepth camera engraved on the Dynamic Island which also doubles as a 3D face scanner for biometrics security.

Ports and Features

With the EU mandating a USB-C port in different consumer electronic goods in its region, Apple has finally shifted to USB Type C on the entire iPhone 15 Series. Unfortunately, the vanilla model equips a slower USB 2.0 port.The phone still has functions like emergency SOS, accident detection, and satellite connectivity. This time, Apple has also released "Roadside Assistance," which uses a satellite link to provide assistance for cars in remote locations without cellular service.
seo_title_facebook: iPhone 15 Price, Full Specifications, Comparisons
seo_description_facebook: iPhone 15 price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs and price of the Apple iPhone 15 here.

title: Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2021 (Ryzen 7 5800H, RTX 3060, 16GB, 1TB, 16 WQXGA 165Hz)
short_description: Legion 5 Pro is the best gaming laptop that Lenovo has to offer. The 2021 iteration of the laptop brings an all-aluminum design, Ryzen 5000-series CPUs, and RTX 30-series GPUs. The CPU-GPU combo is paired with Lenovo's in-house cooling solution and AI Engine to maximize fps in games.
description:
Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2021 Overview:

Here's a brief overview of the build, chipset, and battery life of the Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2021 (Ryzen 7).

Design, Display

Legion Lenovo 5 Pro features an all-aluminum chassis, differentiating it from the vanilla Legion 5. Another way to distinguish the two is by looking at the Legion "Y" branding on the lid. Based on the color variant, it will glow either blue or white on the Legion 5 Pro. Further, the thickness of the laptop ranges from 21.7 to 26.85 mm. Likewise, the weight is listed at 2.45 kg.Opening the lid, you are greeted with a 16" IPS screen with a 165Hz refresh rate. It even has support for both AMD's Free-Sync and NVidIA's G-Sync. Lenovo claims the peak brightness to be 500 nits while the laptop is certified for DisplayHDR 400. In addition, Lenovo Legion 5 Pro boasts 100% sRGB coverage, 178° viewing angle, and DC Dimming.

Performance

In terms of performance, the 2021 iteration of the Lenovo Legion 5 Pro brings AMD's Ryzen 5000-series CPUs, together with NVidIA RTX 30-series GPU. Here, users can choose between Ryzen 5 5600H and Ryzen 7 5800H. The latter boast higher clock/thread count and clock speeds. On the GPU front, you can either get the RTX 3060 to the RTX 3070.Lenovo has deployed in-house Legion Coldfront 3.0 thermals and Legion AI Engine to provide the maximum possible fps.Lenovo Legion 5 Pro features two SO-DIMM RAM slots that you can configure with up to 32GB of DDR4 RAM. Likewise, you get two M.2 SSD slots. Users can configure the M.2 2280 slot with up to 1TB storage, while the remaining M.2 2242 slot caps at 512GB.

Others

Fueling the Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2021 (Ryzen 7) is an 80Wh Li-Polymer battery. It even supports Rapid Charge Pro which can charge the device up to 50% inside 30 minutes. You get a 230W power adapter in the box.

title: iPhone SE (2022)
short_description: iPhone SE (2022) donnes the look and form factor of two of its predecessor but packs the latest hardware underneath. Like the two SE models that camera before it, it features the traditional design of the iPhone 8, equipped with a physical Home button with Touch id and bezels on top and bottom.
description:
iPhone SE 2022 Overview:

Technically, iPhone SE (2022) is the cheapest iPhone in circulation today. However, only the 128GB variant of the phone is currently available in Nepal, which is closer to the base 64GB variant of the iPhone 11 in terms of pricing.

Design and Display

As mentioned earlier, you won't find any difference between the new iPhone SE (2022) and its predecessor on the surface. As with the other two that came before it, Apple has used the same iPhone 8's form factor for the third iPhone SE. Thus, we get a 4.7-inch Retina IPS LCD panel with an HD resolution of 1334 x 750 pixels. The screen has an oleophobic coating to resist and boasts a maximum brightness of up to 625 nits.Towards the bottom of the screen, iPhone SE (2022) retains the iconic Home button, complete with the Touch id. At the back, there is a single 12MP wide camera, accompanied by an LED flash. The phone is available in three color options: (PRODUCT)RED, Starlight, and Midnight.

Performance

Contrary to design, the new iPhone SE (2022) brings some massive improvements on the inside. For starters, it is powered by the A15 Bionic chip that can be found in the latest iPhone 13 series. This SoC features an octa-core CPU, with two performance cores and four efficiency cores. Further, it also brings a 4-core GPU and a 16-core Neural Engine.In terms of battery, the latest iPhone SE packs a 2018mAh cell with support for 20W fast charging. Unfortunately, there is no support for any wireless charging protocol.

Camera, Others

iPhone SE (2022) has a total of two cameras. The one on the back has a 12MP sensor and an f/1.9 aperture. It comes with support for Optical Image Stabilization and Focus Pixels Autofocus. It is capable of recording 4K videos at up to 60 fps and can take 8MP still photos even while recording.Over on the front, the 7MP selfie camera comes with advanced bokeh and depth control for portraits. The video capability is capped at 1080p 30 fps. There is no OIS but it does support cinematic video stabilization for 1080p and 720p.
seo_title_facebook: iPhone SE (2022) Price, Full Specifications | GadgetByte
seo_description_facebook: iPhone SE (2022) price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs, the official price of the iPhone SE (2022) here.

title: iPhone 16
short_description: The iPhone 16 features a redesigned vertical camera module, a new Action Button, and retains its 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display. It includes the Apple 18 SoC, 8GB RAM, and up to 512GB storage. The dual-camera system supports macro shots, and the device offers WiFi 7, USB Type-C, and an AI-enhanced Siri. It comes in Black, White, Pink, Teal, and Ultramarine.
description:
As the season arrives for Apple to reveal its eagerly awaited smartphone lineup, the spotlight usually shines on the Pro and Pro Max models. However, its the base model that often emerges as the most popular. For instance, the iPhone 15 topped global sales charts. In this piece, well delve into the details of the iPhone 16, including its specifications and features.

iPhone 16 Overview

Design and Display

The most notable design change in the iPhone 16 is its revamped camera module, which reintroduces the vertical camera layout seen in earlier models. This design element has been absent since the iPhone 12. This smartphone retains the boxy frame with metal construction, while the more durable and sophisticated titanium build remains exclusive to the Pro models, preserving the distinction between the two.For the first time, the base model features the Action Button, replacing the traditional mute switch (RIP alert slider). The volume rockers are now positioned below this new button. Additionally, Apple has included an extra Capture Button alongside the power button. The iPhone 16 is available in Black, White, Pink, Teal, and Ultramarine colours.

Performance

The iPhone 16 is powered by the Apple 18 SoC and introduces an advanced thermal design featuring a graphene layer. Additionally, it offers 8GB of memory and storage options of up to 512 GB.Furthermore, it brings a range of AI enhancements, with Apple Intelligence achieving new milestones in the smartphone industry.

Camera, Battery, and Others

The iPhone 16 maintains its dual-camera system, which includes a 48MP main camera and a 12MP ultrawide camera with autofocus, though there are no resolution upgrades this time. However, it now supports macro photography. The device boats up to 22 hours of video playback, a 2 hour increase from iPhone 15. Additionally, the iPhone 16 features WiFi 7, a USB Type-C port, and an enhanced AI-driven Siri experience.
seo_title_facebook: iPhone 16 Price, Full Specifications, Comparisons and Price
seo_description_facebook: iPhone 16 price, design, display, battery, camera and more. Find out the complete specs and price of the Apple iPhone 16 here.

title: iPhone 16 Pro
short_description: iPhone 16 Pro is one of the higher offerings from Apple for the year 2024. This phone brings incremental upgrades over the last years offering. The screen has grown larger reaching 6.3-inches. However, the rest of the display tech is the same. Similarly, it has the new A18 Pro chipset with increased performance capability. It bakes Apple Intelligence into the system, offering wide usability. The iPhone 16 Pro is available in four storage options starting from 128GB and going all the way up to 1TB. It has a triple camera setup including 48MP Fusion, 48MP Ultrawide, and 12MP 5X Telephoto. The front camera is also a 12MP unit. One of the key highlights of this phone is the new Camera Control button offering digital camera-like controls.
description:
Are you looking for a no-compromise smartphone? Then the iPhone 16 Pro will surely interest you, as it is one of the best there is!

iPhone 16 Pro Overview

The iPhone 16 Pro is one of the higher 2024 models from Apple, surpassing the iPhone 15 Pro and bringing some incremental upgrades.

Design and Display

At a glance, the iPhone 16 Pro looks exactly the same as its predecessor with the iconic three-camera cutouts. However, on closer inspection, you can see that the new iPhone has an extra button on the side. It gives you digital camera-like controls on your camera app allowing you to flick between settings, zoom, and so on. Apple introduced a new “Desert Titanium” color option. Meanwhile, the other choices are Black Titanium, White Titanium, and Natural Titanium.On the front, it has a Super Retina XDR display which is an OLED panel with adaptive refresh rates of up to 120Hz. The screen size has increased to 6.3 inches from the 6.12 inch of the previous generation. It supports HDR, True Tone, a Wide P3 color gamut, and a brightness range of 1 to 2,000 nits. The iPhone 16 Pro is also IP68 water and dust-resistant.

Performance and Cameras

The performance has always been a strong suit of Apple smartphones, and this one is no different. The new Apple A18 Pro chipset sits at the heart of it with six cores dedicated to CPU as well as GPU. Likewise, there are sixteen cores for the Neural Engine which handles on-device AI. Talking of AI, Apple Intelligence is the focal point of the iPhone 16 series, including the Pro model. description:

iPhone 16 Pro Max Overview
