title: Acer Nitro V 16 2024 (Ryzen 7 8845HS, RTX 4060, 16GB, 512GB/1TB, 16" WUXGA 165Hz)
short_description: The Acer Nitro V 16 (ANV16-41) is perfect if you want a large screen for gaming and work, with powerful performance from its AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS processor and NVidIA GeForce RTX 4060 graphics. Whether you enjoy gaming or need to tackle heavy tasks, this laptop delivers smooth performance and reliability.
description:
Check out this Acer Nitro V 16 (2024) powered by AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS and RTX 4060.

Acer Nitro V 16 (ANV16-41) Overview

Design and Display

The Acer Nitro V 16 comes in a similar design to its other Nitro V 15 siblings. It features the company logo on the centre of the lid and vents under the hinge. Meanwhile, it also comes with an RGB backlit keyboard with a numpad on the front.In terms of display, Acer is giving us two options to choose from i.e. WQXGA or WUXGA. Either way, it will be a 16-inch screen with a 165Hz refresh rate measuring a response time of 3ms. Acer has not mentioned the type of panel this laptop will feature. However, from our experience with gaming laptops, we assume it to be an IPS LCD panel.

Performance

This Acer Nitro V 16 (2024) ships with an AMD Ryzen 7 8845HS CPU alongside an RTX 4060 GPU.Furthermore, the Acer Nitro V 16 (ANV16-41) also feature a DDR5 RAM of up to 32 GB clocking in at 5,600 MHz. Similarly, it also has up to 2 TB of PCIe 4.0 SSD storage. Moreover, a dual-fan cooling system helps this laptop keep cool while providing optimum performance. It will ship with Windows 11 out of the box on the software front.

Connectivity and the rest

The Acer Nitro V 16 comes with decent options of ports with a full-function USB 4 Type-C, two USB 3 Type-A, an HDMI port, and a headphone jack. In terms of wireless connectivity, we will be getting WiFi 6E as well as unspecified Bluetooth version support. Meanwhile, it features speakers with DTS:X Ultra support.

title: Asta Wolf Fly
short_description: The Asta Wolf Fly earbuds are a half-in-ear design with a square box and a plastic case. They have an IPX4 rating and come in black and white colors. They have 13mm drivers with 32 ohms impedance and Bluetooth 5.1 connectivity. You get a dedicated gaming mode and dual microphones for clear calls. Each earbud has a 30mAh battery, providing up to 6 hours of continuous playtime. The charging case has a 400mAh battery, providing 24 hours of playtime.
description:
Asta Wolf Fly Overview:

Design

The Asta Wolf Fly boasts a half-in-ear fit with a square box. A horizontal/flat case encloses the buds. Additionally, both the case and the earbuds come with LEDs to indicate the battery level. The case has four LEDs, while the latter features only one.In terms of durability, the Wolf's Fly achieves an IPX4 rating, ensuring protection against splashes. Color options include Black and White, catering to varying style preferences.

Audio and Connectivity

On the audio side, the Asta Wolf Fly ships with 13mm drivers with an impedance of 32 ohms. With this, they can reproduce frequencies as low as 20 Hz and as high as 20 kHz.Powering the connection is Bluetooth 5.1 in Fly earbuds. Notably, these earbuds come with a dedicated gaming mode, effectively reducing latency to just 60 ms. The presence of dual microphones enhances call clarity, ensuring your voice is crystal clear during conversations.

Battery

On the other hand, each Asta earbud houses a 30mAh battery, providing up to 6 hours of playtime. Furthermore, the charging case, which adds an additional 24 hours of playtime, boasts a 400mAh battery. This results in a total playtime of 30 hours before needing a recharge.Further, charging the Fly wireless earphones themselves takes just an hour, while the case requires an hour and a half to fully replenish its battery.

title: X-Age convE Serene
short_description: The convE Serene earbuds are the latest earbuds from the Nepali brand X-Age. And these earbuds come with a uniquely open design. With a running power up to 6 hours of uninterrupted listening, they feature Bluetooth 5.3 for faster connectivity. Moreover, the earbuds are IPX5 protected.
description:
X-age are Nepali brand who are known for their earbuds, powerbanks, speakers and wide range of accessories, including smartphones as well. Lets have a quick overview of the latest X-age convE Serene earbuds.

X-Age ConvE Serene Overview:

Design and Build

In terms of design, the X-Age ConvE Serene boasts an open-air design, which is obviously bigger than your usual pair of wireless earphones. You get touch controls on both sides and LED indicators with the X-Age logo imprinted in between. The bottom part of the hook houses a battery on each side. Moreover, X-Age has also provided an IPX5 rating against sweat and water splashes.The charging case is also notably bigger here with a matte black shade and LED indicators on the bottom side. Likewise, a USB-C port is present on the right side for juicing up the case.

Audio

As an open-ear earbud, the ConvE Serene doesn’t fit straight into your ear canals. It hovers over your ear canals instead and delivers audio. These kinds of earbuds come in two types: bone conduction and air conduction technology. And this guy follows the latter one. Either way, open ear earbuds cannot block out external noises or in other words, you can hear your outdoors too while listening to music.The audio here is fired by 14mm large drivers but during my testing, the audio quality was just on the average side, nothing extraordinary. Well, it’s an open-air fit so, it wouldn’t be as good as an in-ear earbud.

Battery and Connectivity

Moving on, these open-air earbuds carry a 70mAh battery on each side while the case has a 450mAh battery to keep things running. X-Age promises a 6-hour battery life at full volume and a combined playback of 28 hours with the case. Meanwhile,  the charging case will be fully charged in one hour as claimed by the company.In terms of connectivity, it relies on Bluetooth 5.3 and supports both Android and iOS platforms.

title: Realme C11 2021
short_description: The Realme C11 2021 is a budget offering from the company that succeeds the original Realme C11 from 2020. While the latter was powered by a 12nm MediaTek MT6765G Helio G35 chipset, whereas the C11 2021 is powered by the 28nm Unisoc SC9863A chipset. In addition, the dual 13MP rear cameras from the 2020's model have been replaced with a single 8MP rear camera. Realme includes a 5MP front-facing camera for selfies and video calls. Furthermore, it comes with a 5000mAh non-removable battery that provides adequate battery life.
description:
Realme C11 2021 Overview, Price:

Design And Display

The Realme C11 2021 is a revamped version of C11 (2020). It has a glossy finish on the back with a textured finish. The phone has a stripe running over and under the camera module and is available in Cool Blue and Cool Grey.As the C11 2021 is a budget phone, it has a 6.5-inch IPS LCD display with an HD+ resolution of 720 x 1600 pixels with a density of around 270ppi. Unfortunately, there is no high refresh rate or anything of that sort here.

Performance

The Unisoc SC9863A chipset built on a 28nm technology powers the C11 2021. It has two clusters of Cortex-A55 cores clocked at 1.6GHz and 1.2GHz, respectively. The IMG8322 GPU is used to render the graphics. On the software front, the phone comes with the Android 10 Go edition with Realme UI on top.

Cameras, Others

The Realme C11 2021, likewise, has a single 8MP primary sensor at the back. This is a downgrade from its predecessor, as the 2020 variant of the phone featured a 13MP dual camera setup. A 5MP camera sits inside a teardrop notch on the front. The phone has a 5,000mAh battery with 10W charging support, but only via a dated micro USB connection.In addition, the Realme C11 comes with two memory options: 2GB or 4GB LPDDR4X RAM and 32/64GB of eMMC 5.1 internal storage. You can also expand the memory by inserting an SD card into the SIM tray's dedicated slot.Unfortunately, there is no fingerprint sensor on the Realme C11 2021. It does, however, include a face-unlock feature.

title: Redmi Note 13 Pro 4G
short_description: Redmi Note 13 Pro 4G is the middle-of-the-pack offering in Xiaomi's \"Redmi Note 13 lineup\" in Nepal. It comes with the Mediatek Helio G99 Ultra under the hood. It comes in two configurations: 8/256GB and 16/512GB. Similarly, it dons a 6.67-inch AMOLED panel on the front with the Corning Gorilla 5 protection. It comes with a 200MP primary + 8MP Ultrawide + 2MP depth sensor combo on the back. Meanwhile, on the front, there is a 16MP shooter. Powering everything is a 5,000 mAh cell with 67W fast charging.
description:
Xiaomi has been well know to offer specs-heavy smartphones in an affordable price bracket. Similar is the case for the sub-brand Redmi. As such, Redmi Note 13 Pro 4G is the company's midrange offering for the year 2024 in Nepal.

Redmi Note 13 Pro 4G Overview

Design and Display

The Redmi Note 13 Pro 4G brings a new design. It has a flat design and a smooth glossy finish on the back. This phone is only 7.98mm thick and weighs about 187 grams.On the front, we are getting a 6.67-inch AMOLED panel. It boasts an FHD+ resolution of 1,220 x 2,400 pixels, a peak brightness of 1,300 nits, and a 100% DCI-P3 color gamut. Meanwhile, it has a refresh rate of 120Hz, touch sampling rate of 2,160Hz, and high-frequency PWM dimming of 1,920Hz.

Performance

Under the hood, it comes with the Helio G99 Ultra chipset. It is an octa-core processor with a peak clock speed of up to 2.2GHz. The Redmi Note 13 Pro 4G comes in two configurations i.e. 8GB + 256GB, and 12GB + 512GB. Lastly, it comes with MIUI 14 out of the box, however, it is eligible to receive the HyperOS update.

Camera and the rest

In terms of optics, the Redmi Note 13 Pro comes with a triple-camera setup on the back. The primary camera is a 200MP lens coupled with an 8MP ultrawide camera and 2MP macro lens. Similarly, on the front, we are getting a 16MP shooter for the selfies. Powering the phone is a 5,100 mAh battery that accepts 67W of fast charging.Furthermore, it is a dual-SIM 5G phone that also comes with dual-band WiFi and Bluetooth v5.2 support. In terms of the wired connection, it comes with USB Type-C and a 3.5mm headphone jack.Check out more Redmi smartphones, HERE!

Design and Display

description:
Realme 12 Pro Plus is one of the latest smartphones from the Chinese brand, launched in Jan 2024.

Realme 12 Pro+ Overview:

Design and Display

Like its non-pro sibling, the Realme 12 Pro Plus (stylized: realme 12 Pro+ 5G) boasts a 6.7″ curved-edge full-HD+ AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate, ensuring smooth visuals for an enhanced user experience.Moreover, there’s the same Vegan Leather back with an appealing design made in collaboration with the renowned watchmaker Ollivier Savéo. The phone is available in Submariner Blue, Navigator Beige, and Explorer Red color options.

Performance

Realme 12 Pro+ comes equipped with the Snapdragon 7s Gen 2 SoC, promising a blend of efficiency and performance. For gaming enthusiasts, this midrange smartphone brings a notable feature – 3D VC Cooling Support. This is expected to contribute significantly to temperature control during prolonged gaming sessions, ensuring a smoother and more enjoyable experience. Moreover, you also get plenty of memory with up to 12GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 256 GB of UFS 3.1 storage.On the software front, the phone boots on Realme UI 5.0 based on Android 14. Unfortunately, Realme has only committed to two generations of OS updates and three years of quarterly security updates which is a bit disappointing considering the competition.

Camera

The Realme 12 Pro Plus comes with a 50MP Sony IMX890 sensor with Optical Image Stabilization (OIS). The addition of a 64MP periscope portrait camera further enhances the imaging potential, providing up to 3x optical and 120x digital zoom. Complementing this setup is an 8MP Ultra-wide camera and a 32MP selfie camera.Realme 12 Pro+ doesn’t shy away from embracing the future, incorporating 5G connectivity for faster and more reliable connections. The in-display fingerprint sensor adds a layer of convenience without compromising on security.

Battery and Others

Under the hood, the Realme 12 Pro and Pro+ both ship with a 5000 mAh Battery and 67W fast charging. Besides that, there is 5G support and an in-display fingerprint scanner.

title: Realme 12x 5G
short_description: The Realme 12x 5G, recently launched in Nepal, features a design shift with its camera island now centered and is available in Twilight Purple and Woodland Green. description:
Realme 12x 5G is one of the latest smartphones from the Chinese brand, launched recently in Nepal. Heres a quick overview.

Realme 12x 5G Overview

Design and Display

Realme 12x 5G keeps the majority of design aspects similar to its predecessor. Except for the shift of the camera island on the back to the center, which puts it more in line with its other members of the Realme 12 series. Moreover, it boasts IP54 water and ingress protection while maintaining a slim profile of 7.89mm. This phone ships in two finishes: Twilight Purple and Woodland Green.On the front, you are getting an LCD panel that measures 6.72 inches diagonally. The screen is capable of five levels of refresh rate adjustment peaking at 120Hz. In the meantime, it can get as bright as 950 nits under HBM (High Brightness Mode). Additionally, the Realme 12x 5G also bags the TÜV Rheinland low blue light certification.

Performance

Moving on to the performance side of things, the latest Realme offering does not offer any upgrade in terms of processor. Meaning, that it sticks with the same MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset. This silicon should provide you with a smooth enough experience for day-to-day usage and light gaming here and there.Even though you don’t get an upgrade in the processor, you do get a major bump in memory as well as storage. It comes in an 8/128GB trim in Nepal. In addition, you can virtually double the memory while also expanding the storage with a MicroSD card of up to 2TB on the Realme 12x. Furthermore, this phone boots on the Realme UI 5.0 based on Android 14.

Camera and the rest

In terms of camera, the Realme 12x 5G comes with a primary 50MP shooter — which is a dip from the 64MP you would get on a last-gen phone. However, we all know that the megapixels of the camera do not solely dictate the image quality.Other than that, there’s a 2MP black & white (B&W) camera as well. Meanwhile, you once again get an 8MP camera on the front. Powering the smartphone is a 5,000 mAh cell that can juiced up with a 45W charger.

description:
Are you looking for a budget smartphone that is also a looker? Then the Tecno Spark Go 1 will definitely catch your eye!

Tecno Spark Go 1 Overview

Design and Display

The Tecno Spark Go 1 features a flat body with a distinctive camera island, blending square and circular shapes. It has an IP54 rating, offering basic dust and water resistance. title: Realme Narzo N61
short_description: Realme Narzo N61 is a 2024 budget offering from the company. The phone has a tough build complete with ArmorShell Protection™, IP54 rating, and TÜV Rheinland High Reliability Certificate. It comes with a 6.74-inch AMOLED panel with HD+ resolution, 560 nits peak brightness, up to 90Hz refresh rate, and up to 180Hz touch sampling rate. description:
Are you looking for an affordable smartphone with a tough exterior and relatively smooth performance? Then you might want to check out the Realme Narzo N61:

Realme Narzo N61 Overview

Design and Display

Realme Narzo N61 looks pretty standard in terms of design. It has a wavy pattern on the back and comes in Safari Green, and Marble Black colour options. The company spends a great deal speaking of its durability. The phone is IP54 water and dust-resistant and TÜV Rheinland certified for high reliability. Additionally, it features something called ArmorShell Protection which is a combination of multiple things. Such as metal frames, reinforced glass, coated film, etc. that add to the overall sturdiness of the phone.On the front, you are looking at a 6.74-inch screen with an unspecified panel. This display is likely an LCD considering the price of the phone. In the meantime, the Realme Narzo N61 screen comes with an HD+ resolution with 560 nits of peak brightness, 90Hz refresh rate, and up to 180Hz touch sampling rate.

Performance and the rest

The phone is equipped with the UNISOC T612 for its processing duties. It is an octa-core silicon with 12nm fabrication and 1.8GHz peak clock speed. Though available in three different configurations, Nepali customers can only get it in 4GB + 64GB trim. This is the lowest available configuration of the Realme Narzo N61. The phone allows you to virtually extend the memory and also supports a MicroSD card of up to 2TB, which helps it curb its limitations. In the tank, it has a 5,000 mAh battery with 10W charging support.Talking of the cameras, the phone has a 32MP primary shooter coupled with an auxiliary lens of unspecified purpose. On the front, it is equipped with a 5MP unit for selfies. The Realme Narzo N61 has a dual Nano SIM slot with 4G cellular as well as dual-band WiFi and Bluetooth v5.0 support. It also comes with some nifty software features like the Mini Capsule 2.0.

title: Lenovo IdeaPad 3 2021 (Ryzen 5 5500U, 8GB, 256GB, 15.6" FHD)
short_description: The 2021 iteration of the Lenovo IdeaPad 3 (15ALC6) is among the best mainstream laptops for students and officers that balances power, build quality, and affordability. This particular laptop is powered by AMD's Ryzen 5500U processor with integrated Radeon Vega 7 graphics. It is configurable with up to 12GB of DDR4 RAM and 1TB of NVMe SSD. It features a 15.6\" FHD LCD panel enclosed inside a plastic chassis, which feels robust nonetheless.
description:
Lenovo IdeaPad 3 2021: Overview

Here’s a brief description of the design aesthetic, processor, and battery of the Lenovo IdeaPad 3 2021 laptop with a Ryzen 5 processor.

Design and Display 

Being a budget device, Lenovo IdeaPad 3 features an all-plastic build made up of ABS top and bottom. It comes in 4 different color options, including Abyss Blue, Artic Grey, Galaxy Blue, and Sand. It weighs around 1.65 kilos, so it’s relatively portable and suitable for everyday carry.The display is, unfortunately, a TN panel instead of an LCD one. It is a 15.6″ non-touch panel that can reach a maximum brightness of 250 nits. It has an anti-glare coating and covers 45% of the NTSC color gamut.

Chipset and Memory

AMD's Ryzen 5550U powers the Lenovo Ideapad 3 2021. This SoC has 6 cores and 12 threads with a max boost frequency of 4.0 GHz. Besides that, it has 8MB of L3 cache memory. On the GPU front, it has AMD’s integrated Radeon graphics.With this laptop, you get 8GB of DDR4 memory which can be upgraded down the line to 12 GB. For storage, this ships with 256GB of M.2 SSD, which can be expanded as well.

Battery and Connectivity

IdeaPad 3 2021 has a 38Wh battery. It has decent battery life relative to its competitors and can last a few hours on causal use. It ships with a 65W adapter provided in the box.For wired connections, you get a USB 2.0 Type-A, a USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A, a USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-C, an HDMI, a card reader, and a 3.5mm headphone/microphone jack.

title: Lenovo IdeaPad 3 2022 (12th Gen i5 1235U, 8GB, 512GB, 14" FHD)
short_description: The 2022 iteration of the Lenovo IdeaPad 3 (14IAU7) is among the best mainstream laptops for students and officers that balances power, build quality and affordability. This particular laptop is powered by Intel's 12th generation i5-1235U processor with integrated Intel Iris Xe graphics. It comes with 8GB RAM and 512GB SSD. The cool thing about this laptop is that it can have up to 2TB of storage if you choose to install a 1TB 2.5\" HDD and upgrade the SSD to 1 TB. It features a 14\" FHD LCD panel enclosed inside a plastic chassis, which feels robust nonetheless.
description:
Lenovo Ideapad 3 (2022): Overview

Here's a brief description of the design aesthetic, processor, and battery life of the Lenovo Ideapad 3i 2022 (i5, 14" FHD) laptop.

Design and Build 

Being a budget laptop category, Lenovo Ideapad 3 design is as premium as a notebook can get. It has a brushed matte finish giving it a polished look. It is well-built with no hinge or flexing issues. It's not cumbersome at 1.43 kilos and is pretty convenient to use.Lenovo IdeaPad IAU7's 14" display is an IPS panel of FHD resolution (1920x1080). It can go up to 300 nits in brightness and covers 45% of the NTSC color gamut. The keyboard, unfortunately, lacks a backlight, and the trackpad is a bit off-center.

Performance and Memory

The Lenovo Ideapad 3 2022 is powered by Intel's 12 th gen Core i5 processor. The Intel core i5-1235U is an efficient mobile processor that can deliver smooth performance for day-to-day tasks and office work.This laptop comes with 8GB of DDR4 RAM, but it can be upgraded to up to 16GB. On IdeaPad 3i 2022, you get 512GB of M.2 2280 SSD for long-term storage. The fun part is you can replace that SSD with a 1 TB now and also add an additional 2.5" HDD. So you can have up to 2 TB of storage on this laptop (1TB SSD + 1TB HDD).

Battery and Connectivity 

Lenovo Ideapad 3 (14IAU7) ships with a 38Wh battery. It's not a very big battery, but it can still play local 1080p video for up to 7.7 hours at 150 nits of brightness. It performed okay on the MobileMark 2018 benchmark lasting a total of 5 hours.As for port selection, you get an old-fashioned USB 2 type-A port, a USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-A port, a USB-C 3.2 Gen 1 port, an HDMI 1.4b port, a Card reader, and a 3.5mm headphone/microphone jack.For wireless connections on Lenovo IdeaPad 3i 2022, you have your standard Wifi 6 and Bluetooth 5.1 technology.

title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra
short_description: Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra is the second-gen of Samsung's elite \"Ultra\" tablets and it is the most advanced one from the South Korean company so far.  Living up to its moniker, Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra brings a massive 14.6″, even bigger than some compact laptops. It is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy chip. It also sports a total of four cameras distributed equally across the front and back. Fueling it is a monstrous 11,200mAh battery with support for 45W fast charging.
description:
Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra Overview:

Here's a brief description of the design aesthetic, chipset, and features of the Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra.

Design and Build

Like its predecessor, Tab S9 Ultra offers a unibody metal design. The Aluminium back and frame are complemented by Corning Gorilla Glass upfront. For the screen, it sports a large 14.6 inch AMOLED 2X display that can go up to 120 Hz. The WQXGA+ (2560x1600) panel has an aspect ratio of 16:10.Samsung Tab S9 Ultra offers IP68 dust and water resistance. It is just 5.5mm thick and weighs about 732 grams. It is available in 2 color options: Graphite and Beige.

Performance 

Under the hood, Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra is powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy chipset. This octa-core processor offers a prime Cortex X3 core clocked at 3.36 GHz, 2 Cortex A715 Cores and 2 Cortex A710 Cores at 2.8 GHz, and 3 Cortex A510 efficiency cores at 2 GHz. This is paired with an integrated Adreno 740 GPU.As for the memory, Tab S9 Ultra can be configured with up to 16 GB of RAM and up to 1 TB of UFS storage. Thanks to the micro SD card slot, you can add an extra 1 TB of secondary storage later down the road.

Cameras and Extras

Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra features dual 12MP cameras up front and a dual camera setup on the back. The 13MP rear primary is paired with an 8MP ultrawide sensor. It comes with Android 13 out of the box with Samsung's One UI 5.1 on top. The company has promised 4 years of Android updates and 5 years of security patches.In the tank, Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Ultra has a massive 11,200mAh Lithium Ion battery. The tablet supports up to 45W of fast charging. As for wireless connections, Tab S9 Ultra comes with WiFi 6E and Bluetooth 5.3. For security, you can opt-in for the in-display fingerprint or face recognition. Tab S9 Ultra has a stereo audio setup with quad speakers tuned by AKG.

Design and Display

title: Infinix Note 40 Pro
short_description: The Infinix Note 40 Pro, a 4G variant, features a 6.78\" 3D-curved AMOLED screen with FHD+ resolution and 1300 nits peak brightness. Its powered by the MediaTek Helio G99 Ultimate chipset, with 256GB storage and up to 12GB RAM. The camera setup includes a 108 MP OIS rear camera, a 2MP + 2MP unit, and a 32 MP front camera. The 5000 mAh battery supports 70W wired and 20W wireless charging, and it introduces Infinixs WLCSP tech for improved battery management and performance. Available in Vintage Green and Titan Gold.
description:
Here is a thorough overview of Infinix Note 40 Pro; its features and specifications including design and display, performance, memory, battery, camera, and others.

Infinix Note 40 Pro Overview

Display and Design

Both versions of Infinix Note 40 Pro boast a large 6.78’’ 3D-curved AMOLED screen, offering an immersive viewing experience. With a screen-to-body ratio of 93.80% and a resolution of FHD+ 1080*2436, users can enjoy crisp and vibrant visuals. The display also features a peak brightness of 1300nit, ensuring clarity even in bright outdoor conditions. Protected by Corning Gorilla Glass, durability is guaranteed without compromising on style.The device, with dimensions of 164.35 x 74.6 x 7.75mm and weighing just 190g, is designed to be sleek and comfortable to hold. Users can choose between Vintage Green and Titan Gold colors to suit their preferences.

Performance

Under the hood, the Infinix Note 40 Pro is powered by the MediaTek Helio G99 Ultimate chipset. The octa-core CPU for G99 ultimate compromises  of 2×2.2 GHz Cortex-A76 and 6×2.0 GHz Cortex-A55 cores. Running on Android 14 with XOS 14.

Cameras and Storage 

The device features an impressive camera setup, including a 108 MP OIS rear camera with Lossless 3X zoom, accompanied by a 2MP + 2MP camera unit. On the front, users can capture stunning selfies with the 32 MP selfie camera. With 256GB of internal storage and options for either 8GB or 12GB of RAM, the Infinix Note 40 Pro offers sufficient space for storing photos, videos, and apps.

Long-lasting Battery and Fast Charging

Equipped with a 5000 mAh battery, both of the Infinix Note 40 Pro variants ensure long hours of usage without the need for frequent charging. When it’s time to recharge, the device supports 70W wired charging and 20W wireless charging, allowing users to quickly top up their device and get back to their day.Additionally, the Note 40 Pro series introduced the company’s first-ever self-developed design for optimal battery management. It uses WLCSP tech ( Water level chip scale packaging ), according to Infinix this new chip delivers exceptional efficiency surpassing traditional chips by 204% compared to traditional QFN packaging. So what does that imply? Well, the reduced size of the chip enables electrical data to travel shorter distances within the phone, minimizing heating issues and increasing performance.

title: Samsung Galaxy A16 5G
short_description: Samsung Galaxy A16 5G is the latest midrange offering from the brand. It makes little to no changes to the design complete with a “key island” on the right. On the front, you get a 6.7-inch Super AMOLED screen with a 90Hz refresh rate, 800 nits brightness, and FHD+ resolution. It packs a chipset coupled with up to 8GB RAM and 256GB ROM. The phone runs on Android 14-based OneUI and offers you 6 years of software and 6 years of security updates.\r\n\r\nAdditionally, you have a triple camera setup on the back with a 50MP main, 5MP ultrawide, and 2MP macro lens. The selfie camera is a 13MP unit with face recognition capabilities. It has a 5,000 mAh battery with 25W charging speed. Lastly, you get a 25W charging brick bundled with this phone.
description:
Samsung Galaxy A16 5G is a new midrange phone, that comes as a successor to last years Samsung Galaxy A15. The phone is available in two different connectivity options, but the 5G variant hit the Nepali shelves first.

Samsung Galaxy A16 5G Overview

Design and Display

The Samsung Galaxy A16 5G retains a slim 7.9mm profile, making it comfortable to hold. For the first time in the Galaxy A10 series, it comes with an IP54 rating, adding basic dust and water resistance. Samsung’s signature "Key Island" camera layout, introduced with previous A-series models, adds a stylish touch, and the 5G model features unique spotlight-like patterns on its matte back cover. Available in striking hues of Light Grey, Blue Black, Light Green and Gold, it offers a visually appealing design.On the front, the Galaxy A16 5G boasts a vibrant 6.7-inch Super AMOLED display, stretching to an FHD+ resolution. This large panel supports a smooth 90Hz refresh rate, delivering fluid interactions, whether scrolling or gaming. With 800 nits of peak brightness, this phone ensures decent outdoor visibility, even on sunny days. Additionally, its 16 million colour depth enhances media experiences with rich and vivid visuals.

Performance and the rest

The Galaxy A16 5G runs with different chips under the hood depending on the region. The options include Samsungs in-house Exynos 1330 and the MediaTek Dimensity 6300. The Nepali audience will be getting the latter option. This processor is a successor to the Dimensity 6100+ featured on the A15 5G. While the core architecture remains unchanged, it peaks at a higher frequency than its predecessor. The device has up to 8GB RAM and 256GB storage, and it is expandable by up to 1.5TB via a MicroSD card, so there’s ample room for photos, videos, and apps.Samsung’s One UI, based on Android 14, powers the software, promising an intuitive experience. Furthermore, Samsung ensures extended support on the Galaxy A16 5G, with up to six years of software and security updates. This model includes Samsung Knox, providing added security against potential threats. In terms of battery life, this phone packs a robust 5,000 mAh battery with 25W wired fast charging support. In terms of cameras, it includes a 13MP front camera and a rear setup with a 50MP main camera, a 5MP ultrawide lens, and a 2MP macro lens.
  • Also, check out other Samsung smartphones available in Nepal

title: Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 (2021)
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 is an affordable mid-range tablet. Moreover, it features a metallic side and back design. The tablet features a 10.5-inch LCD display with revamped bezels. The tablet is powered by a Unisoc T618 which is based on a 12nm process. Besides, Samsung has stuck in a quad-speaker setup and also a headphone jack in the tablet. It is the successor to the Tab A7 from last year. While the Tab A7 was deemed the go-to budget tablet, the Tab A8 fails to live up to its predecessor. That being said, it is not a bad tablet at all.
description:
Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 (2021) Overview:

Design

[caption id="attachment_118595" align="alignnone" width="900"] Rear Panel[/caption]The Tab A8 has a simple design and it features an all-aluminum build. In terms of weight and thickness, the device weighs 508 grams and measures 6.9mm. Furthermore, there is a single camera and a small Samsung logo on the back. The volume rockers and the power button is placed on the top right of the frame. The Galaxy Tab A8 is available in three colors— Grey, Silver, and Pink Gold.

Display

[caption id="attachment_118603" align="alignnone" width="900"] Display[/caption]Moving on to the display, the Tab A8 is equipped with a 10.5-inch display. However, it is a TFT screen and lacks the vibrancy of a LED screen. Besides, the screen has a 1200 x 1920 resolution and a pixel density of 216ppi.

Performance

The performance on the Tab A8 is handled by the Unisoc Tiger T618 which is a 12nm octa-core processor. Although quite similar to the Snapdragon 662 on the Tab A7, the T618 performed better on GPU benchmarks like 3DMark Wildlife.Moreover, the Galaxy Tab A8 can be configured with up to 128GB internal storage and a single 4GB RAM option. Nonetheless, the storage can be expanded up to 1TB with an SD Card.

Audio

You will find a quad-speaker array on the Tab A8. Not only that, Samsung has not omitted the 3.5mm headphone jack. Furthermore, the tablet features Dolby Atmos for an immersive listening experience.

Battery

On the battery front, Samsung has you covered with a 7040mAh battery which provides up to 7 hours of screen-on-time on a full charge. Likewise, the Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 supports 15W charging. However, the tablet ships with a 7.7W charger in the box.

Others

[caption id="attachment_118597" align="alignnone" width="900"] Back Camera[/caption]Moving on, the Galaxy Tab A8 features a new camera bump compared to its predecessor. However, the cameras themselves seem untouched as you get the same 8MP rear camera and a 5MP selfie shooter up front. Furthermore, the tablet runs on Android 11 with Samsung's One UI 3 on top. Similarly, biometric options include fingerprint reader and face unlock.
seo_title_facebook: Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 Price, Specifications, Comparison
seo_description_facebook: Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 (2021) price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs, and price of Samsung Galaxy Tab A8 here.

title: Dell XPS 14 9440 2024 (Core Ultra 7 155H, RTX 4050, 16GB, 512GB, 14.5" 3.2K OLED Touch)
short_description: Dell XPS 14 9440 (2024) is a high-end ultraportable notebook series with a striking design. The XPS 14 9440 has a 14.5-inch 3.2K OLED display with a 16:10 aspect ratio. Powering it is a considerably faster Intel Core Ultra 7 155H and RTX 4050 graphics, as well as up to 16GB of LPDDR5X RAM and 512GB of SSD. As a result, it will undoubtedly serve you well in your day-to-day chores. Similarly, the XPS 14 offers Thunderbolt connectors and WiFi 7 compatibility for faster communication. This laptop is for people who prefer awesome build quality, premium trackpads, keyboards and display over anything else.
description:
The Dell XPS 14 9440 (2024) with Core Ultra 7 155H, RTX 4050 and a 2.5K OLED is a premium laptop that offers a sleek design, powerful performance, and a stunning display.

Dell XPS 14 9440 (2024) Overview:

Design and Build Quality

The Dell XPS 14 9440 (2024) has a minimalist and elegant design. The laptop has a platinum or graphite color option and a durable aluminum chassis resistant to scratches and fingerprints. Also, the carbon fiber palm rest is soft and comfortable. The laptop weighs only 1.17 kg and has a thin profile of 14.8 mm, making it easy to carry around.It features a backlit keyboard and a fingerprint reader integrated into the power button for quick and secure login. The laptop has two Thunderbolt 4 ports that support power delivery, data transfer, display output, and a USB-C to USB-A adapter bundled in the box.

Display and Audio

The Dell XPS 14 has a stunning display that is one of its main selling points. The laptop has a 14.5-inch screen that comes in a 3.2K OLED touch option. It has an InfinityEdge design that minimizes the bezels and maximizes the screen-to-body ratio. The display also has an anti-glare or anti-reflect coating that reduces reflections and eye strain.The laptop also has a dual speaker system that delivers clear and loud sound quality. The speakers are tuned by Waves MaxxAudio Pro and support Dolby Vision for an enhanced audio-visual experience. Accompanying it is a dual microphone array that supports noise cancellation and voice recognition.

Performance and Battery Life

This particular Dell XPS 14 9440 (2024) has Intels Core Ultra 7 155H CPU with 16 cores, 22 threads, 24 MB cache, and 4.8 GHz turbo frequency, paired with NVidIA RTX 4050 graphics card.As for the memory and storage, you get 16GB LPDDR5X RAM that runs at 7467 MHz and 512GB SSD. The laptop also has an integrated Intel Iris Xe graphics card that supports casual gaming and graphics-intensive tasks. It also supports Wi-Fi 7 and Bluetooth 5.4 for fast and stable wireless connectivity.The Dell XPS 14 9440 (2024) with Intel Core Ultra 7 155H comes with a 69.5 Wh battery that supports fast charging via the Thunderbolt 4 port.

title: Samsung Galaxy Buds Live
short_description: The Samsung Galaxy Buds Live are a pretty different type of earbud when it comes to design. This features a 12-mm driver with a bass duct and air vents. The earpieces have three mics each for ambient sound, ANC, and ENC. The battery lasts about 8 hours, and the case adds around 21 hours of playtime that can be impacted if features like ANC or Bixby Voice Wake-up is used.
description:
Samsung Galaxy Buds Live Overview:

Okay, let's begin with a brief overview of the Samsung Galaxy Buds Live.

Design

Samsung has innovated a completely new style for their Galaxy Buds Live: a bean shape. It incorporates two wing tips for a better fit. Further, the TWS is an open-fit in design. The earpieces are not well protected from water and sweat as they have only an IPX2 water protection certification. Besides, The TWS is available in four mystic colors—Bronze, Black, White, and Red.

Sound Quality

For the audio, the company has gone with a 12-mm dynamic sound driver. The Galaxy Buds series shifted from 2 way speaker to 1 way. The "Live" version houses a bass duct for lower-frequency sounds and air vents to reduce the blockage of the ear for immense sound. Buds Live also offers SBC, AAC, and SSC codecs.Finally, this time around, Samsung has utilized three mics present in each bud for ANC, including other features such as ENC and ambient sound. Moreover, Dolby Head Tracking technology is used here to achieve "360 Audio." And with Dolby Atmos, you'll hear that 3D sound with even more details. 

Battery

In terms of battery life, the "Galaxy Beans" can last up to 8 hours of non-stop music without any features enabled, and the case increases it to 29 hours of combined playback. Even with both the ANC and Bixby Voice Wake-up enabled, it can withhold up to 5.5 hours of continuous usage and 20 hours of collective playtime. Additionally, 5 minutes of charge increases its playtime by an hour.

Connectivity

Besides, you can connect Galaxy Buds Live with Android and iOS devices using Bluetooth 5.0, which it comes with, and control using its Wearable App. It can even connect with the Windows PC using Swift Pair without the need to scan for the Bluetooth device. 

Rest of the specs

Moreover, the Samsung Galaxy Buds Live accommodates six different sensors—an accelerometer, a hall sensor, a proximity sensor, a gyro, a touch sensor, a voice pickup unit, and a grip sensor. That's a pretty long list of sensors. Aside from that, the earbuds' case supports Qi-certified wireless charging. Plus, the USB-C port provided is another option for charging.

title: Lenovo Tab M10 HD (2nd Gen)
short_description: The Lenovo Tab M10 HD (2nd Gen) is an entry-level tablet great for everyday tasks like streaming videos and browsing social media. It has an octa-core processor, which means it can handle basic tasks with ease, but it may struggle with more demanding tasks like multitasking and gaming. You can choose between 4GB of RAM and 64GB of storage. The tablet has a 10.1-inch IPS display with HD+ resolution. This is accompanied by a stereo speaker setup that supports Dolby Audio, which makes for a decent multimedia experience. Overall, the Lenovo Tab M10 HD (2nd Gen) is a decent choice for those looking for an entry-level tablet for everyday use. But it is not the most cost-effective option available in the market right now.

title: Vivo Y28
short_description: Vivo Y28 is a budget phone that comes with good enough specs. You get a plastic build with IP64 water and dust resistance. On the front, it has a 6.68 LCD panel with HD+ resolution and 90Hz refresh rate. Underneath, the phone packs a MediaTek Helio G85 with 8GB memory and 256GB storage. Likewise, it packs a 50MP and 2MP camera on the back while having an 8MP unit. Lastly, the Vivo Y28 houses a 6,000 mAh battery with 44W fast charging support.
description:
Are you looking for a budget smartphone that isnt very heavy on your pockets? Then you might want to take a look at the Vivo Y28!

Vivo Y28 Overview

Design and Display

The Vivo Y28 comes with flat frames and a composite plastic sheet for the back panel. Additionally, the phone boasts an IP64 water and dust resistance. Meanwhile, it ships in two colour options: Agate Green, and Gleaming Orange. Both the options have a gradient-ish finish across the back.A 6.68-inch screen with flat edges on the front. The panel on the Vivo Y28 is an LCD with up to 90Hz refresh rate. Moreover, the screen offers a brightness of up to 1,000 nits along with HD+ resolution. Likewise, it has a pixel density of 264 PPI and comes with an 83% NTSC colour gamut.

Performance and the rest

The primary performance on this phone is driven by the MediaTek Helio G85 processor with eight cores, 12nm fabrication, and a peak clock speed of 2.0GHz. Additional hardware on the Vivo Y28 includes up to 8GB LPDDR4x RAM coupled with up to 256GB eMMC 5.1 storage. Other than that, you can virtually extend the memory up to 8GB while the storage can go up to an additional 1TB with a MicroSD card.In terms of optics, this phone comes with three cameras altogether. It has a 50MP primary shooter coupled with a 2MP auxiliary lens. This secondary shooter is a bokeh camera helping out with background blurs. In the meantime, the front-facing camera is an 8MP unit. In the tank, the Vivo Y28 packs a large 6,000 mAh battery with 44W charging support. It comes with dual SIM support with a hybrid slot. It offers wireless connectivity via 5G cellular, dual-band WiFi, and Bluetooth v5.0. Lastly, this phone has a side-mounted fingerprint sensor for biometric security.

title: Lenovo Yoga 6i 2022 (12th Gen i7-1260P, 16GB, 1TB, 14" 2.8K 120Hz )
short_description: Lenovo Yoga Slim 6i (20220 is an ultrabook powered by the 12th Gen Intel Core processors. It has a high-resolution display with 100% sRGB coverage. Furthermore, it has two Thunderbolt 4 ports for display output and boasts up to 9 hours of endurance.
description:
Lenovo Yoga Slim 6i (2022): Overview

Here's a brief overview of the build quality, chipset, and connectivity options of the Lenovo Yoga Slim 6i (2022) with the Intel i7 processor.

Design and Display

The Lenovo Yoga Slim 6i boasts an elegant aluminum build, providing a premium look and feel. Impressively, it is MIL-STD-810H military-certified while remaining lightweight at only 1.35 kg. With a thickness of 14.9mm, it maintains a slim profile and is available in a single color option, 'Storm Grey.'Its display is a 2.8K (2240x1400) 60Hz matte panel, offering 100% sRGB coverage and Dolby Vision support for exceptional visuals. Sporting a 16:10 aspect ratio, it also comes with Eyesafe Certification 2.0 to reduce eye strain during extended use.

Performance

Powering the Lenovo Yoga Slim 6i (2022) are the 12th Gen Intel Core i5 and i7 processors. Specifically, the Intel Core i7-1260P is a 12-core Processor with 4 Performance and 8 Efficiency Cores. Built on a 7nm process, this 16-thread processor can achieve a maximum turbo frequency of 4.70 GHz. The integrated Iris Xe Graphics with 96 EU (Execution Units) clocked at 1.40 GHz deliver respectable graphical performance.It's worth noting that the RAM is soldered on the device, limiting upgradability to the default 16 GB. Unfortunately, the 32 GB variants are currently unavailable. As for storage, users can opt for a 512 GB or 1TB M.2 SSD.

Battery and Connectivity

The Lenovo Yoga Slim 6i packs a 65 Wh Lithium Ion battery, providing commendable battery life. It managed to last an impressive 9 hours in the Mobile Mark 2018 benchmark and offers up to 14.7 hours of continuous local 1080p video streaming. Moreover, with Rapid Charge Express support, just 15 minutes of charging can yield up to 3 hours of runtime.In terms of connectivity, the laptop features a USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A port, 2 Thunderbolt 4 ports, an HDMI 2.1 port, and a Headphone Jack. For wireless connectivity, Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 5.1 are included, ensuring smooth and reliable data transfers and connections.

title: Ultima Atom 255
short_description: Ultima has been successful with its Atom earbuds. Atom 255 is the most expensive one in the series along with 192. This doesn't mean the bud's expensive overall; it costs only Rs. 2699 in Nepal. This TWS highlights open-fit earpieces, each with 12mm drivers and two mics for ENx. It also features a huge battery backup (6 hrs earbuds + 42 hrs case), ASAP charging (2 hrs playback in 10 min), IWP (insta wake n' pair), IPX4 (sweat protection), Bluetooth 5.3, and a type-C port.
description:
Ultima Atom 255 Overview:

Here is a quick overview of Ultima Atom 255 Earbuds.

Design

Ultima Atom 255 is an open-fit TWS supported by a touch-controlled stem. The earpieces do secure an IPX4 rating for sweat protection. For the case, the body is oval-shaped with a transparent cap that makes a snap sound when closed. Plus it has a button at the back to reset the connection if needed. You are provided with two colors here—black with a red accent and greyish-white with cyan.

Sound

Moreover, The Atom 255 boasts a 12mm sound driver. The buds use SBC and AAC codecs and cover frequencies between 20Hz - 20KHz. It comes with two mics per earpiece that facilitate ENC(Environmental Noise Cancellation). Additionally, Ultima has promised reduced latency of 60ms in their gaming mode.

Battery Life

Coming to the battery, Ultima Atom 255 is powered by a battery with up to 6 hrs of playback for buds. Combined with the fact that 10 min of charge increases the playback by 2 hrs, you don't have to worry even if the music stops. The charging case can further hold juice equivalent to 42 hrs of runtime. Besides, the 10W fast charging is something to consider.

Rest of the specs

Along with the above-mentioned qualities, Atom 255 features IWP pairing which on opening the case, can easily connect to both Android and iOS devices. Also a type-C port for the case.

title: Zeblaze GTS 3 Plus
short_description: The Zeblaze GTS 3 Plus is a regular smartwatch with a silicone band with a fabric-like texture. The watch measures 49mm wide while weighing just 39.5 grams. Similarly, it boasts a 2.15\" AMOLED screen on the front with 330 PPI pixel density. It comes with Bluetooth v5.2 and is compatible with both Android and iOS. You can access additional customisation and your health data through the FitCloudPro app. The watch is an IP68 rated package capable of offering you with up to 15 days of usage.
description:
Zeblaze is a Chinese OEM brand that offers qualitative smartwatches at an affordable price tag. One of their latest offerings is the Zeblaze GTS 3 Plus.

Zeblaze GTS 3 Plus Overview

Design and Display

This smartwatch comes in a squircle ship and has a single button on the right. This button has a grippy texture and is made of aluminium alloy. Meanwhile, the case comes with a plastic bottom and middle frame spraying. Similarly, the wristband here is a silicone strap with fabric-like texture engravement.A 2.15-inch touchscreen greets on the front as the display. The panel here is an AMOLED with a peak brightness capability of up to 1,000 nits. Talking of the resolution, the display spans 415 x 505 pixels while packing 330 PPI pixel density. Moreover, the Zeblaze GTS 3 Plus boasts IP68 dust and water resistance. It is available in three colour options: Starlight Silver, Midnight Black, and Champagne Gold.

Features and the rest

The Zeblaze GTS 3 Plus comes with all the standard smartwatch features like date and time, stopwatch, and timer. This includes heart rate monitoring, blood oxygen monitoring, sleep monitoring, breathing training, sleep tracker, and so on. Fut also has a menstrual cycle tracking feature for the ladies. Additionally, it offers over 300 watch faces for added customisation and over 100 sports modes for fitness tracking.Powering this smartwatch is a 300 mAh lithium-polymer battery that offers up to 15 days of typical usage. You can fully charge the Zeblaze GTS 3 Plus in 1.5 hours with the magnetic charger that comes in the box. It comes with Bluetooth LE v5.2 and we can make and receive calls through it straight from the watch. This smartwatch also comes with a built-in voice assistant feature. It is compatible with devices running on Android 5.0 or iOS 12.0 or later. The companion app for this smartwatch is the FitCloudPro app.

title: Xiaomi Pad 5
short_description: Xiaomi Pad 5 is the company's first tablet in 3 years. Among the three tablets launched in this series so far, only the standard Xiaomi Pad 5 has made its way to the international market including Nepal—whereas the Xiaomi Pad 5 Pro and Pro 5G are still exclusive to China. This tablet brings a powerful processor, an elegant design, a nice display, and a quad-speaker array which means it is capable to handle your everyday chores while being binge-ready as well. Having said that, the Xiaomi Pad 5 doesn't support cellular connectivity so you're restricted to just WiFi connectivity here. The company also sells the official stylus and keyboard accessory for this tablet but as of now, neither of them is available in Nepal.
description:
Xiaomi Pad 5 Overview:

Design

Xiaomi Pad 5 has a glass-plastic hybrid build quality with aluminum frames. Its plastic back has been topped off with a matte finish that has a great hands-on feel. The tablet is pretty thin at just 6.85mm, while it is pretty heavy weighing a whopping 511 grams. The Pad 5 is available in two color options: Pearl White and Cosmic Gray.

Display

Upfront, you're looking at a large 11" IPS LCD panel with a sharp 2.5K WQHD resolution. It also enjoys a smooth 120Hz refresh rate alongside a 240Hz touch sampling rate. Besides this, Xiaomi Pad 5's screen has a 10-bit color depth and it is also HDR10 and Dolby Vision certified for HDR playback on streaming platforms like Netflix and Amazon Prime Video.This display is encased inside minimal bezels on all four sides. But Xiaomi has made sure that the bezels are adequately thick enough to prevent any accidental touches when you're holding the tablet. Moreover, since it bears a 16:10 aspect ratio, the Xiaomi Pad 5's screen doesn't suffer from letterboxes when you're watching videos as much as you would on the 9th Gen iPad.

Performance

On the performance front, Xiaomi has used Qualcomm's Snapdragon 860 chip here. It has been complemented with 6GB of LPDDR4X RAM and either 128 or 256GB of UFS 3.1 storage. Unfortunately, this tablet doesn't support expandable storage. As far as software goes, it runs on a special fork of MIUI 12.5 called "MIUI for Pad" with a handful of tablet-specific features.

Audio

In terms of audio, the Xiaomi Pad 5 has a quad-speaker system with Dolby Atmos tuning. It is also Hi-Res and Hi-Res Wireless certified for a premium audio experience. However, Xiaomi hasn't installed a 3.5mm headphone jack on this tablet.

Battery

Fueling the Xiaomi Pad 5 is a sizeable 8720mAh battery. The company claims 16+ hours of video playback and over 10 hours of gaming here, but under normal usage, you can expect somewhere between 8 – 10 hours of screen-on time. It supports 33W fast charging, while Xiaomi provides a compatible power brick inside the box itself.

Others

Finally, the Xiaomi Pad 5 has two cameras in total—one on the front and one at the back. The rear camera uses a 13MP sensor capable of shooting up to 4K 30 fps videos, whereas the 8MP front camera maxes out at 1080p 30 fps recordings. Moving on, this tablet doesn't have cellular connectivity or a built-in navigation (GPS) system.In the international market, Xiaomi Pad 5's official stylus and keyboard accessory are also available, although they haven't made it to Nepal just yet. Security-wise, there's no fingerprint reader here—physical or optical. Overall, considering everything you're getting for the price, the Xiaomi Pad 5 boasts an unbeatable value in the Nepali market.

title: Acer Predator Helios 18 2024 (14th Gen i9-14900HX, RTX 4090, 32GB, 2TB, 18" WQXGA 250Hz)
short_description: The Predator Helios 16 2023 is a gaming machine from Acer for 2023. It boasts a 18-inch LED-backlit LCD panel with a 250Hz refresh rate. Fueling the laptop is a 90Wh battery with 300W of fast charging support. This specific model gets the horsepower of a 14th Gen Intel Core i9-14900HX CPU under the hood. For those gaming actions, Acer has paired the CPU with an NVidIA RTX 4090 GPU with 16GB GDDR6 VRAM. Furthermore, you get 32GB of DDR5 RAM and 2TB NVMe PCIe Gen 4.0 SSD on board.
description:
In this short overview, lets get into the specs, features, prices, and availability of the Acer Predator Helios 18 (2024) with 13th Gen Intel Core i9-14900HX and RTX 4090.

Acer Predator Helios 18 (2024) Overview

Design and Display 

Being an 18-inch gaming machine, the Predator Helios is a chunker weighing over 3 kilos and occupying quite a footprint. It features a multi-color Predator logo on the lid followed by similar RGB strips on the bottom. You got your two Thunderbolt 4s at the back, alongside an HDMI, and a power jack. The rest of the Type-A, SD card slot, and ethernet options are divided across the sides.The screen on the Predator Helios 18 is especially impressive given that you can go with a mini-LED panel running at a whopping 250Hz with up to 1000 nits of brightness all across. The WQXGA resolution sports a 16:10 ratio and the screen is creative-ready with its accurate 100% DCI-P3 colors.

Performance and Memory 

Under the hood, the Acer Predator Helios 18 (2024) from Acer ships witht the 14th gen Core i9 14900HX Raptor Lake refresh CPU with 24 Cores, 32 Threads, and a boost clock of 5.8GHz paired with the RTX 4090 (16GB) from NVidIA drawing up to 175W of power. Complementing that, you get plenty of RAM (64GB DDR5)  and storage (2TB NVME Gen 4)  for your games and other files. With such a powerful combo, the Helios 18 is sure to provide desktop-grade performance with the added benefit of being mobile. Besides gaming at ridiculously high frame rates, it’s plenty capable of editing at 4k, rendering animations, or dabbling in 3d modeling.Things are kept under wraps by a combination of 5th Gen AeroBlade fans and liquid metal on the GPU and GPU that help keep the temperatures in check.

Connectivity and Extras

Moving on to the rest of the stuff, you get WiFi 7 support, AI-based noise reduction, tons of RGB customization, and a large 90 Wh battery. The laptop ships with a 330W brick to provide sufficient juice to the system and the maximum quoted runtime is 5.5 hours on the company’s website.The colorful keyboard is an eyecatcher with its individual-lit keys and ‘MAGSPEED’ WASD accents. Acer claims that their patented Magclick tech uses a mechanical switch with short key travel for satisfying mechanical feedback as well as shorter actuation for faster clicks.

title: MSI Cyborg 15 2023 (13th Gen i5-13420H, RTX 3050, 16GB, 512GB, 15.6" FHD)
short_description: MSI Cyborg 15 2023 (A13VE) is a sci-fi cyberpunk-inspired gaming laptop with some translucent parts. It comes in a Translucent Black chassis coupled with a blue backlit keyboard spewing the cyberpunk vibe. Under the hood, it comes with the Intel Core i5-13420H and NVidIA GeForce RTX 3050 combo. Additionally, it also packs an 16GB GDDR5-4800 RAM and 512GB NVMe PCIe Gen 4 SSD. Other than that, it comes with a 3-cell 53.5 Wh battery and 120W AC adapter for the power.
description:
The MSI Cyborg 15 (A13VE) is the Taiwanese companys offering for the year 2023. It is a gaming laptop available in multiple configurations. Here, we will discuss a particular MSI Cyborg 15 (2023) with 13th Gen Intel Core i5-13420H and NVidIA RTX 3050 discrete GPU.

MSI Cyborg 15 2023 (A13VE) Overview

Design and Display

The MSI Cyborg 15 2023 is heavily inspired by sci-fi cyberpunk style. Given that, the inspiration spills on the design of this laptop. Certain parts on the keyboard and chassis of the laptops are translucent allowing for a view of internal. Moreover, the exhaust on the bottom of the laptop is arranged such that it reads “MSI TRUE GAMING”.A 15.6-inch display with narrow bezels on the side sits on the front of the MSI Cyborg 15 2023. It has a sizable chin with the company name branded on it. The screen itself is an IPS panel capable of a 144Hz refresh rate. Furthermore, it boasts an FHD resolution spanning 1,920 x 1,080 pixels. Moving back to the laptop, it comes in a Translucent Black finish with a single blue backlit keyboard.

Performance

The MSI Cyborg 15 2023 delivers its performance through 13th Gen Intel Core i5-13420H coupled with the NVidIA RTX 3050. The CPU is an octa-core silicone with four performance and efficiency cores each. It is also capable of clocking in a maximum of 4.6 GHz. Meanwhile, the discrete GPU comes with 6GB GDDR6 memory and peaks at 1,605 MHz.This laptop ships with 16GB DDR5-4800 RAM as its memory. In the meantime, it comes with 512GB NVMe PCIe Gen 4.0 SSD for the storage. You can up the memory on your MSI Cyborg 15 2023 up to 64GB with dual-channel compatibility. Contrarily, you cannot upgrade the storage and will have to swap out the SSD entirely. On the software end, it comes with Windows Home 11.

Battery and the rest

In the tank, the MSI Cyborg 15 2023 comes with a 3-cell 53.5 Wh battery and comes with 120W power adopter in the box. Other than that, it offers wireless connectivity with WiFi 6 and Bluetooth v5.2 combination. The port selection is decent as well with one audio jack, one USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-C, two USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A, and one HDMI 2.1.

title: Kick AeroWatch Sigma
short_description: The Kick AeroWatch Sigma features a squircle metal frame with a functional side button and an IP67 rating, available in Cool Grey and Dashing Black. It has a 2.01-inch “Fluid HD” display with an 800-nit peak brightness, likely using an LCD panel. The smartwatch includes over 100 sports modes, heart rate and SpO2 monitoring, and tracks steps and calories, accessible through the DaFit app. It supports calls via Bluetooth version 5.4, displays notifications, allows SMS responses, and offers a 10-day battery life with Spark Charge Technology, though specific battery details are not provided.
description:
Are you looking for an affordable smartwatch that gets all the basics right? Then you might want to take a look at the AeroWatch Sigma from Nepali OEM brand Kick Lifestyle.

Kick AeroWatch Sigma Overview

Design and Display

The new Kick AeroWatch Sigma sports a modern squircle shape with a functional button on its right side, contributing to both style and practicality. Its metal frame, along with an IP67 rating, offers durability against dust and water, enhancing the watch’s resilience for daily wear. Moreover, it is available in two sleek colours: Cool Grey and Dashing Black, catering to different style preferences.The front features a generous 2.01-inch “Fluid HD” display. While the brand does not specify the exact panel type, taking the brands hesitance to say it out loud it is likely an LCD screen. With a peak brightness of 800 nits, the display remains vibrant and readable in various lighting conditions.

Features and Battery

The Kick AeroWatch Sigma comes with all the essential features one would expect from a modern smartwatch. It boasts over 100 sports modes, which would be valuable for any fitness enthusiast. In addition, it includes health-tracking functions such as heart rate and blood oxygen monitoring, as well as step and calorie tracking. You can easily access all the fitness data via the DaFit app, enhancing user convenience.For added functionality, Kick AeroWatch Sigma allows you to receive and make calls. It is made possible by Bluetooth v5.4 which establishes a stable connection with your smartphone. Furthermore, it works with iPhones as well as Android phones, and its companion app is available on both platforms too. Notifications for apps are displayed, and users can quickly respond to SMS, enhancing the watch’s utility as a communication tool.In terms of battery life, the Kick AeroWatch Sigma typically lasts up to 10 days, supported by Spark Charge Technology for faster charging. However, the brand does not disclose the specifics on battery capacity or charging speed.

title: Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (14th Gen Intel Core i7-14700HX, RTX 4060, 16GB, 1TB, 16" WQXGA 240Hz)
short_description: The Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (16IRX9) is a gaming laptop that comes with a solid set of hardware. This includes a combination of a 14th Gen Intel Core i7-14700HX processor and an NVidIA GeForce RTX 4060 discrete graphics card. In addition to that, you also get 16GB RAM and 1TB SSD on this thing. It can be upgraded further to exactly double the memory and storage capacity. On the front, it dons a 16-inch IPS LCD panel that stretches WQXGA in resolution and offers a 240Hz refresh rate and 100% DCI-P3 colour gamut. Along with all this impressive hardware, you get a 80Wh battery with 300W AC adapter to keep things up and running.
description:
Are you looking for a powerful laptop that can sort all your computing needs for years to come? Then you might want to take a look at this Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (16IRX9) with Intel i7-14700HX processor and RTX 4060 graphics card.

Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (16IRX9) Overview

Design and Display 

Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (16IRX9) has the build of a gaming machine. It has an aluminium top and PC-ABS bottom. This thing weighs a hefty two and a half kilos. As for the ports, you get plenty — four USB-A one of which supports Always On, two USB-C, an HDMI port, one ethernet, one combo audio jack, and a power-in socket.The Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (16IRX9) comes with a wide 16-inch display of WQXGA (2560 x 1600) resolution with a high 240Hz refresh rate. It is an IPS panel with a 16:10 aspect ratio, 500 nits peak brightness, and 100% DCI-P3 colour gamut. The keyboard is a custom 4-Zone RGB backlight, whereas the whole thing ships in Onyx Grey colour.

Performance and the rest

Other than that, the Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (16IRX9) ensures smooth performance with the combination of 14th Gen Intel Core i7-14700HX processor and NVidIA RTX 4060. The processor has 20 (8 performance + 12 efficiency) cores, 28 threads, and 33MB of L3 cache. It can also go up to 5.5 GHz of max clock speed. As for the GPU, NVidIAs RTX 4060, with a maximum TGP of 140W, can handle graphic-intensive workloads easily.  In addition, Lenovo has also included an LA1 AI chip to improve FPS in games.In addition to the solid CPU and GPU combo, the Lenovo Legion Pro 5 2024 (16IRX9) ships with dual-channel memory. This particular model comes with 16GB DDR5-5,600 RAM, which can be further upgraded to 32GB. Furthermore, there are 2 M.2 2280 slots, one of which is preoccupied with a 1TB NVMe PCIe Gen 4 SSD. For power, it packs an integrated 80Wh battery that supports Super Rapid Charge Pro. This technology can juice the laptop to 40% in just 10 minutes via the 300W adapter that ships in the box.

title: Apple MacBook Pro 16-inch (M2 Pro/Max)

This is a Liquid Retina XRD display with a brightness of up to 1600 nits and a close to 16:10 aspect ratio, giving you more space to work with files or watch movies. While this is the same as the 2021 model (MacBook Pro 16 2021), Apple has upgraded the chip to M2 Pro and M2 Max this time around. Both are based on the second-generation 5nm node and provide incredible performance while also delivering industry-leading power efficiency. In fact, it has the highest-rated battery backup for a MacBook Pro, with 22 hours of video playback. It charges via a 140W USB-C power adapter. The MacBook Pro (16\" 2023) can be configured with up to 96GB of unified memory and up to 8TB of storage, though availability for specific memory and storage configurations may vary by region.

title: Redmi Pad SE 8.7
short_description: The Redmi Pad SE 8.7 4G features a compact design with an 8.7-inch HD+ LCD display, 90Hz refresh rate, and TÜV Rheinland certification for eye protection. It’s powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 processor, paired with 6GB RAM and 128GB expandable storage. The tablet runs on Xiaomi’s HyperOS (Android 14) and packs a 6,650mAh battery with 18W fast charging support, although only a 10W charger is included. It comes with an 8MP rear camera, 5MP front camera, dual SIM support for 4G connectivity, WiFi 5, and Bluetooth 5.3.
description:
Redmi Pad SE 8.7 4G Overview

Design and Display

The Redmi Pad SE 8.7 4G comes in a flat design with its edges and frames having no curves. Apart from a circular camera island on the top edge of the back panel, nothing much is going on here design-wise. It is a standard-looking tablet for the most part, however, it is rather smaller considering how enormous tablets can be. Hence, it is quite portable and should be easy to hold with a single hand when consuming content. Furthermore, it ships in Graphite Grey, Aurora Green, and Sky Blue colors.Despite its smaller size, it packs a decent-sized display measuring 8.7 inches. It is an LCD panel with HD+ resolution, up to 90Hz refresh rate, and a peak brightness of 600 nits. Additionally, it comes with TÜV Rheinland low blue light (software-based) and flicker-free certification.

Performance

Under the hood, the Redmi Pad SE 8.7 4G packs the MediaTek Helio G85 processor with 12nm fabbing and a peak clock speed of 2.0GHz. Though it is available in multiple configurations in the international market, we Nepali folks only get a single option. Here, the tablet comes with 6GB LPDDR4X RAM and 128GB eMMC 5.1 storage, which actually is the highest trim available. There is also a dedicated slot for storage expansion with a microSD card of up to 2TB capacity.In the tank, it has a 6,650 mAh battery with 18W charging support. However, you only get a 10W charger bundled with the box. On the software front, this thing boots on the Xiaomi HyperOS based on Android U (Android 14).

Camera and Connectivity

In terms of optics, it comes equipped with two pieces. The rear camera is an 8MP unit, and the front is a slightly lower 5MP one. The Redmi Pad SE 8.7 4G comes with fully functioning cellular connectivity. You can pop in two SIMs and use it for calls, messaging, and 4G internet. Besides that, it also supports dual-band WiFi 5 and Bluetooth v5.3.

title: Redmi 13C
short_description: Redmi 13C is an affordable offering from the Chinese tech giant Xiaomi. It comes with the MediaTek Helio G85 under the hood. It comes in multiple configurations with up to 8GB RAM, and 256GB storage. Similarly, it dons a 6.74-inch 90Hz display on the front with the Corning Gorilla Glass protection. It comes with a triple camera setup on the back with a 50MP primary sensor. Meanwhile, on the front, there is an 8MP shooter. Powering everything is a 5,000 mAh cell with 18W PD charging capability.
description:
Xiaomi has been well know to offer specs-heavy smartphones in an affordable price bracket. Similar is the case for the sub-brand Redmi. As such, Redmi 13C is the company's budget offering for the year 2024.

Redmi 13C Overview

Design and Display

The Redmi 13C has a similar design to its more capable Redmi Note 13 siblings. This phone has a dual-tone design with a darker shade pretending to be a squircle camera island. Furthermore, it has a flat design and a matte finish and comes with two camera cutouts on the back. This phone is only 8.09mm thick and weighs about 192 grams.On the front, we are getting a 6.74-inch screen with the Redmi 13C. It boasts a resolution of 720 x 1,600 pixels, a peak brightness of 600 nits, and a pixel density of 260 ppi. Meanwhile, it has a refresh rate of 90Hz and supports DC dimming. Most interestingly, this phone boasts a Corning Gorilla Glass protection on the screen. However, a point to be noted is that the company has not mentioned the panel type in their promotional material.

Performance

Under the hood, it comes with the MediaTek Helio G85 chipset. It is an octa-core processor with a peak clock speed of up to 2.0 GHz. The Redmi 13C comes in two configurations i.e. 6GB + 128GB, and 8GB + 256GB. The 4GB + 128GB trim will not be available here in Nepal. It also supports up to 8GB of virtual memory expansion while also offering storage expansion of up to 1TB via MicroSD card. Lastly, it comes with MIUI 14 out of the box. Its eligibility to receive the HyperOS update is not yet known.

Camera and the rest

In terms of optics, the Redmi 13C boasts a triple-camera setup on the back. The primary camera is a 50MP lens coupled with a 2MP macro camera and an auxiliary lens of unspecified resolution and purpose. Meanwhile, we are getting an 8MP shooter for selfies and the AI face recognition feature on the front.Powering the phone is a 5,000 mAh battery that accepts 18W PD charging. Furthermore, it is a dual-SIM 4G LTE phone that also comes with dual-band WiFi and Bluetooth v5.3 support. In terms of the wired connection, it comes with USB Type-C and a 3.5mm headphone jack.Check out more Redmi smartphones, HERE!

title: iPad Pro 12.9 (2021)
short_description: Apple iPad Pro 12.9 (2021) has a huge 12.9-inch display that supports ProMotion 120Hz refresh rate. It is powered by an Apple M1 chip and has a fairly big 40.88Wh battery. Furthermore, the tablet features a boxy form with flat frames, making it look quite modern. Apple also ships a stylus and a magic keyboard for a greater degree of productivity. However, they need to be purchased separately. Similarly, the tablet supports the most recent WiFi 6 network standard, which brings better throughput speeds and less bandwidth congestion.
description:
iPad Pro 12.9 (2021) Overview, Price:

Here, we will discuss the full specifications and price of the iPad Pro 12.9 (2021).

Design

This iPad, like the iPad Pro 11-inch, has a flat aluminum body. It measures only 6.4mm thick and weighs between 682 and 685 grams—depending on whether it is WiFi or cellular. As a result, the tablet is fairly hefty to carry in one's hands. Moreover, volume rockers are located on the side frame, while the power button is located on top. This, however, is not a Touchid-enabled home button.

Display

As the name suggests, you are greeted by a 12.9-inch screen. This is a mini-LED backlit display with more contrast and brightness than a normal LED-backlit screen. It is achieved by spreading over 2500 local dimming zones among the panel's 10,000+ mini-LEDs.Anyways, the display boasts a 2732 x 2048 pixel resolution with support for a wide color gamut, and TrueTone. It's also a ProMotion compliant panel, so the refresh rate can vary from 10-120Hz depending on the content on the screen. Likewise, the brightness here can go as high as 1600 nits.

Performance

Inside the chassis, it is powered by an Apple M1 chip. It's an octa-core processor with 4 performance cores and 4 efficiency cores. Likewise, the graphics are handled by an 8-core GPU.  Memory options include up to 16GB of RAM and up to 2TB of storage.

Audio

Over on the audio front, it has a quad-speaker setup that supports Dolby Audio. For calls, video/audio recording, it includes a total of five "studio-quality" mics set around the frames of the iPad and one on the camera module.

Battery

The tablet is powered by a 40.8Wh battery that supports 20W fast charging through a USB Type-C port. It's also a Thunderbolt 3 interface that can support multiple peripherals directly to your iPad.

Others

Moving on, it has the same camera arrangement as the iPad Pro 11-inch. This means, there's a triple camera setup on the rear led by a 12MP primary lens. Accompanying this is a 10MP ultra-wide lens with a 125° field of view, and a LiDAR sensor. For selfies, the iPad Pro 12.9-inch has a 12MP ultrawide camera with support for center stage. Similarly, the connectivity option includes WiFi 6, Bluetooth 5.0, 5G, and a USB Type-C port.

seo_description_facebook: iPad Pro 12.9 (2021) price, full specifications, and more. Find out the complete specs, price of the iPad Pro 12.9 (2021) tablet here.

title: iPad Air 13 (2024)
short_description: The 2024 Apple iPad Air 11-inch, powered by the M2 chip, is perfect for students and everyday users seeking a versatile and powerful tablet. It features a vibrant 11-inch Liquid Retina display with True Tone and a wide P3 color gamut, ensuring stunning visuals. The M2 chip provides smooth performance for multitasking, and the dual 12MP cameras support high-quality photos and 4K video. With options for 5G and WiFi 6E connectivity, plus compatibility with Apple Pencil Pro and Magic Keyboard, the iPad Air 11-inch (2024) is ideal for productivity and creativity on the go.
description:
Here is a quick overview of the latest Apple iPad Air 13 (2024) with M2 chip.

Apple iPad Air (2024) Overview

Design and Display

The overall design of the latest iPad Air remains unchanged from its predecessors. As such, it has the same monotone finish and comes with a single camera on the back. It ships in four color options: Blue, Purple, Starlight, and Space Grey. While the Apple iPad Air (2024) looks the same for the most part, it is available in two screen sizes for the first time.The screen sizes it is available on are 11 and 13 inches. The Apple iPad Air was available in the former size previously, however, we are getting the larger 13 inches as well for 2024. Either way, it is a Liquid Retina display (IPS LCD) with True Tone and antireflective coating. Additionally, the screen covers a wide P3 color gamut. In the meantime, the smaller of the two options peaks at 500 nits of brightness while the larger can push an extra 100 nits of brightness.

Performance

The 2024 version of the Apple iPad Air once again packs an M-series chip for its performance. The American company shipped the iPad Air (2022) with M1 chips. Similarly, the latest variant is getting upgraded with the M2 chip which is built on a second-gen 5nm nodeFurthermore, the chip has eight CPU and 10 GPU cores respectively. Other than that, this tablet comes with 8GB RAM and 128GB storage while booting on iPadOS 17.4

Camera and the rest

In terms of optics, the Apple iPad Air (2024) comes with two cameras altogether, both of which are 12-megapixel each. The front camera here is an ultrawide unit aligned horizontally with support for the “Center Stage” feature. Meanwhile, the rear shooter is a wide camera with 4K video recording capabilities.Likewise, the latest iPad comes with superfast connectivity options. To be more specific, you can choose to have 5G cellular support on this table all while having WiFi 6E connectivity. In addition to that, the iPad Air (2024) can be used with Apple Pencil Pro and Magic Keyboard as well.

Furthermore, the popular video-editing software DaVinci Resolve is now available for iPads, allowing you to edit videos on the go. Software-wise, it ships with iPad OS 16 (upgradable), which enables you to utilize the 2nd Gen Apple Pencil to its full potential. The tablet can now detect the Pencil up to 12mm above the display, allowing users to see a preview of their stroke before using it. On the front, there's a huge 12.9-inch display with a ProMotion 120Hz refresh rate. Similarly, a 40.8 Whr battery powers everything and it charges via a USB-C port. Likewise, the tablet supports the most recent WiFi 6E network standard, which provides faster throughput and less bandwidth congestion.

title: Realme 11x 5G
short_description: Realme 11x 5G arrives with MediaTek's Dimensity 6100+ 5G chipset with 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage. Its 6.72-inch IPS LCD display has a smooth 120Hz refresh rate and up to 240Hz touch sampling rate. The phone runs on Android 13-based Realme UI 4.0 and features a 64MP plus 2MP depth camera setup. Powering it is a 5000mAh battery that supports 33W SuperVOOC fast charging. And Realme offers a compatible charger inside the phone's box itself.
description:
The Realme 11x 5G is a slightly toned-down version of the Realme 11 5G. The latest offering from the company is the Realme 11 5G, a mid-range phone that supports 5G connectivity and boasts a 120Hz display, a 108MP dual camera setup, and a 5000mAh battery.

Realme 11x 5G Overview:

Design and Display

The Realme 11x 5G looks quite identical to the Realme 11 and follows the sleek design and a punch-hole cutout on the front. On the display side, you get a 6.72-inch IPS LCD screen with a resolution of 2400 x 1080 pixels and a refresh rate of 120Hz. The panel also supports a peak brightness of 680 nits and support.

Performance

The phone is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset. This octa-core SoC features two Cortex-A76 cores clocked at 2.4GHz and six Cortex-A55 cores clocked at 2.0GHz. It is accompanied by a Mali-G57 MC2 GPU and an integrated 5G modem. Memory-wise, it comes with 8GB of RAM and 128/256GB of UFS 2.2 storage.

Camera

The Realme 11x 5G has a dual-camera setup on the back. This guy goes with a 64MP main camera instead of a 108MP of the Realme 11. While the secondary unit is the same 2MP depth-sensing camera.  For selfies and video calls, there is an 8 front-facing camera that can also record 1080p videos at 30fps.

Battery and Others

Fueling the phone is a 5000mAh battery that supports 33W fast charging via a USB-C port. Other features of the phone include a side-mounted fingerprint scanner, a dual-SIM slot, a headphone jack, and dual stereo speakers. The phone runs on Android 13 with Realme UI 4.0 on top.
