title: Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2022 (Ryzen 7 6800H, RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB, 16" WQXGA 165Hz)
short_description: Legion 5 Pro is the best gaming laptop that Lenovo has to offer. The 2022 iteration of the laptop brings an all-aluminum design, Ryzen 6000-series CPUs, and RTX 30-series GPUs. The CPU-GPU combo is paired with Lenovo's in-house cooling solution and AI Engine to maximize fps in games.
description:
Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2022: Overview 

Here's a brief description of the design aesthetic, chipset, and battery life of the Lenovo Legion 5 Pro 2022 with Ryzen 7 & RTX 3060.

Build and Display 

Lenovo Legion 5 Pro(2022) has the build of a gaming machine. It has an all-aluminum build and weighs a hefty 2.5 kilos. The wide 16" display of WQXGA (2560x1080) resolution has a high 165Hz refresh rate. It has a tall 16:10 aspect ratio as well. The keyboard(with number pad) has a custom 4 Zone RGB backlight, whereas the keycaps are black in color.

Performance and Memory

This laptop is powered by AMD's Ryzen 6000-series processor. The Ryzen7-6800H chip has 8 cores and 16 threads. It has 16MB of L3 cache. It can also go up to 4.5 GHz of max clock speed. As for the GPU, NVidIA's RTX 3060 can handle graphic-intensive workloads without much difficulty. It has Lenovo's Coldfront 4.0 technology to cool this CPU/GPU combo.Lenovo Legion 5 pro 2022 ships with 16GB of fast DDR5 RAM, which can be upgraded to 32GB.There are 2 M.2 2280 slots for secondary memory, one of which is preoccupied.

Battery and Connectivity 

Legion 5 Pro (2022) packs a 4-cell 80Wh battery that lasted about 6 hours(hybrid mode) on MobileMark 2018 test. It supports Super Rapid Charge, which can charge the cells up to 80% in 30 minutes via the 135W adapter that ships in the box.As for the ports, you get a lot. A USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C (with DisplayPort1.4) on the left, a USB-A 3.2 Gen 1, a headphone port, and an E-Shutter button on the right. Similarly, there are two USB-A 3.2 Gen 1 (1 always-on), one USB-A 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C (with DisplayPort 1.4, Power supply), one HDMI 2.1, one RJ45, and a power-in socket on the back.

title: Redmi Note 11 Pro 5G
short_description: Redmi Note 11 Pro 5G is the successor of last year's successful Redmi Note Pro. The Redmi Note 11 Pro 5G sports the Snapdragon 695 whereas its 4G counterpart is based on Helio 696.
description:
Redmi Note 11 Pro 5G Overview, Price:

Design, Display

The Redmi Note 11 Pro 5G features a flat edge design, and it is 8.12mm thick and weighs 202 grams, the same as Redmi Note 11 Pro 4G. The phone is available in three color options: Polar White, Atlantic Blue, and Graphite Gray. As for the build quality, the back and front are glass, while the sides are aluminum.Its front features a 6.67-inch Full HD+ Super AMOLED display, which supports a variable 120 Hz refresh rate and 360Hz touch sampling rate. The screen can achieve a peak brightness of 1200 nits.

Performance

The phone is powered by the Snapdragon 695 5G chip based on a 6nm architecture. The handset houses Xiaomi's LiquidCool technology, which uses multiple graphite and copper foil layers to dissipate heat.Xiaomi offers up to 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 128GB of UFS 2.2 internal storage. Thus, customers can pick from 3 options: 6+64GB, 6+128GB or 8+128GB. The handset comes with MIUI 13 based on Android 11 out of the box.

Cameras, Others

Moving on, the Note 11 Pro 5G has a rear triple camera setup. The primary camera is a 108MP ISOCELL HM2 sensor, and the sensor combines 9 small pixels for a combined 2.1 m pixel. In addition, there is an 8MP f/2.2 ultra-wide camera and a 2MP f/2.4 macro sensor. There is a 16MP sensor on the front.Besides this, the IP53 rating makes it dust and splash-resistant. The 5000mAh on the Redmi Note 11 Pro 5G can charge from 0% to 100% in 42 minutes as it supports 67W fast charging.Check out the full specifications and price of the Redmi Note 11 Pro 5G below:

title: Wings Phantom 345
short_description: The Wings Phantom 345 is a transparent case with an LED display indicating battery charge and battery level. It features an in-ear fit with a silicone tip, has an IPX5 rating, and weighs 35 grams. The earbuds have a 13-mm high-fidelity driver and two mics for better noise control. They support AAC and SBC codecs and have a separate gaming mode.
description:
Wings Phantom 345 Overview:

Design

Wings Phantom 345 adopts a transparent case design, with the buds resting on the exterior. On the inside of the transparent design rests the LED display to indicate the percentage of the capsule's charge as well as the level of battery remaining in the left and right earbuds.Moving to the earbuds, they are an in-ear fit with a silicone covering at the tip. In addition, the Phantom 345 has an IPX5 rating. And the product overall weighs around 35 grams, which is pretty lightweight. In addition, there are two color options to choose from: Black and White.

Audio

On audio, you would have a 13-mm high-fidelity driver for every earpiece. Furthermore, the Phantom 345 ships with two mics on individual pieces. This means the buds have a better way to control outside noise during calls and such, paired with the "Smart" ENC.Further, the buds have both AAC and SBC codec support. There is even a separate gaming mode, reducing the latency to around 40 ms.

Rest of the specs

On the flip side, the earbuds alone last for around 10 hours of playback. The case further backs the buds for an additional 40 hours of life. This means, in total, the Wings Phantom 345 as a whole lasts 50 hours combined.The Phantom 345 even charges fully in 1.5 hours if all the charge is depleted. Similarly, only charging the buds takes nearly an hour. Furthermore, the Wings Phantom 345 uses Bluetooth 5.3 for connectivity and USB-C for cable.

description:
Promate XWatch-B18 Overview:

Design and Display

Indeed, the design of the Promate XWatch-B18 is notably close to a square shape. The straps offer two options: soft silicone ones and stylish fabric, ensuring a comfortable fit. Moreover, users can still choose from over 100 watch faces to personalize their experience. And the watch is available in classic colors: Black, Blue, and Graphite.

Hardware

When it comes to performance, the watch is powered by the RTL8762DK and BK3266 chipsets. Additionally, the Promate XWatch-B18 includes 192KB of built-in RAM and 64 MB of flash memory for everything. Features

Battery

title: Vivo Y27s
short_description: Vivo Y27s is a midrange offering in the company's Y-series of smartphones. The phone is powered by a 6nm 4G Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 mobile silicone. It boasts a 6.64\" FHD+ LCD screen with a 90Hz refresh rate. It comes in 8 GB + 256 GB memory and storage configuration. You can even double the memory virtually while also supporting 1TB of storage expansion via a MicroSD card. Camera-wise we have a 50MP + 2MP combo on the back whereas on the front we have a solo 8MP unit housed inside the waterdrop cutout. Powering the Vivo Y27s is a 5,000 Li-ion cell with 44W fast charging support.
description:
Vivo Y27s Overview

The Vivo Y27s is a midrange smartphone with a 90Hz screen, Snapdragon SoC, and 50MP dual camera among other things. Let's briefly discuss what else this smartphone has to offer.

Design and Display

The Vivo Y27s comes with a plastic back body while boasting IP54 water and dust resistance. It has a single rounded-rectangle camera island with two camera cutouts along with an LED flash on the back. It is available in two colour options: Burgundy Black, and Garden Green.
On the front, the Vivo Y27s sports a 2.5D curved display measuring 6.64 inches diagonally. It is an IPS LCD panel with a resolution of 1080 x 2388 pixels and a pixel density of 394 PPI. It also offers a refresh rate of 90Hz, peak brightness of 650 nits, and a 100% P3 colour gamut.

Performance

Under the hood, the Vivo Y27s is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 chipset. It is a 6nm octa-core processor that has a maximum clock speed of 2.4 GHz. Meanwhile, it comes with Qualcomm Adreno 610 GPU bundled together.
In terms of memory and storage, there is a combination of 8 GB LPDDR4x RAM and 256 GB UFS 2.2 storage. The Vivo Y27s offers an 8 GB virtual RAM extension as well as storage expansion of up to 1TB via a microSD card. Software-wise, it runs on Android 13 with Funtouch OS 13 on top.

Camera and the rest

Getting to the optics, the phone sports a dual 50MP + 2MP rear cameras with an LED flash. Meanwhile, on the front, we are getting an 8-megapixel selfie camera. Additionally, we can expect a plethora of camera magic that Vivo is known for with this phone as well.
Fuelling the smartphone is a 5,000mAh lithium-ion battery that supports 44W wired charging. In terms of wireless connectivity, we are getting Dual SIM Dual Standby, 4G LTE, Dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.0, and five-way navigation support. Moreover, it comes with USB 2.0 Type-C and a 3.5mm headphone jack for wired connections. Lastly, it also supports biometrics reading for additional security.
